loans.name: Lata

texts.en:
Lata is a 38-year-old living with her husband and two sons who are 15 and 10 years old. She is a woman with a lot of aspirations and has a desire to improve herself with an entrepreneurial vision. She is into manufacturing photo frames. Initially, her husband gave orders to photo frame manufactures and supplied the frames to different shops in his locality, but he was not able to achieve the target when there was high demand. This is when Lata came up with the idea of starting to manufacture photo frames. This way, she would be able to help her husband with the expenses as well as be financially independent. They earn around INR 500 per day. Now Lata has three to five women working for her. 

She has started taking orders from other suppliers so she needs to buy more materials to manufacture photo frames. For this reason, she is seeking a loan of INR 10,000.  The couple is trying to expand their business on a large scale so that they can generate employment for others and improve their own living standards. This will give Lata an opportunity to earn more and save for her children’s education and for her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy more materials to manufacture photo frames

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, pest control, etc., as well as improve the land.

loans.name: Virgen Del Carmen De Vizcochoni Group

texts.es:
La socia Estefa pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen del Carmen de Vizcochoni” en la comunidad de Vizcochoni. 
La comunidad de Vizcochoni está ubicado en el del distrito de Colquepata dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco, Perú.
La socia Estefa tiene 40 años de edad tiene 05 hijos y es conviviente, la socia es una persona responsable y amable que saca adelante a su familia, la socia se dedica a la agricultura y crianza de animales menores la socia cría a sus animales para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma segur apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de abono, semillas, alimento para sus animales entre otros.
Los socios  se dedican a la agricultura, a la venta de comida, a la venta de comestibles, al engorde de ganado, a la elaboración de artesanía, a la ganadería, a la crianza de animales menores y otros. 
Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
Estefa belongs to the “Virgen del Carmen de Vizcochoni” communal bank n the community of Vizcochoni. The community of Vizcochoni is located in the district of Colquepata in the province of Paucartambo of the department of Cuzco, Perú. Estefa is 40 years old, has 5 children, and is in a common law marriage. She is a responsible and kind person who is getting her family ahead. She works in agriculture and raising small animals to later sell to customers who ask for them. She wants to keep working so she can keep supporting her family. She is asking for the loan to buy fertilizer, seeds, and animals feed, among other things. 

The members work in agriculture, selling food, raising cattle, making handmade crafts, cattle ranching, raising small animals, and more. The members in general are thankful for the opportunity offered and they are committed to making their payments according to the set schedules.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, and animal feed, among other things.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farming inputs.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
José tiene 25 años de edad, estado civil soltero vive con sus padres, Vive en el  Cantón Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.
La ventanilla se llama LA PAULINA se encuentra ubicada en la parroquia Puerto Pechiche recinto La Paulina, pertenece al cantón Pueblo Viejo esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.
José se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz desde hace algunos años y cría ganado. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y los vende en el mercado del mismo lugar.
El crédito solicito para la compra de lo necesario para la siembra y una bomba para fumigar. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir. Su sueño es comprarse un carro
Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
José is 25 years old. He is single and lives with his parents in the Canton of Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos.

The communal bank is called "La Paulina" and is located in the parish of Puerto Pechiche in the precinct of La Paulina. It is part of the Canton of Pueblo Viejo. This group is dedicated to farming and livestock activities.

José works in agriculture, and has been planting maize and rice for several years. He also raises livestock. He purchases his products in Ventanas and then sells them at the market in the same location.

José is requesting this loan in order to purchase what he needs for planting as well as a pump to fumigate his crops. The loan will help him to increase his earnings for his family's consumption and to invest.

His dream is to purchase a car. He likes to play sports.

loans.use: to purchase a pump for fumigation.

loans.name: María Lorena Del Transito

texts.es:
María de 47 años de edad,  estudio hasta segundo grado, está casada y su esposo es agricultor, tienen 7 hijos y 5 de ellos viven en su casa, dos trabajan en la agricultura y  3 estudian 4º, 8º y 2 año de bachillerato; con su pareja son las responsables de mantener la familia.

María se ha dedicado toda su vida a los oficios del hogar, además le ayuda a su esposo e hijos a la siembra de maíz y pipián, el terreno donde siembra el pipián le queda a 15 minutos y el de maíz a unos 40 minutos se van caminando con sus hijos y su esposo.

El crédito que solicita es para comprar fertilizantes, abono, veneno y pago de la mano de obra, ya que sembraron 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz  y 7,000 de frijol. 

El sueño en un futuro es que sus hijos sean profesionales y que sean independientes, y con el cultivo espera que las condiciones climáticas sean las adecuadas para el cultivo para obtener buena producción y generar buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
María is 47 years old. She went to school through the second grade. She is married and her husband is a farmer. They have 7 children and 5 of them live in her home. Two of them work in farming and 3 of them are in the 4th, 8th, and 2nd year of high school. With her spouse she is responsible for supporting the family. 

María has dedicated her whole life to keeping her home. She also helps her husband and the children plant the corn and the squash. The land where they plant the squash is 15 minutes away and where they plant the corn is 40 minutes away. She walks there with her husband and children.   

The loan she is asking for is to buy fertilizer, poison and to pay for labor costs, because they planted 14,000 square meters of corn and 7,000 of beans.   

Her dream for the future is for her children to graduate from college and to be independent. For the crops, she hopes to have the right weather conditions so she can have good yields and generate good earnings.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and poison and to pay for labor because they planted 14,000 square meters of corn and 7,000 of beans.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en: Lilian is a married woman. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the lack of capital. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to own a boutique within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will own a boutique. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Uma

texts.en:
Uma is 38 years old and hails from a village in Jharkhand. She is married and has three children, two sons and a daughter, all school going. Uma is a member of the local NGO “MESP”. 

Uma and her husband run a grocery shop. Uma has been working hard to manage the shop. Six years ago, her husband was suffering from a disease. He was unable to work and was hospitalized. Uma spent around 3-4 lakhs on his treatment. She had to struggle a lot but she stood strong with faith and confidence.
        
She now plans to expand her business for which she is requesting a loan of 10,000 INR as their current earnings aren't sufficient to run the family. The loan will be used to buy sugar, rice, millet, and other items for the shop. She hopes to generate greater profits and earn more. Uma dreams of having a bigger store.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, millet, and other items for her shop

loans.name: Felix Amada

texts.es: Doña Félix mujer trabajadora que lucha a diario para mantener sus ingresos con las ventas de cerdos en pie y las variedades que realiza del mismo, siendo viuda no tiene quien le apoye económicamente, doña Félix tiene ideas de superación como por ejemplo su objetivo a futuro es poner un comedor para vender comida por las noches y poner también un auto lavado con el apoyo de su hijo y que esto le permita aumentar sus ingresos, ella ha venido manteniendo el negocio gracias al apoyo de créditos el que solicita nuevamente en esta ocasión para comprar dos cerdos en pie y comercializarlo.
texts.en:
Félix is a hard-working woman who struggles daily to maintain an income through the sale of live pigs and their products. As she's a widow, she has no-one supporting her financially. 

Félix has ideas for improvement such as, for example, her future goal which is to set up a canteen to sell food in the evenings and also set up a car wash with the support of her son; this will allow her to increase her income. She has maintained the business thanks to the support of the loans which she is again asking for, this time to buy two live pigs for her business.

loans.use: to buy two live pigs

loans.name: Mathayo

texts.en:
Mathayo is a married man, and he has 4 children with ages ranging from 5 to 17 years. He describes himself to be optimistic.

He operates a food stall where he sells potatoes. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. He describes his biggest business challenge to be a lack of funds. He will use the loan to purchase additional stock.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock

loans.name: Denis

texts.en:
Denis is a married man, and he has 2 children. He describes himself to be focused.

He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are of all types. He also does a photography business. He describes his biggest business challenge to be a lack of capital.

He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy a digital camera for his photography business. His business goal is to own a tuk-tuk (a three-wheeled motorcycle taxi) within 5 years. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank, and his previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a digital camera for his photography business

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is a 37-year-old man. He has 3 children with ages ranging from 3 to 15 years. He describes himself to be focused.

He operates a retail business where he sells second-hand shoes. He has been involved in this business for 2 years. His primary customers are armed forces personnel. He will use the loan to purchase additional stock.

His business goal is to own a big shop within 5 years. Simon hopes that, in the future, he can use the profits from his business to pay his loan, boost his savings and increase his standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman, and she has 4 children. She describes herself to be focused.

She operates a retail business where she sells rice. She has been involved in this business for 20 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital.

She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of rice. Her business goal is to own a rice mill within 5 years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank, and her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farming supplies and to pay labourers to look after crops.

loans.name: José Nelson

texts.es:
José de 46 años de edad, estudio hasta 3º grado, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios del hogar, tienen 4 hijos y viven con ellos, 3 trabajan en la agricultura y el menor estudia 6º grado; nadie más vive con ellos

José desde su niñez se ha dedicado a la agricultura y aprendió ya que le ayudaba a su padre a sembrar maíz, frijol y ajonjolí; actualmente piensa sembrar 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz en un terreno donde hace de tiempo una hora en caballo desde su hogar.

El crédito que solicita es para comprar fertilizantes, abono, veneno y pago de la mano de obra, ya que sembraron 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz  y una de frijol.

El sueño es que la familia tenga una larga vida, y seguirle dando los estudios a sus hijos hasta donde pueda, y espera sacar buena cosecha para mantener a su familia.
texts.en:
José is 46 years old and completed up to third grade at school. José has a partner who looks after the home. The couple has four children: three work in farming while the youngest is in sixth grade. Nobody else lives with the family.

Since his childhood José has worked in farming, having learned the trade while helping his father to grow corn, beans and sesame. José is planning to grow corn on 7,000 square metres of land. To arrive at this land, José must travel one hour on horseback from his home.

José's dream is for his family to have a long life. He wants to continue offering his children an education, and hopes to have a good harvest in order to support his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilisers, manure, and poison, and to pay labourers, all to sow corn and beans on 14,000 square metres of land.

loans.name: Luz Elena

texts.es:
La señora luz vive en el municipio de Montería junto a sus padres y sus hijos.
Ella vio la oportunidad de montar un negocio frente al estadio deportivo del municipio y fue así como inicio con una salsamentaría en la que vende comidas, bebidas y licores.
Es un negocio pequeño pero con una calidad de servicio impecable gracias al buen trabajo de Luz y su padre, quien le ayuda en ocasiones en el negocio.
Ella desea aumentar su inventario y mejorar la variedad de productos que ofrece, por eso pide un apoyo económico para realizar la compra de surtido como licores para atraer más clientes y que siempre se sientan bien atendidos.
Este préstamo le permitirá a Luz continuar con su actividad y podrá seguir generando ingresos para el sostenimiento de sus hijos que están en proceso se crecimiento.
texts.en:
Luz lives in the Montería municipality with her children and parents.

She identified an opportunity to open a business opposite the local sports stadium and so now has a small grocery store where she sells food, drinks and liquors.

This is a small business but the service is excellent, thanks to Luz and her father's - who sometimes helps with the business - hard work.

Luz wants to increase stock and improve the variety of goods on offer. She is therefore applying for financial support in order to buy stock, such as liquors, to attract more customers and make sure that they feel well served.

This loan will allow Luz to continue with her work. She will be able to continue to earn an income in order to support her children who are growing up.

loans.use: to buy stock for her small grocery store.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es:
Alfredo de 34 años de edad, no estudio debido a que su papá falleció cuando él tenía 5 años y eran de escasos recursos económicos, además la escuela estaba bastante lejos y él tuvo que hacerse cargo de algunos compromisos a pesar de su corta edad. 

Está casado y tiene 2 hijos menores de edad y solo uno estudia. Su esposa tiene que levantarse muy temprano a hacer el atol que él sale a vender en la comunidad muy temprano, después hacen tamales o algún otro tipo de negocio. 

Alfredo saco al crédito en una comercial una motocicleta para el negocio y ya pago más de la mitad de lo que cuesta la moto y por eso decidió solicitar un préstamo en CREDICAMPO,  para cancelar el saldo pendiente de la motocicleta. 

Él espera seguir ampliando el negocio e involucrar a sus hijos, ya que  siente que está en mejores condiciones que antes de comenzar el negocio.
texts.en:
34-year-old Alfredo didn't go to school because his father died when Alfredo was five years old, and there were few economic resources. Additionally the school was very far, and he had to take charge of some obligations in spite of his young age.

He's married and has two young children, and only one goes to school. His wife has to get up very early to make the atol that he goes out to sell in the community very early. Later, they make tamales or some other type of business.

Alfredo bought a motorcycle on credit from a store for his business, and he already paid more than half of what the motorcycle costs, and for this he decided to ask for a loan from CREDICAMPO to pay the remaining balance of the motorcycle. 

He hopes to continue expanding his business and to include his children, considering that he feels that he's in a better place than before he started the business.

loans.use: to settle the remaining balance of his motorcycle

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Mamadou est un technicien de profession qui exerce depuis plus de 15 ans. Il possède un studio où il centralise ses activités qui consistent à installer des réseaux de chaines de télévision, des activités audiovisuelles dans la zone. C’est d’ailleurs dans ce cadre, qu’il sollicite ce crédit pour acheter le matériel nécessaire et les outils de travail permettant d’exécuter ses taches.
Il est marié et père de famille et grâce à son activité, il gère la dépense quotidienne et les autres charges de la maison.
Mamadou nourrit de grands projets qui nécessitent un financement consistant, il compte sur un partenaire financier qui pourra l’appuyer. Mamadou veut étendre son réseau audiovisuel et monter une radio communautaire dans cette localité.
texts.en:
Mamadou is a technician by profession and has been exercising this trade for more than 15 years. He has a studio where he centralises his activities which consist of installing television chalnnels and audiovisual activities in the area. It is incidentally in this context that he is requesting a loan to buy the necessary equipment and tools to carry out his jobs. 

He is married and a father, and thanks to his business he can cope with the daily outgoings and other household expenses. He has a lot of projects which need consistent funding and he is counting on a financial partner who can help him. Mamadou wants to extend his audiovisual network and set up a community radio in this town.

loans.use: to buy audivisual equipment for installing networks and cabling for TV channels.

loans.name: Alexis Rolando

texts.es: Rolando tiene 24 años de edad, el se dedica al comercio de papas desde hace 5 años atrás y también trabaja en una textileria, comenta Rolando que es su padre quien le ayuda en el negocio de papas, Rolando vive con sus padres y con sus 4 hermanos, el crédito va a invertir comprando mercadería en papas, Rolando desea mejorar su negocio y vender en grandes cantidades.
texts.en: 24-year-old Rolando has  worked selling potatoes for 5 years and is helped by his father. Rolando also works in a textile factory. He lives with his parents and his 4 siblings.  He will invest the loan in merchandise - potatoes. Rolando would like to expand his business and sell in bulk.

loans.use: to buy potatoes

loans.name: María Eufemia

texts.es:
María de 20 años de edad, estudio 8º grado, está casada, aun no tienen hijos. Tres personas más viven en casa con ella, personas particulares. Ella después de estudiar se iba con su mamá a vender ropa, es así como conoció el negocio de vender. 

Ahora ella quiere dedicarse pero con negocio propio, su esposo vive en EEUU pero ella quiere tener su propia fuente de ingreso. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar ropa y zapatos para salir a vender a las casas de su comunidad. Así invertirá su tiempo libre en algo que mejorara su calidad de vida. Ella planea en un futuro cuando sus hijos que aún no tiene, nazcan y crezcan quiere estar preparada para darles un buen estudio para que saquen una profesión.
texts.en:
María, 20, finished eighth grade.  She's married but doesn't have children yet.  Three other people live in her house with her, private individuals.

After school she used to go with her mother to sell clothing, which is how she learned the sales business.  Now she wants to work but with her own business.  Her husband lives in the United States, but she wants her own source of income.

The loan she's requesting from CrediCampo is to buy clothing and shoes to go out and sell door-to-door in her community.  That way she'll invest her free time in something that will improve her quality of life.

In the future, when the children she doesn't yet have are born and growing up, she plans to be ready to give them a good education so they have a good profession.

loans.use: to buy clothing and shoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand and gravel to cement over the floor of his home which currently is bare earth.

loans.name: Carlos Ivan

texts.es: Carlos es un joven trabajador de 28 , el vive solamente con su padre debido a que su madre ya es fallecida, Carlos los fines de semana se dedica al negocio de chanchos y los demás días de la semana se dedica a trabajar de albañil, Carlos se dedica 2 años al negocio de chanchos, comenta que compra en los alrededores y luego los saca a la feria de la ciudad de su residencia, lo que espera Carlos es mejorar su negocio y seguir trabajando duro para salir adelante.
texts.en: Carlos is a 28-year-old young man who only lives with his father as his mother died. At weekends, Carlos sells pigs and the rest of the week he works as a builder.  He has been selling pigs for 2 years and says that he buys them locally and then sells them at the fair in the city where he lives.  Carlos is keen to expand his business and continue working hard to make progress.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a cow or large steer.

loans.name: Maria Isnelida

texts.es:
Isnelida una mujer alegre y gozadora de la vida dedicada a la agricultura pues desde su nacimiento se crio en el campo y desarrollo sus habilidades empíricamente. 
Su mayor obstáculo ha sido sin duda el fallecimiento de su esposo pero a pesar de esto siguió con sus cultivos y luchando por sus 3 hijos que hoy en día son mayores de edad. 
Solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos como abonos y semillas para mejorar sus cultivos pues quiere sacar su cada adelante expandir sus terrenos y honrar el nombre de sus esposo con  grandes cultivos.
texts.en: Isnelida is a cheerful woman who enjoys life.  She has worked in farming since she was born, having grown up in the country and developed her skills by observing. Her main obstacle has undoubtedly been the death of her husband but, in spite of this, she continued growing her crops and struggling to support her 3 children, who are now grown up. She is seeking a loan to buy supplies such as manure and seeds in order to improve her crops because she wants to keep making progress, have more land and honour her husband's memory by growing large crops.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies

loans.name: José Humberto

texts.es:
José de 49 años de edad, solamente estudio 3º grado, está casado y tiene 3 hijos, 2 de ellos ya no dependen de él y uno estudia. Su esposa también trabaja con él, en el negocio, vendiendo panes y refrescos. 

José vende ropa y cuando se le presenta algún tipo de negocio trata de aprovecharlo. Trabaja con este tipo de negocio desde hace unos 7 años, decidió dedicarse a este negocio después que regreso de EEUU. Antes tenía una tienda. 

Él necesita el dinero para cancelar una deuda que tiene en otra institución, porque paga mucho interés y quiere que se le apoye ya que la intención de trabajar, comenta es para superarse y siente que está pagando demasiado. 

José solamente quiere que su hijo estudie y trate de cumplir sus sueños, él respeta la decisión de su hijo en lo que quiera estudiar o el tipo de negocio al que se quiere dedicar siempre y cuando sea para bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
José is 49 years old. He only studied until the 3rd grade. He is married and has 3 children, 2 of whom are no longer dependent upon him and one that studies. His wife also works with him in the business, selling bread and drinks.

José sells clothes and when he is presented with some type of business, he tries to take advantage of it. He has worked with this type of business for 7 years. He decided to do this business for a living after returning from the United Sates. Previously, he had a store.

He needs money to cancel a debt that he has with another institution because he is paying a lot in interest and wants to support it with work. He says that he wants to improve himself and feels that he is paying too much.

José only wants his son to study and try to achieve his dreams. He respects the decision of his son and what he wants to study or the type of business he wants to do for a living and where he spends for the well-being of the family.

loans.use: to cancel a debt he has with another institution.

loans.name: Truth Group

texts.en:
The name of this borrower's group is Truth. It is composed of two women living in the same neighborhood. They sell wigs, perming cream, provisions and soft drinks. 

The group's representative, Naomi, is 37 years old, married with 3 children, and works selling wigs and perming cream. She has been in this business for over six years. She helps her husband provide for everyday household needs thanks to the revenue from her business. Someday Naomi would like to open a big cosmetics shop and be able to serve the needs of her entire city. She and her other group member are requesting a loan to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy wigs and perming cream to sell to customers

loans.name: Sudama

texts.en:
Sudama is a 45-year-old widow and a mother of two sons. Sudama and her husband were well-settled people in their locality, but her husband’s death was a major loss. It was very hard for her to take. After his loss, it was hard for her to meet the basic needs of the family. She has been working as a paraprofessional educator for the last 10 years. She took responsibilities for her two sons and enrolled them in a private school. Along with her profession, she opened a cell phone store to earn additional income. Her elder son helps her in the shop in his free time. 

Sudama is ambitious and pursues every opportunity in life. She is requesting a loan to expand her shop. She will use the loan to buy more mobile phone accessories to improve her sales and income. In the future, she wants to install a Xerox machine in her shop, which will help her to earn more.

loans.use: to buy more mobile phone accessories

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en: Jimmy is a married man operating a produce business, a motorcycle transport business and farming, living in Kagadi, Uganda. He ventured into the above businesses to earn a living and hopes to grow his business despite the challenge of price fluctuations. Since he is hard working, he is asking for a loan to buy local brew (waragi) to sell.

loans.use: to buy local brew (waragi) to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs to attend to her coffee crops this season

loans.name: Nour Al Houda 3 Group

texts.en:
Fatima is the featured borrower of Nour Al Houda 3 group. She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, because they have always been neighbors and friends and they work hard to develop their families' livelihoods.

Fatima is a 45-year-old married mother of five who has been working in a mouneh (food preserving) business for five years. She is well known in her region with wide experience and special talents in her domain. Fatima supports her husband in their family's livelihood through covering most of their children's living expenses.

Her customers are increasing, but she still needs additional income to expand her work and reply to the increasing number of customers. Thus, for this reason, her acquired loan will be invested in increasing her business merchandise with special seasonal fruits and vegetables production to conserve for the coming seasons upon customers' requests.

She is the lady at the center of the picture, Huda is the first from the right, while Zeinab is the first from the left.

loans.use: to buy special seasonal fruits and vegetables to conserve

loans.name: Alba Marina

texts.es: Alba es una  madre soltera  muy trabajadora y activa, ella tiene una hija de 6 y un hijo de 9 años, que asisten a la escuela, Alba comenta que anteriormente trabajaba de  vendedora en un puesto de jugos y que hace 6 meses decidió ponerse un puesto propio de venta de jugos, gaseosas y comidas rápidas, comenta Alba que le va bien en este negocio ya que se encuentra ubicado en un estadio y un parque recreativo donde las personas salen a hacer deporte y a disfrutar en familia, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de frutas, confites, y productos para ofrecer en su puesto, Alba aspira readecuar su negocio para atraer más clientela y de estos ingresos dar la educación e sus hijos.
texts.en: Alba is a single mother. She is hardworking and active. She has a 6 year-old daughter and a 9 year-old son. They attend school. Alba says that previously she worked as a vendor in a toy stall and that 6 months ago she decided to open her own stall selling toys, sodas, and fast food. Alba says it is going well, and that she is located in a stadium and a recreational park where people go to play sports and enjoy family. The loan will be invested in the purchase of fruits, candy, and products to offer in her stall. Alba aspires to remodel her business to attract more customers and from this income give education to her children.

loans.use: to buy fruit.

loans.name: Rubuyu

texts.en:
Rubuyu, who deals in produce selling, is a hardworking married Ugandan man with 4 children aged between 16 and 6 who gets his additional income through farming to support his family. He plans to grow his business despite the challenges of poor transport limiting him to getting his stock on time.

Rubuyu intends to use the loan to buy more stock of maize for selling.

loans.use: to buy more stock of maize for selling

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be creative. She operates a retail business where she cooks food for sale. She has been involved in this business for eight years. Her business is located in a growing area. 

Catherine describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. She will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food for sale. Her business goal is to own a big shop within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a fast-growing business. This is her first loan with SMEP Micro-finance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ingredients

loans.name: Greda Group

texts.en:
This group is comprised of two hard-working members, and they are into the sale of liquid soap, slippers, hair and body creams, millet, sugar, beans, maize, cooking oil and charcoal. 

Mavis is the featured borrower. She is married, and she sells liquid soap and slippers. She has run this business for five years with the help of her husband. 

She is seeking a loan so that she can buy more liquid soap and slippers to sell to customers so that she can increase her income. 

Her colleague Josephine is 58 years old and sells millet, sugar, beans, maize, cooking oil and charcoal.

loans.use: To buy more liquid soap and slippers to sell to customers so that she can increase her income.

loans.name: Nowa

texts.en: Nowa is a 41-year-old man who operates a waragi (local brew) store along with farming and produce in Kagadi, Uganda. He is a hardworking married man who hopes to grow his business despite the challenges of price fluctuations. He is requesting a loan to buy more stock of alcohol for selling.

loans.use: to buy more stock of alcohol for selling

loans.name: Astghik

texts.en:
Astghik is a self-employed woman from Getap village in the Vayots Dzor region. She lives there with her father and brother.

She has been engaged in animal husbandry for two years. Jointly with her family members ,Astghik breeds cattle and hens. The family also owns an orchard where they grow apples, pears and peaches. Astghik's family now wants to expand its agribusiness by making some investments.

Astghik has applied for a loan of 3,000 USD to buy 1 cow, 2 oxen, and 5 piglets, and to purchase animal feed. As this is her first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products in the past because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to purchase livestock (1 cow, 2 oxen, 5 piglets) and animal feed

location.town: Getap village of Vayots Dzor region

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman and has 4 children. She describes herself to be focused.

She operates a tailoring business where she makes clothes for selling. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital.

She will use the 30,000 KES loan to buy two sewing machines. Her business goal is to own a tailoring school within 5 years. She hopes that, in the future, she will own a piece of land and build rental houses. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank, and her previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy two sewing machines

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of electronics

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is a married woman. She has seven children. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a retail business where she sells timber. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are of all types. 

Nelly describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. She will use the Kes 100,000 loan to buy more stock of timber. Her business goal is to own a pickup for transportation within five years. This is her seventh loan with SMEP Micro-finance bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to add more stock of timber.

loans.use: to buy more stock of timber

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas 2, 3 Y 4 Group

texts.en:
Paula is the coordinator of her group, Mujeres Unidas (United Women) 2, 3 & 4, a group composed of 15 micro-entrepreneurs (women and men), located in the lush, rugged Samana peninsula. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their five children.

Paula is excited to be taking her 20th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. This businesswoman sells different items in her business; one is selling sewing machines (used and for domestic uses) and the other selling coconut oil. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by purchasing sewing machines to sell and coconuts to extract their oil.

She said that her most difficult challenge has been to raise her children and educate them while she has been working to support her long-term partner. She will use the profits to reinvest and save for any needs in her family. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy sewing machines to sell and coconuts to extract their oil for resale

loans.name: Gulzhan

texts.ru: Гулжан 53 года, замужем, трое детей. У Гулжан высшее образование, с 1996 года в качестве дополнительного дохода занимается сельским хозяйством. У нее в хозяйстве есть 2 коровы, 10 овец и 4 лошади, также есть земельный надел размером 5,13 ГА земли, где она выращивает картофель, зерновые культуры и эспарцет, реализуя свою продукцию оптовым покупателям. Также Гулжан  продает молоко местным жителям. Гулжан известна, как принципиальный, честный, порядочный и надежный человек. На сегодняшний день деятельность Гулжан приносит ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 15,000 сом (KGS). Для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец с целью дальнейшей перепродажи. Доходы от кредита Гулжан планирует использовать для развития своего хозяйства и намерена купить жилье старшему сыну.
texts.en:
Gulzhan is 53 years old, married, and has three children.  She has a higher education, and since 1996 she has been farming to earn a supplemental income.  She has 2 cows, 10 sheep, 4 horses, and a 5.13 ha plot of land where she raises potatoes, grains, and sainfoin.  Gulzhan sells her harvests to wholesalers.  Besides this, she also sells dairy products to the residents of her village.  Currently, Gulzhan's farm brings in a monthly profit of 15,000 som (KGS).  Gulzhan is well known as a principled, honest, respectable, and reliable person.

In order to develop her business further, Gulzhan applied to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 20,000 som (KGS) to buy sheep, which she will later sell.  Gulzhan plans to use the profits from the loan to continue developing her business and to buy her eldest son a place to live.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Consuelo Estefania

texts.es: Estefanía como la mayoría de personas que viven en el campo se dedica a la ganadería, ella es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 2 y 4 años de los que el mayor asiste a la escuela, Estefanía juntamente con su esposo se dedica a la crianza de ganado y a la agricultura, ella va a invertir el crédito en la compra de una vaca para mejorar su negocio con el que aspira seguir trabajando para en algún momento comprar una casa y mejorar la calidad de vida.
texts.en: Estefanía like the majority of people who live in the countryside is in cattle raising for a living. She is married and has 2 children ages 2 and 4 years old, of which the eldest is attending school. Estefanía, together with her husband, raises cattle and is in agriculture for a living. She is going to invest the loan into the purchase of a cow to improve her business. With this she aspires to continue working until she can buy and house and to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and gravel to cement the floor and to buy laminate and wood to make the roof of her housing.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in a good area, and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. 

He will use the 20,000 Kenyan shillings loan to buy motorcycle spare parts. His business goal is to own two motorcycles within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP Micro Finance Bank.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia is 43 years old. She is married to Michael, and together they have been blessed with six children aged between 18 years and 8 years old.

Sophia sells chickens. She has done this business for the last 14 years, earning a monthly income of Kshs. 5,000. Sophia has requested her second loan of Kshs. 7,500 from VisionFund Kenya after successfully repaying her previous loan. She will use the loan amount to expand her business by buying more chickens for resale at a profit.

With the anticipated profits, Sophia will be able to pay school fees for her school-going children. Her hopes and dreams are to expand her business further as well as to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy chickens for resale

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 28 years old. She is married to Kennedy and together they have been blessed with three children 8, 5 and 1 year old. Kennedy is a businessman and hence provides additional income for the family.

Catherine runs a kiosk (small general store) where she sells foodstuffs and household items. She has done this business for the last four years, earning a monthly income of Kshs. 10,000.

Catherine has requested a loan of Kshs.20,000 which she will use to purchase goods like dried foodstuffs and household-use items for resale.This is her third loan with VisionFund Kenya, and she successfully repaid her previous loans.

Catherine will use the profits to sustain and support her family as well as initiating a new project.

loans.use: to purchase goods such as dried foodstuffs and household items for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more meat for selling

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is a married man. He has six children. He describes himself to be ambitious. He operates a tailoring business where he makes clothes for sale. He has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are individuals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be financial problems. 

Philip will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials and to service his sewing machine. He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials and to service his sewing machine

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane lives in Paruyr Sevak village with her husband and three children (two sons and one daughter). The family has been engaged in agricultural activities for more than 10 years. In particular, they breed livestock (cattle, sheep, pigs, bee colonies) and run a farm where they cultivate potatoes, watermelons and tomatoes. Gayane also owns an orchard and grows various types of fruits there. 

The family's agribusiness needs some investments to function more efficiently and become more profitable. Gayane has taken a loan from a financial institution before, but because of the family's poor conditions, she wasn't able to pay it back. However, over these years of tireless work, she was able to own her agribusiness, which is profitable enough to cover monthly payments. She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have bad credit history behind them and have no access to credit products. 

The requested loan will enable Gayane to purchase fertilizers and pay for two oxen and 10 sheep, and will also finance soil plowing activities.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizers and livestock (two oxen and 10 sheep) and finance the soil plowing process

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 37-year-old married man. He has three children with ages ranging from 6 years to 12 years. He describes himself to be steady and optimistic. He operates a tire business where he sells and services tires. He has been involved in this business for five years. His primary customers are commercial and private motorists. He describes his biggest business challenge to be finances. 

He will use the 20,000 Kenyan shillings loan to purchase additional stock of tires. His business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. He hopes that in the future, his business will help to improve the quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of tires

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
Rachael is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be generous. She operates a food stall where she cooks food for sale. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a good area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. 

Rachael will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy stock of ingredients for preparing food. Her business goal is to be successful within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be prosperous. She will use the anticipated profits to start another business.

loans.use: to buy stock of ingredients for preparing food

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is a married woman. She has six children. She describes herself to be goal-oriented. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes and shoes. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a good area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. 

Julia will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to be successful within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be prosperous. She will use the anticipated profits to venture into other businesses.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Weldon

texts.en:
Weldon is a married man who has one child. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a barber shop where he provides haircuts for customers. He has been involved in this business for two years. His primary customers are male. 

Weldon describes his biggest business challenge to be keeping up with the new skills required. He will use the Kes 15,000 loan to purchase a chair and necessary equipment. His business goal is to add a salon within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be the best service provider. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to purchase a chair and necessary equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 4,000 plantains to sell in 4 days, to keep up sales momentum

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of tires

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy enough meat for cooking to sell.

loans.name: Parvina

texts.ru: Парвина добросовестная женщина. Она занимается собственным бизнесом уже более 6 лет. Она имеет собственную аптеку. Парвина с детства всегда мечтала о данном виде бизнеса. После окончания средней школы она поступила в Медицинский колледж и окончила колледж успешно. Она фармацевт. Парвина сегодня введет свой бизнес успешно. Она воспитает и обеспечивает 2 не совершеннолетних детей и всегда старается для их благополучия. Парвина запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки лекарства для увеличения оборотного капитала. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Parvina is a conscientious woman and has run her own pharmacy for over six years. She had dreamed about this area of business since childhood. After graduating from high school she enrolled at the Medical College and successfully finished her degree. She is a pharmacist is currently runs a successful business. She has two young children and always strives to provide for them. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 somoni to buy medicine and increase her working capital. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy medicines and increase working capital

loans.name: Sima

texts.en:
Sima lives in Deoghar district of Jharkhand with her husband, two sons and one daughter. Her husband is a hawker. He sells soaps, oil, shampoo, and clothes in different villages and also supplies the goods to a few small shops in his village. He transports goods from Kolkata and sells them to Deoghar traders. Sima helps her husband in his business. Their income is around 300 INR per day, which is inadequate to run the family.
   
Sima wants to expand her husband’s business by buying more items in bulk for which she is requesting a loan of INR 12,000.

She plans to use the profits to repay the loan and she also hopes to save enough to open a shop in the coming years.

loans.use: to buy soaps, oil, shampoo.

loans.name: Lauren Maria

texts.es:
Lauren es una joven muy emprendedora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante y progresar.
Hace algunos años se dedicaba a la venta de productos por catalogo como ropa, accesorios, artículos de belleza y elementos para el hogar, estos productos los vendía principalmente a amigos, vecinos y familiares.
Tuvo que dejar la actividad por razones muy familiares que le impedían continuar con su trabajo.
Hoy en día, Lauren ha encontrado una nueva oportunidad de progresar y sacar su proyecto adelante.
Y es precisamente por esto que solicita un préstamo pues quiere volver a retomas este trabajo y consolidarlo para empezar a generar ingresos estables que le permitan sostener sus estudios y mejorar su calidad de vida.
Desde muy niña sintió gran afinidad con el comercio y las ventas, por lo que hoy en día tiene grandes habilidades en este campo gracias a su simpatía y excelente calidad de servicio.
Con el crédito comprara un gran surtido de mercancía para iniciar con un inventario diverso.
Tiene la esperanza de poder salir adelante gracias al apoyo de las personas de buen corazón que apoyan este tipo de proyectos.
texts.en:
Lauren is a very enterprising young woman with a great desire to move forward and make progress.  Some years ago, she sold catalog products such as clothing, accessories, beauty products, and household items. She sold these products mainly to friends, neighbors, and relatives. 

She had to give up this activity for family reasons that prevented her from continuing with her work, but now, Lauren has found a new opportunity to progress and to move her project forward.   This is exactly why she is requesting a loan.  She wants to resume this work, and consolidate it so that she can start generating a stable income which will allow her to support her studies and improve her quality of life.

She has had a great affinity for commerce and sales since she was very young, so today she has very good skills in this field, thanks to her charm and the excellent quality of her service. With the loan, she will purchase a wide selection of merchandise in order to begin with a diverse inventory. She is hopeful that she will be able to move forward, thanks to the good-hearted people who support this type of project.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise in order to start her business.

loans.name: Jose Albeiro

texts.es:
La venta de frutas y verduras, es la actividad en la cual se desempeña José, un hombre con empuje y perseverancia para sacar adelante su propio negocio.
El se dedica a esta actividad desde hace más de 30 años, trabajando desde muy temprano en la mañana todos los días.
El decidió iniciar este proyecto al ver la necesidad de obtener más ingresos para su familia y ya que no tenía la educación suficiente para otro cargo, opto por la venta de frutas y verduras.
Es un hombre simpático y servicial, siempre dispuesto a atender las inquietudes y deseos de sus clientes.
El pide un auxilio económico para comprar una gran variedad de fruta para abastecer su negocio e irlo aumentando poco a poco, esto hará que sus utilidades aumenten y pueda seguir con su actividad tranquilamente.
Su sueño es tener un local en cual pueda vender tranquilamente sus alimentos sin necesidad de transportarlos por toda la ciudad.
texts.en:
Selling fruit and vegetables is the business that Jose is involved in. He is a man with drive and perseverance to move his business forward. He has been doing this for more than 30 years, working from very early in the morning, every day. He decided to start this project realizing the need to make more income for his family and given that he did not have the education for other posts, he opted for the sale of fruit and vegetables.

He is a friendly and helpful man always ready to take care of the concerns and desires of his customers. He is requesting financial help to buy a large variety of fruit to stock his business, making it grow little by little. This will increase his profits and he can continue with his work in peace. His dream is to have a sales point where he can sell his food easily without having to transport them all over the city.

loans.use: to stock his business with fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Rosa una muy emprendedora mujer de avanzada edad madre de 5 hijos los cuales ha mantenido gracias a su negocio de venta y comercialización de mercancía como perfumes, productos de uso domésticos, crema de manos, aretes, collares, lencería y en general artículos de uso doméstico. 
La señora Rosa siempre ha sido muy soñadora y quiere ver su negocio más surtido y mejor posicionado y piensa implementar una nueva forma de pago como lo es plan separe y a crédito y para ello quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de mercancía pues espera una gran demanda de productos por parte de sus clientes con estas dos nuevas formas de pago. 
Su gran sueño es ver su negocio crecer económicamente.
texts.en:
Rosa a very entrepreneurial mature woman. She is a mother of 5, who she has supported through her business of selling and marketing goods such as perfumes, personal care items, hand cream, earrings, necklaces, linens, and general household goods.

Rosa has always been a dreamer, and now she wants her business to be further stocked and better positioned. She wants to implement a new credit payment plan, which is why she is applying for this loan, to purchase merchandise that is in high demand. She expects that her business will increase with the new products and payment methods. Her dream is to see her business grow economically.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for the home, perfumes, electrical appliances, earrings, and more, for her business.

loans.name: Jean Marie

texts.fr:
Monsieur Jean-Marie, s’active dans l’agriculture depuis des années. Il est marié et père de famille. Il a suivit une formation sur l’agriculture : sur comment semer, comment cultiver et comment récolter et gérer son stock. Il a mis en pratique ses connaissances acquises et à récolté de bons fruits. Actuellement, il sollicite un crédit de 300 000F pour acheter des semences et de l’engrais et cultiver. Il est très actif et commence sa journée à 8h pour la finir à 18h. Pour mieux exploiter ses connaissances, il emploie deux personnes pour l’aider dans le travail ; il peut alors diversifier les produits et services.
Jean-Marie envisage d’acheter un moulin à mil dans le cadre de diversifier l’activité et d’acquérir aussi une batteuse pour faciliter le travail.
texts.en:
Monsieur Jean-Marie has been working in agriculture for years. He is married and the father of a family. He has taken a course in agriculture: how to sow, cultivate, harvest and care for his yield. He has put the knowledge he gained into practice and it has been fruitful. 

Presently, he is asking for a loan of 300,000 f to buy seeds and fertilizer for his crops. He is very active, beginning his day at 8 am and ending work at 6 pm. In order to make better use of his knowledge, he pays two persons to help him with his work so that he can diversify his produce and services. 

Jean-Marie has plans to buy a mill to grind millet as a way to diversify his business and also to acquire a thresher to ease his work.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for farming

loans.name: Jumalyn

texts.en:
Jumalyn is 29 years old and has three children. She is married and has two children who are currently in school.

Jumalyn is in the agricultural business, pig-fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Jumalyn has been in pig-fattening for one year now and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Jumalyn would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy material to make traditional embroidery.

loans.name: Marina Yaneth

texts.es:
Marina de 37 años de edad, solo estudio 1º grado y ya no fue más porque no tuviera la oportunidad de estudiar sino que ella no quiso. Ahora está casada y tiene 4 hijos, 3 de ellos estudian. Su esposo trabaja como soldador en estructuras metálicas, también es pintor de vehículos. 

Ella siempre se ha dedicado a los oficios domésticos, ella cuando tiene tiempo y ve la oportunidad también hace algunas ventas de merienda. Ella necesita el dinero para construir una nueva habitación en su casa ya que la familia va creciendo y el espacio es menos, comprara arena, grava, cemento, hierro y pago de mano de obra.

Ella dice que respeta la decisión de sus hijos, lo que quieran estudiar ya que no puede obligarlos dice a estudiar lo que ella quiera.
texts.en:
Marina, 37, only studied first grade, not because she didn't have the chance to continue studying but because she didn't want to. She is now married and has 4 children, 3 of whom are studying. Her husband works as a wielder of metallic structures and also as a car painter.
Marina has always worked doing the household chores. Whenever she has the time and opportunity, she also sells snacks. She needs the money to build a new room in her house because the family is growing and the available space decreases. She will buy sand, gravel, cement, iron and she will pay for labor costs.
She says she respects her children's decisions concerning what to study because she cannot force them to study what she wants.

loans.use: to build a new room in her house to accommodate her growing family. She will buy sand, gravel, cement, iron, and will pay for labor cost.

loans.name: Luwin

texts.es:
La señora Luwin  de 40 años de  edad,  vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos  mayores en su casa de habitación, se dedica desde hace 05  años al negocio de venta de cosméticos como lociones, cremas, achinería y tamales de elotes, su venta es de lunes a domingo.
 Doña Luwin es una mujer trabajadora con deseos de salir adelante, está solicitando el préstamo para compra de lociones, perfumes, cremas, pollo, harina, papas y colorantes estos últimos para su segundo negocio de venta de tamales, con el apoyo del préstamo pretende mejorar sus ingresos es su cuarto crédito que solicita a Prisma, su sueño es mejorar su calidad de vida.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Junio del 2014.
texts.en:
Luwin, 40, lives with her husband and her two grown up children in her home. For 5 years she has had a business selling cosmetics such as lotions, creams and low cost consumer goods. She also sells sweet corn tamales. She works Mondays to Sundays.
Luwin is a hard-working woman with a desire to get ahead in life. She's asking the loan in order to purchase lotions, perfumes and creams and also chicken, flour, potatoes and coloring. These latter are for her second business selling tamales. With the help from the loan she expects to improve her income. This is her fourth loan with the partner institution, Prisma. Her dream is to improve her quality of life.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - June, 2014.

loans.use: to purchase lotions, perfumes, creams, chicken, flour, potatoes and coloring for her businesses.

loans.name: Gerald

texts.en:
Gerald is a single man. He describes himself as determined. 

He operates a retail business where he repairs bicycles. He has been involved in this business for one year. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge as lack of sufficient capital. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy bicycle spare parts and other items for his business. His business goal is to be prosperous within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP microfinance bank. He will use the anticipated profits to improve his business standards.

loans.use: buy bicycle spare parts.

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Everlyne, a 37-year-old mother who is very charming, caring and hardworking. She hails from Kitale area of Kenya, an area that is very fertile and has got one of the best weather patterns on earth. Kitale is always referred to as the “food basket” of Kenya because half of the food that Kenyans consume comes from this area. 

Everlyne has practiced farming for the last five years and has never regretted starting farming because, through crop and dairy farming, she has been able to earn a decent and modest living. Having a large family makes Everlyne work even extra hard because she has more stomachs to feed and this really pushes her. Through profits that she gathers from farming she is able to take care of her family needs and take her five children to school. 

The Kitale area is an area that has a ready market for poultry products. Having an entrepreneur's mind, Everlyne wants to take advantage of that and start poultry farming so that she can supplement her income. 

Everlyne is seeking a KES 65,000 loan to buy poultry and start selling eggs and poultry products to the market that is already there. Through profits gathered from selling eggs, she is sure that her income will increase and this translates to more profits. Everlyne hopes that the extra income from this loan will change her standard of living and increase her business.

Everlyne is projecting that by the end of the year, she will buy a small plot and increase her poultry farming business. Through the loan, Everlyne is going to deliver the promise of elevating the quality of life.

loans.use: To buy poultry.

loans.name: Ma. Victoria

texts.en:
Ma. Victoria is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Ma. Victoria is 47 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Ma. Victoria has a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase an additional piglet, feed, and vitamins for her business.

Ma. Victoria has been in this business for ten years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase an additional piglet, feed, and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
Hello from Kitale, Kenya! Meet John, a 55-year-old hardworking, humble and loving man who cherishes his family so much. John is a proud father of five children that he really loves and you can always notice a pleasant feeling when he arrives at the house every day in the evening. 

John is a passionate farmer who has been doing farming for the past 12 years. He possess a wealth of experience and most of the villagers come for farming advice from him. John practices mixed farming through keeping dairy animals and doing crop farming and through this he has been able to provide a decent life to his family. Although he has been making profits, the income he is getting is not enough to fully satisfy his basic needs. That is why he has decided to keep poultry as a way of making ends meet.

John is seeking a loan of KES 65,000 to buy poultry and use the space in his farm to make more profits. Kitale area is known to have demand for eggs and poultry products. Therefore, John is sure of a ready market and this has really motivated him to turn his dream into reality.

Being a very hardworking man, John sells the fruits of his labour in the nearby markets and will also want to do the same with the poultry products, hence creating more income. John is very keen to provide all the necessities to his family and is sure that through the loan, he will be able to achieve this target.

John has always wanted to turn his dream into reality. Knowing that there are people and institutions that support and generate opportunities to progress, he feels so much relived and knows that he will be able to realize his dream. John is planning to open a very big shop that will not only be selling eggs but also selling poultry products such as medicine for poultry and also feeds.

Through profits from the business, John will be able to repay the loan and improve his living conditions and also provide a secure future for his children.

loans.use: To buy poultry.

loans.name: Melquelidec

texts.es:
Melquelidec, no estudio más que 1º grado, después aprendió más por su propio esfuerzo. Esta acompañado y tiene 2 hijas, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos. Sus hijos aun no estudian por ser menores de edad. 

Él siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura, pero ahora también trabaja como corralero, como es conocido el trabajo de pastorear animales, hace algunos años comenzó a trabajar cuando un amigo le propuso trabajar para él y que él le enseñaría. 

El necesita el préstamo para la compra de una televisión y pagar algunos préstamos personales que ha adquirido de manera informal. Sueña con que sus hijos estudien y saquen una profesión ya que no quiere que trabajen de la misma manera que él.
texts.en:
Melquelidec studied up until the first grade, then he learned through his own efforts. He is married and has two daughters, and his wife does domestic work. Their children do not attend school yet, because they are too young. He has always been a farmer, but now he is also working as a ranch hand, since he knows how to look after animals. A few years ago he started working for a friend who suggested he work for him and said that he would teach him.

He needs the loan to buy a television and to pay off some personal debts that he has acquired informally. He dreams of his children going to school and getting a career since he does not want them to have to work the same way he does.

loans.use: to buy a television and to pay off some personal debts that he has acquired informally.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es:
La señora Raquel de 47 años de edad, es madre soltera vive en  casa propia en una comunidad de San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras y se dedica desde hace  05 años al negocio de venta de ropa usada y nueva.
Doña Raquel también vende su producto en las aldeas y caseríos aledaños a su comunidad de forma ambulante, se levanta temprano para salir con su cesta de ropa a venderla, es una mujer trabajadora con muchos deseos de salir delante.
Doña Raquel está solicitando el préstamo para compra de camisas, faldas, vestidos, blusas, pantalones y zapatos ropa es su segundo crédito que solicita y pago muy bien su primer crédito, con el apoyo de este nuevo préstamo espera mejorar su negocio y satisfacer la necesidades de sus clientes ya que viene la feria del lugar y desea aprovechar a vender para tener mejores ganancias.
 Doña Raquel uno de sus sueños es mejorar su casa.

 San Lorenzo, Honduras - Junio del 2014.
texts.en:
Raquel is 47 years old and is a single mother who lives in her own house in a community of San Lorenzo in the south of Honduras. She has been selling new and used clothing for the last 5 years. Raquel sells her product in the villages and neighborhoods around her community in the streets. She gets up early to go out with her basket of clothing. She is a hard-working woman with a lot of desire to get ahead.

Raquel is requesting a loan to buy shirts, skirts, suits, blouses, pants and shoes. This is her second loan, she paid her first loan off well. With the help of this new loan she hopes to improve her business and satisfy the needs of her customers. The community's festival is coming up and she hopes to take advantage of this to make more profit. One of Raquel's dreams is to make improvements on her home.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - June 2014.

loans.use: to buy shirts, skirts, suits, blouses, pants and shoes for her business.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es: Alejandro tiene 60 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y su hijo de 24 años de edad quien se encuentra estudiando. Alejandro posee un estanque en el que cría tilapias y luego las pone a la venta. De esta forma se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. Este negocio es su principal fuente de ingresos por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en  el negocio en la compra de mayor cantidad de tilapia y concentrado para contar con mayor cantidad y poder cubrir un mayor segmento de mercado y lograr aumentar las ventas e ingresos.
texts.en:
Alejandro is 60 years old and he lives in his own house with his partner and 24-year-old son who is currently in school. 

Alejandro has a pond where he raises tilapia and then sells them. This is how he makes a living and supports the household. 

This business is his main source of income, which is why he is requesting this loan from FUSAI to invest in his business. He will purchase a larger quantity of tilapia and food to ensure a greater amount of fish to be able to cover a larger section of the market, which will increase sales and profit.

loans.use: to buy tilapia and food for his business.

loans.name: Mónica Patricia

texts.es:
Mónica una bella y muy codicia mujer de 29 años de edad madre de un hijo de 10 años el cual ha mantenido gracias a su negocio de comercialización de productos como ropa íntima, aretes, perfumes y productos de aseo personal. 
Es una mujer soltera y comprometida con su trabajo y sabe que la mejor manera de progresar y es trabajar diariamente y amar su modo de trabajar. 
Solicita un crédito para la compra de surtido que le permita mejorar su calidad de vida y brindarle a su hijo un futuro prometedor.
texts.en:
Monica, a beautiful and ambitious woman, 29 years of age, is the mother of a 10-year-old son she has maintained thanks to her business selling products such as underwear, earrings, perfumes and personal care products. 

Monica is a single woman, committed to her work, who knows that the best way to progress is to work hard every day and she loves her mode of working. She is requesting this loan to purchase a selection of merchandise that will enable her to improve her quality of life and offer her son a promising future.

loans.use: buy personal care products to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs like manure and soil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand and gravel to build a pond for raising and selling tilapia.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself to be determined. 

He operates a bakery where he prepares bread and other pastries. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in an area with potential, and his primary customers are of all  types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be a lack of sufficient capital. 

Paul will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy ingredients for preparing bread and other items. His business goal is to expand well within five years. 

This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for preparing bread and other items

loans.name: Benewelfa

texts.en:
Benewelfa is 50 years old and married with four children. 

She is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Benewelfa requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Benewelfa has been farming vegetables for eight years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save enough to buy more farm lands.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 50 years old and has six children. She is single, and has three children who are still in school.

Teresita is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Teresita has been raising pigs for 10 years now, and has borrowed 18 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela works hard to support her family. She is widowed, and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Angela requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fishing nets, etc. for her business.

She has been in this business for 13 years now.

In the future, Angela would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing nets, etc. for her business

loans.name: Baby Ann

texts.en:
Baby Ann is 24 years old and married with one child.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like sugar, candies, biscuits, coffee, shampoo, canned goods, etc. to sell.

Baby Ann has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years, and also earns an income from raising livestock.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like sugar, candies, biscuits, coffee, shampoo, canned goods, etc. to sell

loans.name: Elda Lucia

texts.es:
Elda es una mujer pujante y luchadora que siempre va en busca de oportunidades para salir adelante y progresar. Desde hace 20 años se dedica a una actividad familiar que ha pasado de generación en generación en la historia de su familia y aunque es un negocio pequeño, está formado con mucha dedicación.
Este negocio se trata de la venta de obleas con arequipe y queso, son alimentos muy populares en el municipio de Sabaneta, Antioquia y muy apetecido por sus habitantes.
Elda siempre ha estado pendiente de que su negocio marche bien y otorgue los resultados que siempre espera, por eso hace todo lo posible por darle los impulsos que necesita.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de utensilios de cocina e insumos para sus preparaciones.
Con esta ayuda ella podrá continuar con la tradición alimenticia de su familia y continuara llenando el municipio de sabor.
texts.en:
Elda is a vigorous and combative woman who always seeks out opportunities to get ahead and progress. For the last 20 years, she has been dedicated to a family activity that has passed down from generation to generation in her family's history. Although this is a small business, it is based on much dedication.

The business sells, mainly, Arequipe-style wafers with cheese. These are very popular snacks in the municipalities of Sabaneta and Antioquia, much loved by the inhabitants.

Elda has always kept an eye on her business to make sure it does well and she gets the results she always expects. Elda does everything possible to provide the impulse that's needed.

At present, Elda is requesting a loan to purchase kitchen utensils and supplies for her culinary preparations.

With this financial help, Elda will be able to continue in her family's tradition, filling the municipality with tasty aromas.

loans.use: buy kitchen utensils and supplies for making the popular snacks she sells.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a washing machine, spare parts and to do maintenance on existing machines.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy eggs, basic grains, milk, candies, drinks, etc at wholesale.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 56 years old and married with five children, two of whom are currently in school. 

She is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional livestock, vitamins and other supplies for her business. She has been raising livestock for 2 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Elvira would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock, vitamins and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase high-yeilding grafting seedlings

loans.name: Elkin Elias

texts.es:
Las oportunidades en muchas ocasiones se ven reducidas y más en un país donde necesitas juventud ya con una avanzada como la de Elkin que a sus 59 años de edad es un hombre separado con un hijo y una pequeña tienda que es su única fuente de ingreso por ello trata de permanecer en el tiempo y mantenerla surtida por dicha razón quiere solicitar un crédito para resurtir su tienda comprando víveres, productos de la canasta familiar, productos de aseo, snacks y dulces los cuales mejoraran sus ventas pues tendrá muchos productos que sus clientes le sugieren todos los días.
Su mayor sueño es permanecer en el tiempo y poder brindarle a su exposa e hijo ayuda monetaria.
texts.en:
Often, there are few opportunities, especially in a country where one needs to be young; thus, for an older person like Elkin, who at the age of 59, is separated with a child, a little store is his only source of income.

That is the reason that he tries to keep going, and keep it stocked, and that is the reason that he wants to request a loan:  to re-stock his store, purchasing groceries, products for the family shopping basket, toiletries, snacks, and sweets. This will improve his sales, as he will have many products that his customers suggest to him every day. 

His biggest dream is to keep going, and to be able to provide financial support for his ex-wife and his child.

loans.use: to purchase a supply of groceries, products for the family shopping basket, and toiletries.

loans.name: Luis Eduardo

texts.es:
Luis se ha dedicado toda su vida a la construcción, actividad que le ha permitido sostener a su familia a través de todos estos años.
El ya se siente cansado de este oficio a causa del esfuerzo físico que debe realizar y que en ocasiones le ha traído problemas de salud.
Hoy en día ve una excelente oportunidad de progreso en la venta de legumbres de manera ambulante en el municipio de la dorada donde actualmente reside.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de una carretilla, legumbres al por mayor y un megáfono para anunciarse a través de la calles de su pueblo.
Este préstamo le dará la opción de mejorar sus ingresos y ofrecerle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida y educación.
Es un hombre muy trabajador y siempre está en busca de mejores oportunidades para su familia.
texts.en:
Luis has dedicated his whole life to construction, an activity that has allowed him to support his family through all these years. He is tired of this work due to the physical effort required that has sometimes given him health problems. Today, he sees an excellent opportunity to progress by selling vegetables on foot in the town of La Dorada where he currently lives.

He is requesting a loan to buy a truck, vegetables at wholesale and a megaphone to announce himself in the streets of the town. This loan will give him the option to improve his income and offer his children a better quality of life and education. He is a very hard working man and he is always in search of better opportunities for his family.
