loans.use: to buy a truck, vegetables and a megaphone to start his business.

loans.name: Reyna De Los Angeles Group

texts.es: Felicitas Rodriguez es una mujer de 51 años de edad es socia del grupo Reyna De Los Ángeles formado hace 3 años, es conviviente, tiene 4 hijos y tiene todo el apoyo de su familia en su hogar, tiene un negocio de venta de productos alimenticios de todo tipo como abarrotes en general y atiende muchos clientes que dicen que son de calidad. Solicito el préstamo para comprar muebles y ampliar el tamaño de su negocio en su hogar, se siente agradecida con los inversionistas de KIVA por la ayuda ya que es una mujer emprendedora que tiene muchas metas en la vida y gracias a ellos, Ella podrá poner en marcha la ampliación de su negocio.
texts.en: Felicitas Rodriguez is a 51 year old woman who is a member of the group Reyna De Los Angeles, formed three years ago. She has a spouse and four children and has the complete support of her family at home. She has a business selling food products of all types such as general groceries and tends to many customers who say that they are of good quality. She requested the loan to buy furniture and expand the size of her business in her home. She feels thankful to the Kiva investors for their help since she is an entrepreneurial woman who has many life goals and, thanks to them, she will be able to start the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to increase the size of her business with necessary furniture.

loans.name: Herminia Sarahi

texts.es:
La Joven  Herminia Sarahi  de 24 años de edad, vive con su esposo tiene  casa propia y una  hija  que  depende de de los dos,  vive en una comunidad de San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras, y se dedica desde hace  casi 03 años al negocio de abarrotería como ser: arroz, frijoles, maseca, maíz, manteca, cal, café, azúcar, frescos, jugos, etc. 
Herminia Sarahi sus clientes son los amigos y vecinos de su comunidad, está solicitando el préstamo para comprar frescos, manteca, arroz, maíz, papas, yuca, cebolla, café y pollo, con el apoyo del préstamo espera obtener los ingresos necesarios para mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia, es el  segundo préstamo que solicita.
 Su sueño es tener mejor su negocio.

 San Lorenzo, Honduras - Junio del 2014.
texts.en:
The young Herminia Sarahi is 24 years old. She has her own house, she lives with her husband, and she has a daughter that depends on both of them. She lives in a community of San Lorenzo, in the south of Honduras. 

For three years now, she has been selling groceries, such as rice, beans, maseca [corn masa flower], corn, butter, salt, coffee, sugar, soft-drinks, juices, etc. The customers of Herminia Sarahi are the friends and neighbors in her community. 

She requests the loan to buy soft-drinks, butter, rice, corn, potatoes, yuca, onions, coffee and chickens. With the support of the loan, she hopes to generate the income needed to improve her quality of life and that of her family.  This is her second loan request. Her dream is to improve her business.

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  June, 2014.

loans.use: to buy soft-drinks, butter, rice, corn, potatoes, yuca, onions, coffee and chickens for her business.

loans.name: Rosa Delia

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Delia de 35  años de edad es madre de 02 hijos que dependen de ella, vive en una comunidad de Nacaome  valle al sur de Honduras, vive en casa de propia   y se dedica desde hace 04  años  a la venta de golosinas y frescos.
Doña Rosa Delia sus clientes  son los alumnos de un centro de educación básica, es una mujer trabajadora con deseos de salir adelante. 
Doña Rosa Delia está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de frescos, pollo, carnes, harina, aceite, plátanos, papas, yuca, etc.  Con el apoyo del préstamo espera mejorar  sus ingresos y su calidad de vida, está muy contenta de seguir trabajando  con Prisma. 
Doña Rosa Delia uno de sus  sueños es mejorar su negocio y su casa.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Junio del 2014.
texts.en:
Rosa Delia is 35 years old, she is the mother to two children who depend on her and she lives in her own home in the community of Nacaome valley in southern Honduras. She has made a living selling candy and fresh foods for the past four years, and her customers are students at a basic education center. She is a hard-working woman with hopes of getting ahead in life.

Rosa Delia is requesting this loan to buy fresh foods, chicken, meat, flour, oil, bananas, potatoes, yucca, etc. With the support from the loan she hopes to increase her income and improve her quality of life. She is very happy to continue working with Prisma. One of her dreams is to improve her business and her home.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - June 2014.

loans.use: to buy fresh foods, chicken, meat, flour, oil, bananas, potatoes, yucca, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more milk to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman with 3 children. 

She operates a retail business selling maize cereals, and she has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of maize cereals.

loans.use: to buy more stock of maize cereals

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine works hard to support her family. She is married and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy piglets, feeds and vitamins for her business. She has been in this business for 1 year now.

In the future, Geraldine would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feeds and vitamins for her business

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is 28 years old and has four children. She is married and two of her children are currently in school.

Julie is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Julie has been fattening pigs for two years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Julie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda is 45 years old and married, with three children. She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. She has been raising livestock for five years and earns additional income from food vending.

Luzminda is borrowing 17,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase vaccines and other supplies for her livestock. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase vaccines and other supplies for her livestock

loans.name: Maria Elsy

texts.es:
María es una destacada vendedora que le ha tocado vivir una vida de solicitaría sin nadie que le dé una mano ha sobrevivido gracias a los trabajos que logra encontrar viviendo en piezas alquiladas pero desde hace un tiempo ya pro su avanzada edad se le ha hecho casi imposible conseguir una persona que la contrate desde ese entonces comenzó a formarse como independiente y hace 6 años vende ropa para hombre y dama. 
Su gran sueño es poder tener un hogar propio un lugar seguro donde llegar y que no la corran o la hagan desocupar por ello solicita un crédito no para la casa si no para trabajar muy duro y mejorar su ventas, el crédito lo invertirá en compra de ropa para hombre y dama.
texts.en:
Maria is a stand-out seller who has lived a life of someone who would never ask for a hand. She has survived thanks to the work and manages to find living space in rented rooms. But for some time due to her advanced age, it has been almost impossible to find a person to hire her so she started an independent business and she has sold clothes for men and women for six years.

Her great dream is to be able to have her own home, a safe place where she can go and is not forced to vacate. Thus she is requesting a loan, not for the house, but to work very hard and improve her sales. The loan will be invested in the purchase of men's and women's clothing.

loans.use: to buy clothing for men and women.

loans.name: Virgilia Del Carmen

texts.es: Virgilia tiene 33 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos de 15 años y 12 años de edad. Virgilia y su esposo  poseen una pequeña carpintería en la cual elabora variedad de muebles como: sillas, juegos de comedor, puertas, ventanas, etc. Este negocio es su principal fuente de ingresos y el que les permite dar a sus hijos lo necesario. Con el deseo de mejorar su negocio y ofrecer productos bien acabados a sus clientes ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de una maquina para tallar madera y así hacer más eficiente su trabajo.
texts.en: Virgilia is 33 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and two children, ages 15 and 12. Virgilia and her husband own a small carpentry which produces a variety of furniture such as chairs, dining sets, doors, windows, etc. This business is their primary source of income, and allows them to provide for their children. With the goal to improve their business and provide well-finished products to their customers, she has decided to apply for this loan through FUSAI to invest in buying a machine for carving wood, to work more efficiently.

loans.use: to buy a wood carving machine.

loans.name: Rita Rivera

texts.es: Rita de 39 años de edad  es madre soltera y habita junto a sus cuatro hijos de 19 años, 18 años, 16 años y 12 años de edad. Ella se gana la vida por medio de la venta de papas fritas y minutas (postre a base de hielo rallado y jarabe de frutas). El negocio lo tiene desde hace 13 años y lo hace de forma ambulante y en su casa. Rita desea ampliar su negocio puesto que es su principal fuente de ingresos y desea aumentar sus ventas y sus ingresos con el fin de dar a sus hijos mejores condiciones de vida. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de insumos como: jarabes de frutas, fruta fresca, platos y una bicicleta para llegar a más lugares a ofrecer sus deliciosas minutas y poder así aumentar sus ventas e ingresos.
texts.en: Rita, 39, is a single mother and lives with her four children who are 19, 18, 16 and 12 years old. She earns a living by selling french fries and "minutas" (a dessert made of grated ice and fruit syrup). She has had her business for 13 years and performs her work on foot and from her house. Rita wishes to expand her business since it is her main source of income and wishes to increase her sales and her income with the goal of giving her children better living conditions. Accordingly, she is requesting this loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of ingredients like fruit syrups, fresh fruit, dishes and a bicycle to travel to more places to offer her delicious "minutas" and be able to increase her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy fruit syrups, fresh fruit, dishes and a bicycle.

loans.name: Xiomara Jackeline

texts.es:
La señora Xiomara de 34  años de edad, es madre soltera  vive con sus hijos, tiene dos  hijos  que depende de ella y vive en una comunidad de San Lorenzo, valle al sur de Honduras, tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace 04 años  a la elaboración  de uniformes escolares,  faldas, vestidos, blusas y pantalones y también vende cosméticos.
Doña Xiomara es una mujer luchadora con deseos de salir adelante, está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra telas, hilos, lociones, cremas, pinta labios, polvos, etc. ya que viene la época escolar y tiene bastante trabajo  y es por tal razón que desea comprar la materia prima. Su sueño es mejorar su casa y tener uno de los mejores talleres de costura de  la zona es el segundo crédito que solicita.

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Junio del 2014.
texts.en:
Xiomara is 34 years old. She is a single mother. She lives with her children. She has two children who depend on her and she lives in the community of San Lorenzo, a valley in the south of Honduras. She has her own house and has been dedicated for four years to making school uniforms, skirts, dresses, blouses and pants and also sells cosmetics.

Xiomara is a hard working woman with a desire to get ahead. She is requesting the loan to buy fabrics, threads, lotions, creams, lipsticks, powders, etc. since the school year approaches and she has a lot of work and for this reason she wants to buy raw material. Her dream is to improve her house and have one of the best tailoring shops in the area. This is the second loan she has requested. San Lorenzo, Honduras June 2014.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, thread, lotions, creams, lipstick, powders etc. for her businesses.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself as being determined. 

Edward operates a tea farm where he grows tea to sell. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a rural area and his primary customers are small-scale. He describes his biggest business challenge to be heavy rainfall, which affects tea. 

He will use the KES 15,000 loan to buy more tea leaves to sell. His business goal is to excel within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more tea leaves to sell.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Marilyn works hard to support her family.

She has a dried fish selling business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from fishing. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more fish and other materials for her business.

Marilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish and other materials for her business

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a dried fish making business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fish and ingredients for her business. She has been in this business for 5 years, and earns more income from fishing.

Merlita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish and ingredients for her business

loans.name: Baroat

texts.ru:
Бароат 53 года. Она жительница города Худжанд, Согдийской области Таджикистана. Бароат проживает с мужем, дочерью и сыном. Бароат в течении восемнадцати лет занимается животноводством. Она разводит мелко-рогатый скот. 
Бароат берет кредит для закупа овец, коз и дойной коровы, чтобы увеличить поголовье скота и обеспечить семью свежим молоком и молочными изделиями.
texts.en:
Baroat is 53 years old. She is a resident of the city of Khujand, in the Sogdiiski region of Tajikistan. Baroat lives with her husband, daughter and son. Over the course of 18 years, Baroat has been involved in raising livestock. She breeds small-horned livestock.

Baroat is taking a loan to purchase sheep, goats, and a dairy cow, in order to increase the livestock count and to provide the family with fresh milk and daily products.

loans.use: to purchase sheep, goats, and a dairy cow

loans.name: Blanca Alicia

texts.es: Blanca de 38 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar conformado por sus hijos y su esposo, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa interior para damas y caballeros desde hace varios años, cuenta con muchos clientes fijos con lo que puede mantener su negocio a flote, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logar cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar,  Blanca solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de ropa interior ya que posee gran demanda por parte de muchas personas, con lo que podrá adquirir en diferentes precios, estilos y colores y de esta forma contar con más clientes y así mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: 38 year old Blanca lives in her own house with her family, consisting of her children and husband. She has worked selling ladies' and men's undergarments for several years, and she has many regular customers who keep her business afloat. The earnings from her sales have managed to cover some household expenses. Blanca is requesting a loan with which she can buy a larger quantity of undergarments, as there is great demand from many people to be able to acquire undergarments of different prices, styles, and colors. In this way she will be able to have more customers and therefore improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of undergarments

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more meat to sell.

loans.name: Rubian

texts.es:
El señor Rubian llego hace 4 años al sector donde vio en la pesca una gran oportunidad para generar ingresos y ser independiente y desde entonces ha ejercido esta profesión como persona humilde empezó desde 0 con muchos problemas económicos pero siempre sacando una sonrisa y fuerzas para continuar y poco a poco las condiciones han ido mejorando. 
Solicita un crédito para comprar un “chinchorro” que es una red de pesca y es muy indispensable para su profesión pues es lo único que sabe hacer y con lo que se ha mantenido en este tiempo es un hombre que vive con su pareja y aspiraciones de familia y trabajara incasablemente para traer al mundo un hijo y tenerlo en buenas condiciones.
texts.en:
Rubian joined the fishing sector four years ago, where he saw a great opportunity to generate income and be independent. Since then he has performed this profession.

As a humble man, he began with many economic problems but always with a smile and the determination to continue. Little by little, things have been improving.

He is requesting a loan to purchase a "chinchorro," which is a fishing net and is very indispensable for his work. This is the only thing that he knows how to do, and with it, he has supported himself. He lives with his partner and dreams of having a family. He will work tirelessly to bring a child into the world under good conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing net

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is 25 years old, married with three children, and a resident of Ruhama. He has applied for a loan of 1,600,000 UGX to buy fertilizer to help him improve his coffee plantation. He has many customers but has limited capital. He wants to use the money to buy manure and also to plow an area on his coffee plantation to plant more coffee seedlings. Samuel hopes to increase his income for his family. His dream is to save for his children who are still young so that by the time they go to school he will have saved money for their tuition. He decided to come to UGAFODE for a loan to increase his output, which will generate extra income for the family so they will have a better life in the future.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizers

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en: Doreen is a married woman who has five children. She describes herself as optimistic. She operates a retail business where she sells pastries. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a populated area. Doreen describes her biggest business challenge to be financial challenges. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more pastries. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a better life.

loans.use: buy more pastries

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene is a married woman who has two children. She describes herself as honest. She operates a farm where she keeps cows which produce milk to sell. She has been involved in this business for three years. She describes her biggest business challenge to be unfavorable weather conditions. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy farm inputs. Her business goal is to excel within five years.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Yeymy Saray

texts.es:
Yeymy es una joven emprendedora, tiene 18 años de edad, es soltera y vive en San Juan de Lurigancho junto a su familia. Es una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante, su mayor motivación en la vida es su familia, es por ellos que día a día lucha para poder brindarles un mejor futuro.
Desde hace más de 2 años se dedica a la venta de ropa y le va muy bien porque es una persona muy responsable, trabajadora, honesta y sobre todo porque siempre se preocupa por atender bien a los clientes y tiene muchas técnicas de venta por lo que tiene resultados favorables.
Yeymy está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá comprar una cocina para poder reemplazar la cocina que tiene en su casa porque está un poco deteriorada, de esta manera estará mejorando su calidad de vida, y ella seguirá esforzándose para más adelante poder cumplir una de sus grandes metas: "Tener su propio negocio".
texts.en:
Yeymy is an enterprising young woman. She is 18 years old, single, and lives in San Juan Lurigancho with her family. She is a person with a great desire to succeed and her greatest motivation in life is her family. It is for them that she strives day by day, in order to give them a better future.

She has been selling clothing for two years and it is going very well because she is a very responsible, hard-working, honest person, and especially because she always is concerned about serving customers well. She has many sales techniques, so she has favorable results.

Yeymy is grateful to the Kiva lenders, because with the support they have offered her she will be able to buy a stove. This is in order to replace the stove she has in her house because it is in somewhat poor condition. This way she will improving her quality of life and will continue doing her best to someday fulfill one of her great goals: "To have my own business."

loans.use: To buy a stove.

loans.name: Dennis

texts.en:
Dennis is a married man. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are both commercial and private. He describes his biggest business challenge to be financial challenges. 

Dennis will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy another motorcycle. His business goal is to have a transport company within five years. He hopes that, in the future, he will have a quality life. He will use the anticipated profits to pay bills and expenses.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle is 31 years old, married and has two children who are in school.

Michelle is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Michelle requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Michelle has been in pig fattening for two years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Michelle would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Menerva

texts.en:
Menerva is 32 years old, married and has one child who is currently in school.

Menerva is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Menerva requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase piglets, feed and vitamins for her business.

Menerva has been in pig fattening for three years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Menerva would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase piglets, feed and vitamins for her business

loans.name: Remolina

texts.en:
Remolina works hard to support her family. Remolina is married and has a raising-cattle business in the Philippines.

Remolina requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy vitamins and vaccines for her cattle.

Remolina has been in this business for seven years now.

In the future, Remolina would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and vaccines for her cattle

loans.name: Rojina

texts.en:
Rojina is a 45-year-old married woman with three children, all in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Rojina has a business raising cattle in the Philippines. Rojina requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase vitamins and other supplies for her livestock.

Rojina has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Rojina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins and other supplies for her livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock to start his store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy goods such as salt, onion, soda, and pepper.

loans.name: Sandra Jaqueline

texts.es:
La señora Sandra  de 35  años de edad,  tiene 02  hijos que dependen  de ella, vive con su esposa en su casa propia, ubicada en la comunidad de San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 05 años al negocio de venta de ropa usada y zapatos.
Doña Sandra vende sus productos con los vecinos, amigos y personas que a diario visita, porque se va de casa en casa ofreciendo dichos productos, es una joven mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante actualmente está estudiando para enfermera.
Doña Sandra está solicitando el préstamo para compra  de blusas, camisas, pantalones, vestidos, calzonetas, etc. y para construir una letrina, con el apoyo de este préstamo pretende mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida. 
Doña Sandra su sueño es mejorar su casa.

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Junio del 2014.
texts.en:
Sandra is 35 years old, and she has two children who depend on her. She lives with her husband in her own home, which is located in the community of San Lorenzo, in southern Honduras. She has devoted herself to the business of selling used clothing and shoes for five years. Sandra sells her products to neighbors, friends, and people that she visits daily, because she sells these products door to door. 

She is an enterprising young woman who wants to get ahead, and she is studying to become a nurse. She is requesting the loan in order to purchase blouses, shirts, pants, dresses, bathing suits, etc., and to build a latrine. With the support of this loan, she is trying to improve her income and also her quality of life.  Sandra’s dream is to improve her house.

San Lorenzo, Honduras—June, 2014.

loans.use: to purchase blouses, shirts, pants, dresses, bathing suits, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy spray, cream, soap, powder, grease etc.

loans.name: Lirios De Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Doña Ada, tiene 50 años de edad, es casada, tiene 3 hijos, vive en el municipio de Gracias Lempira. Toda su vida a realizado actividades de agricultura junto a su familia, ha cultivado maíz, frijol y café, actualmente solo se dedica al cultivo de café, cuenta con su propia finca. Esta solicitando un quinto préstamo en forma grupal, el cual es por 6,000 lempiras para comprar fertilizante y dar asistencia a su finca de café. 
El grupo a que pertenece se llama Lirios de Esperanza, esta formado por tres miembros, que se dedican al cultivo de café y viven en la misma comunidad. El préstamo grupal es por 12,000 lempiras para comprar fertilizantes y dar asistencia a la finca de café. En la foto esta Reina a la izquierda, Gumercinda, y Ada a la derecha.
texts.en:
Ada is 50 years old, married, and has 3 children. She lives in Gracias, Lempira. She has worked in agriculture with her family for her whole life; she has raised corn, beans, and coffee. She currently grows coffee for a living and owns her own plantation. She is requesting a small loan -- 6,000 lempiras to purchase fertilizer and support her coffee plantation -- as part of a group.

The group to which she belongs is called Lirios de Esperanza [Lilies of Hope]. It is made up of three members who grow coffee for a living and live in the same community. The group loan is for 12,000 lempiras to purchase fertilizers and support the cultivation of coffee. In the photo, Reina is on the left, then Gumercinda, and Ada on the right.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to help her coffee plantation

loans.name: Alfredo Jose

texts.es:
El señor Alfredo desde muy joven se dedico a las funciones del campo tales como agricultura y ganadería, actividades que le enseño su padre para su supervivencia.
Hoy en día su actividad principal es la ganadería y tiene como objetivo aumentar su capital comprando aun mas lotes de ganado que le permitan abastecerse y generar mejores ingresos.
Es padre responsable y amoroso con sus hijos, vive en una finca con ellos y su esposa.
Sueña con poder otorgarles a sus hijos una educación de calidad para que más adelante se puedan defender solos y sean independientes.
Todos los días asiste su negocio y procura por hacer las cosas muy bien.
El crédito será invertido en la compra de ganado.
texts.en: Since very young Alfredo has worked in the fields: in agriculture and animal husbandry, activities he learned from his father for his survival. Currently his main activity is raising animals. His objective is to increase his capital by buying even more herds of cattle that will allow him to generate more income. He is a responsible and loving father to his children. He lives in a farm with them and his wife. He dreams of giving his children a quality education so that they can stand up for themselves and be independent in the future. Every day he attends to his business and tries to do things very well. He will invest the loan buying cattle.

loans.use: To buy a herd of cattle

loans.name: Hector Dario

texts.es:
El señor Héctor es un renombrado herrero muy experimentado. Ha adquirido muchas habilidades a través de pequeños estudios en diferentes academias y otra parte la ha aprendido empíricamente trabajando en muchos talleres desde su juventud.
Tiene un taller en el cual fabrica todo tipo de elementos en hierro como rejas, puertas, ventanas, entre otros.
Siendo muy conocido en el municipio de Medellín, es un hombre muy trabajador y honrado que conoce el significado que tienen los el trabajo duro para progresar y salir adelante, es por esto que siempre trata de ofrecer siempre un excelente servicio, de buena calidad y de una manera eficiente.
El solicita un préstamo para surtir su almacén con gran cantidad de hierro y acero en diferentes calibres, de este modo podrá tener una mayor cantidad de materia prima para trabajar impactando positivamente su economía.
texts.en:
Héctor is a renowned and experienced blacksmith. He has acquired many skills through short periods of study at various schools and by learning on the job in many workshops since his childhood.

He has a workshop in which he makes all kinds of iron products such as grills, doors, windows, and other.

Very well known in the area of Medellín, he is a very hardworking and honest man who understands the significance of hard work to improve and move forward. For this reason, he always tries to offer excellent service, of good quality and in an efficient manner.

He is requesting a loan to stock his workshop with a large quantity of iron and steel of various calibers. In this way, he will be able to have a greater quantity of raw material to work, positivity impacting his financial situation.

loans.use: to purchase steel and iron of various caliber

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more medicine wholesale

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Growing up, Anita was fascinated by two things: how the human body works and her dad's cooking. Yes, her dad's authentic cooking. When she was five years old she would always watch her father cook. “I would see the passion he had, always inventing different meals. I slowly started learning from him. He inspired me to cook and think outside the box. We started competing on who can make the best meals with a side of fresh organic hummus.” 

The love they have for cooking grew and still is growing. “My passion for cooking is something I have been wanting to share with the world. I saw a great store that was a check-cashing place and decided to purchase it. I'm converting the check-cashing store into a beautiful restaurant called Hummus. My father and I will be working together and creating something unique. Once the store is open we will be serving different varieties of fresh hummus and authentic food.”  

With the support of a $10,000 Kiva loan, Anita will be able to complete the final stages of construction and open her doors.

loans.use: To complete the final stages of construction and open her restaurant.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria's business, Mayan Commercial Cleaning, is continuing to thrive since receiving her first Kiva loan last year.

Mayan Cleaning Services was built out of necessity during the economic downturn, when Maria watched with a heavy heart as several members of her family were laid off from their jobs and then were unable to find new work. She knew that her family had experience in custodial services, so she started the business to provide an additional income stream for her family.

Maria will use her second Kiva loan to buy new equipment, such as a trailer to transport her commercial carpet cleaner purchased with her first loan. She will also use the money to pay worker’s comp insurance, as well as for marketing materials like flyers and pamphlets.

As a fully family run business, Maria loves how her venture has served to rally her family around a unified purpose during the recent economic downturn. She hopes to continue building her business to provide a lasting legacy that her children can be proud of.

loans.use: to buy new equipment, pay worker’s comp insurance and produce marketing materials

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en: Fredrick is a 61-year-old man. He describes himself as focused and assertive. He operates a tire business. He has been involved in this business for five years. His primary customers are commercial and private motorists. Fredrick describes his biggest business challenge to be financing. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to purchase additional stock. His business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock

loans.name: Hosea

texts.en:
Hosea is a bright, visionary and verbal farmer from Kitale, a small agricultural town in Kenya known for maize. He is the first born in a family of five siblings, and has been through primary schooling but due to circumstances out of his control, he dropped out. He describes his upbringing as challenging, and is seeking a loan to construct a greenhouse. A greenhouse will give him control over the environment that his crops grow in. He will be able to produce more exotic variety of crops and increase his yield quantity by more than 40%.
Hosea has fully paid a previous loan of Ksh. 150,000 which he secured through Juhudi Kilimo. With the new loan, he is looking to increase crop production on his farm, where he has worked for the last 14 years. He and his wife have hired four permanent employees to help run his farm. 
Hosea also owns over 100 chickens, a lorry and sheep. However, he is very cautious when approaching a new business opportunity and is very focused on money matters: He records every transaction and reviews his budget on a daily basis. He is certain that returns from the expansion will allow him to pay the loan.
Hosea is an active member of Lukendo Group (the oldest and one of the most successful groups in Juhudi Kilimo) who believes in luck and hard work as a way to succeed and building better life for the future generations. He has over 20 trees in his compound and various works of art. He considers himself to be very honest With this loan, Hosea will build a better life for his wife and two children (aged 8 and 10) and put in a lot more hard work.

loans.use: to construct a greenhouse

loans.name: Sabjesia

texts.en:
Sabjesia is 51 years old and married, with four children.

Sabjesia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 27,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more stocks to sell in her general store.

Sabjesia has borrowed and paid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Sabjesia aspires to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.es:
Janeth es una mujer muy emprendedora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante y progresar.
Desde hace algunos años se viene dedicando a la venta de productos por catalogo como ropa, accesorios, artículos de belleza y elementos para el hogar de marcas muy reconocidas, estos productos los vende principalmente a amigos, vecinos y familiares que conocen a Janeth y quieren que también progrese en su actividad.
Solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de mercancía nueva y de temporada, así podrá fortalecer su inventario y mejorara efectivamente sus ventas.
Tiene la esperanza de poder salir adelante gracias al apoyo de las personas de buen corazón que apoyan este tipo de proyectos.
Es una mujer muy tenaz y merece la oportunidad de progresar.
texts.en:
Janeth is a very entrepreneurial woman who is eager to succeed and get ahead. For many years, she has made a living selling products by catalog, such as apparel, accessories, and beauty and household items from well-known brands. She sells these products mainly to friends, neighbors and relatives who know Janeth and also want her to succeed. 

She is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of new and seasonal merchandise, so she can build her inventory and improve sales. She hopes to be able to increase her success with the support of the good-hearted people who support these types of projects. Janeth is a very tenacious woman and deserves the opportunity to progress.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to increase her inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy farm inputs

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina is a 57-year-old jovial mother of four children who hails from the Nandi hills area of Kenya; she is a very hardworking mother who always puts food on the table for her family. Because of lack of tuition fees, she never went to college and started farming at an early age. She has 36 years’ experience in farming, and through these years, she has been able to gather a wealth of experience, and most farmers in her village look up to her for advice.

Dina practices mixed farming and through cattle keeping, she has been able to get profits through milk selling. Profits from milk selling have helped her raise her family and pay school fees for her children.

Dina is seeking a loan of 40,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to be able to construct a cow unit, because through the dairy cow, she has been able to gather immense profits. Dina is planning on increasing the number of cows that she has, and a cow unit will be of help in keeping the extra cows safe and free from rain and bad weather conditions.

Through profits that she will gather, she will improve her living conditions and be able to pay back the loan.

loans.use: To construct a cow unit

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing and footwear

loans.name: Sifelimusa

texts.en:
Sifelimusa is a 20-year-old resident of the Chiredzi District in Zimbabwe. She volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide teaching life skills education in the local school. 

In order to support her family, Sifelimusa has been running a hair salon for the past two years. She provides hair treatments and sells hair products. 

With a Kiva loan, Sifelimusa will purchase braids, hair treatments, and rollers to increase her supplies and serve more customers. More business and higher profits will help her provide for her family and become more financially independent.

loans.use: to purchase more hair products

loans.name: Plasdah

texts.en: Plasdah is a 24-year-old businesswoman. She is married with one child and resides in the Kwekwe District, Zimbabwe together with her family. Eleven months ago, after realizing the importance of being financially independent, Plasdah ventured into a poultry project where she has had the capacity to produce batches of 50 broiler birds every six weeks. She volunteers with other Cama members in her community in doing awareness campaigns on the importance of education, children’s rights, and on HIV and AIDS. Cama is Camfed’s alumnae network of women. With the requested loan, she intends to expand her poultry production to 50 broiler birds per week to meet the demand of chicken in her area and therefore get more profits to improve the quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks to sell

loans.name: Memory

texts.en:
Memory is a 25-year-old young woman. She is married and is currently living in the Chiredzi District of Zimbabwe. She is a Camfed Learner Guide, volunteering at a secondary school in her community teaching life skills sessions. Over the last year, she has grown her poultry business to its current capacity – producing about 150 broiler birds every six weeks and selling them to local residents. She started the business in 2009 because she wanted to be financially independent.  

Memory would very much like to increase her sales volume and become a supplier to supermarkets. She will use a Kiva loan to purchase more broiler chicks and feed to increase production. She hopes to provide for herself and remain financially independent.

loans.use: to buy more chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Sebitah

texts.en: Sebitah is a 38-year-old businesswoman. She lives in the Kwekwe district in Zimbabwe with her husband and two children. She has been successfully rearing broiler chickens for three months now and produces batches of 25 birds every six weeks. Sebitah also serves as a Learner Guide in her community where she leads and assists school children in their study groups. With the requested loan, she intends to increase her produce of broilers to batches of 25 birds every week, to meet the demand and improve her sales and profits. She hopes to pay her children’s fees timely every term with the profits that she will be getting from her business.

loans.use: to increase the number of chickens to sell

loans.name: Murzali

texts.ru: Мурзали позитивный по жизни человек. Он очень хорошо разбирается в скотоводстве. У него девятилетний стаж в этой сфере. Скотоводство его основной источник дохода. Поэтому Мурзали максимум время занят этим делом. Он каждый день выводит скот на пастбище. Чистит коровник, держит контроль над чистотой и здоровьем коров. Мурзали специально для коров подготовил место, где они постятся днем. Он умело превратил бывший канал, где проходила вода, на маленькое пастбище. Его жена помогает ему с дойкой коров. Полученное молоко продают и получает дополнительный доход. Его дети уже взрослые и самостоятельно работают. Помогают отцу и матери материально. Но Мурзали не привык сидеть сложа руки. У него свой скот, от которого получает свой заслуженный доход. Мурзали пользуясь сезоном, хочет купить корову и корм. С надеждой обратился в МДО «Арванд» . Благодарить за помощь и доверие в предоставлении кредита.
texts.en: Murzali is a positive person in life. He is very well-versed in raising livestock. He has nine years of experience in this sphere. Animal husbandry is his main source of income. Therefore, Murzali is maximally busy with this work. Every day, he leads the livestock to pasture. He cleans the cowshed and maintains control over the cleanliness and health of the cattle. Murzali prepared a place specially for the cattle, where they spend the days. He skillfully formed the former channel where water flowed into a small pasture. His wife helps him with the dairy cows. They sell the milk produced and receive additional income. His children are grown already and work independently. They help their father and mother financially. But Murzali is not accustomed to sitting idly by. He has his own livestock from which he receives his well-earned income. Using the season, Murzali wants to buy a cow and feed. With hope, he appealed to MDO Arvand. He is thankful for the help and trust in offering the loan.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Priviledge

texts.en:
Privilege is a 19-year-old businesswoman. She is married with one child and lives in the Kwekwe District of Zimbabwe.

She has been successfully operating a flea market for a year now and she sells shoes, clothes and hair extensions. Privilege volunteers her spare time to assisting students at her nearest secondary school in her community with lessons on guidance and counseling.

With the requested loan, she intends to purchase bulky clothes, shoes and hair extensions at lower cost and enjoy more profits. With additional profits, she hopes to assist her family to meet their basic necessities.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Forget

texts.en:
Forget is a 32-year-old woman who lives in the Nyanga District of Zimbabwe. She is a married woman with three children (one boy and two girls). Forget successfully runs a small business of market gardening, farming potatoes.  

With the requested loan, Forget intends to make bulk purchases of farming implements, to buy more irrigation pipes and seeds to expand her tomato growing business and supply more people in the community with food. Additional income will also help her family improve their living conditions and will help her better provide for her children.

loans.use: to make bulk purchases of farming implements

loans.name: Magreth

texts.en:
Magreth is 23 years old. She is married and lives in the Chiredzi District of Zimbabwe with her husband. Magreth has been volunteering weekly, teaching life-skills education at her local secondary school. In addition, she rents a small grocery shop selling basic essentials like sugar, rice, flour, salt, milk, and cooking oil. 

With a Kiva loan, Magreth will purchase more flour, soup, rice and cooking oil to increase her supplies. Her hope is to expand the business and increase her income. This will bring stability to her business and will enable her to provide for her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: To purchase more flour, soup, rice and cooking oil to increase her supplies.

loans.name: Lisbert

texts.en:
Lisbert is a 21-year-old resident of the Chiredzi District of Zimbabwe. She volunteers at the local school as a Camfed Learner Guide teaching life skills classes and runs her own poultry business. Over the past year, Lisbert has grown her business to its current capacity, producing about 50 egg-layers every six weeks and selling eggs to the local residents. 

She started the business in 2009 because she wanted to be financially independent. With the Kiva loan, Lisbert will purchase more chicks and chick feed to increase production. This will increase her sales volume and she will hopefully reach her goal of becoming a supplier to major supermarkets. 

Lisbert hopes to remain financially independent.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks and chick feed

loans.name: Nyebu - Bi Yoona  -  Nyohini Group

texts.en:
Meri is an active woman, 45 years old, from Nyohini, an area of Tamale, the Northern Regional capital city in Ghana. She is married and has four children. She is the first person sitting on the right hand as you face their group picture
. 
Meri is a member of a local rice and shea butter-processing group who has been doing the business for the last 17 years. Their group is called ‘Nyebu - Bi Yoona  -  Nyohini ‘  She makes good profits from the business since she and every member of her group have been trained by Grameen Ghana and SNV on improved ways of processing shea butter and milling locally produced paddy rice for local market in Ghana. Their milled rice is sold and consumed around Ghana and the shea butter for the export market. She also sells her parboiled milled rice to boarding schools. Meri is always in business.

Meri and the group have asked for a loan of GHS 11,500. Her share of the loan will help her to buy and process six bags of paddy rice and shea butter. By so doing, she would earn more income, repay this loan and support her children’s educational needs.

loans.use: To buy and mill six bags of paddy rice and shea butter.

loans.name: Flavia

texts.en:
Flavia is a 43-year-old married female with five children who are all going to school. Flavia owns a textile business in a busy market and works seven days a week, 11 hours a day, plus farming and has rental houses as additional sources of income. Flavia began the business to generate income for personal development. Expanding her business and educating her children are her dreams. She used the previous loan to buy clothes to sell.

Flavia needs another to pay school fees for her children. She is hard working though a lack of capital is a problem she meets.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Soledad

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Soledad works hard to support her family.

She has a dried fish making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. Soledad is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more fish, ingredients and materials for her dried fish making business.

Soledad has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish, ingredients and materials for her business

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en: Gayane is a taylor from Gyumri. She lives there with her two children (one son and one daughter). Gayane has been engaged in a sewing business for many years. She buys fabric and other necessary materials to sew and sell clothes. For different orders various materials are needed. That is why Gayane is always forced to look for various types of fabric. In particular, she needs to buy Alize fabric for her current orders. For this purpose she has applied for a loan of AMD 300,000. Let's help this hard working woman sustain her sewing business and expand it. Gayane really hopes to receive support from the lenders. She will greatly appreciate that.

loans.use: to purchase Alize fabric

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz es una mujer de 32 años de edad madre de 2 hijos de 15 y 9 años de edad y por los cuales tuvo que abandonar muchas aspiraciones y sueños en la vida como estudiar una carrera universitaria ya que tenía que hacerse cargo de sus hijos y cubrir los gastos que ellos demandaban. 
Encontró en la venta de mercancía tales como artículos para el aseo personal, ropa y accesorios la manera para generar buenos ingresos estando cerca  de sus hijos, adicionalmente también tiene conocimientos en arreglo de uñas gracias a unos pequeños cursos realizados en su juventud. 
Su principal objetivo es aumentar sus ventas y poder tener una clientela fija ofertando sus productos.  Por esta razón solicita un crédito para la compra de mercancía para ofertarla en varias partes y comenzar a ganar nueva clientela buscando fidelizarla para futuras nuevas ventas. También desea comprar materia prima para su negocio de uñas.
texts.en:
Luz is a 32 year-old woman. She is the mother of two children aged 15 and 9 years old. She had to give up many aspirations and life dreams, such as attending college, in order to take care of her children and to cover child-rearing expenses. 

She found the way to generate good income, while staying close to her children, through the sales of merchandise such as personal care products, clothing, and accessories. In addition, she has knowledge of nail care services, thanks to some brief training courses that she took in her youth.

Her main goal is to increase her sales, and to be able to have loyal customers to whom to offer her products. For this reason, she requests a loan to buy merchandise in order to market it in several places and to start attracting new customers, seeking to retain their loyalty for future new sales. She also wants to buy supplies for her nail care business.

loans.use: to buy wholesale merchandise, and to buy supplies for her nail care business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his son's medical treatment.

loans.name: Monand

texts.ru:
Монанд живет в сельской местности, в далёком от города кишлаке. Она имеет большой  опыт в сфере животноводство и знает все тонкости этого дела. От скотоводства получает свой доход, который тратит на жильё, учебу детей и проживание. Монанд имеет три коровы и три барана. Она также доит корову и получает парное и вкусное молоко.  Продавая молоко, она получает дополнительный доход. 
Так как от скота Монанд получает сезонный доход, она также занимается дехканским хозяйством. Круглый год у нее можно в огороде найти свежую  зелень. Этим она покрывает ежедневные расходы семьи.  Имеет четырех детей, трое выросли и только один находится на иждивении у Монанд. Сын помогает ей в скотоводстве и часто выводит скот на пастбище. . Монанд планирует купить КРС и корм для них, но не имеет достаточную сумму на руках.  Монанд решила обратится в МДО «Арванд» за кредитом. Очень надеется найти решения своих задач приобретённым кредитом. Заранее благодарит МДО «Арванд» за доверие и поддержку.
texts.en:
Monand lives in a rural area, far from the city. She has a lot of experience in the area of animal husbandry and knows all the fine points of this work. From the livestock, she receives her income which she uses for housing, the children's education, and well-being. Monand has three cows and three sheep. She also milks a cow and receives fresh and delicious milk. Selling milk, she receives additional income.

Since the livestock for Monand provide only seasonal income, she also does collective farming. All year round, she can find in the garden fresh greens. This is how she covers the daily expenses of the family. She has four children, three of which are grown and only one is a dependent of Monand. Her son helps her with the livestock and often leads them to pasture. Monand plans to buy cattle and their feed, but does not have enough money in hand. Monand decided to apply to MDO Arvand for a loan. She very much hopes to find solutions to their problems through acquiring loans. She thanks MDO Arvand in advance for the trust and support.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, eggs,coffee,milk etc.

loans.name: Salatin

texts.en:
Salatin is a 48-year-old widow and IDP (internally displaced person) who lives with her daughter in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. Salatin is a very caring mother. Her first goal is to give her daughter a good life. For that reason, she is working every day without rest. 

Salatin earns a living by selling fruits and vegetables. She has dedicated her life to this business for more than 22 years. To be able to keep her small business functioning in a sustainable way, Salatin needs to make some investments. A loan of 1,200 AZN (Azerbaijani New Manat) will be a huge support to this hardworking woman and her family. She will use this loan to buy fertilizers and seeds

Salatin relies on the goodwill of the lenders, and she will be thankful to them for supporting her in sustaining and developing her small business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Nurkhon

texts.ru:
Нурхон живет вместе с дочерью в городке Турсунзаде. Ей 39 лет. Она замужем. Ее муж и сын находятся за приделами страны на заработках. Нурхон является портнихой. Она работает на дому. В течение 8 лет Нурхон принимает заказы на шитье дома, в работе ей активно помогает ее дочь. Нурхон хочет передать своей дочери весь свой талант и умение. 
Нурхон просит кредит, чтобы приобрести новую швейную машинку, так как ее старая машинка устарела и не пригодна для работы. Нурхон с надеждой просит кредит. Она верит, что ей помогут, и она продолжит работу, не лишаясь источника дохода.
texts.en: Nurkhon lives with her daughter in the city of Tursun-zoda.  She is 39 years old and married.  Her husband and son live in another country for work.  Nurkhon works out of her home as a dress maker.  For 8 years Nurkhon has been making dresses to order, and her daughter actively helps her in her work.  Nurkhon wants to pass on all of her talent and knowledge to her daughter.  Nurkhon is requesting a loan to buy a new sewing machine to replace her old machine, which is no longer suitable for work.  Nurkhon is requesting this loan with great hope; she believes that she will be helped, will be able to continue working, and will not lose her source of income.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Mirvari

texts.en:
Mirvari was born in 1961. She was widowed after her husband was died in the Karabakh war, and then Mirvari raised her children independently. She has two children. The elder of them, who is a 31-year-old man, was married, and the younger child studies the first course of medical college. 

Mirvari’s son has a store where he sells phone accessories; also in here, her son repairs different phones. Mirvari helps her son with their family business. Recently, she applied to Komak company for a loan in the amount of 2,100 Azerbaijan new manat. With this amount, Mirvari wants to buy more goods for selling. For the support, she says thanks to the Kiva organization and lenders.

loans.use: to buy more goods for selling

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 26-year-old single young man from Rafah; he lives with his family in the city. He works at a local firm to help his family, and also to pay the university installments since he is still a student. He studies Business Administration. He would like get a BA degree and find a better job to improve the family's living conditions. 

Mahmoud took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. 

By taking this loan. Mahmoud will be able to do his homework and write the reports easily. 

Mahmoud appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Kamene

texts.en:
Kamene is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her hard work.

She is asking for a loan to buy tobacco for her business. 

She is grateful for the financial support she has received.

loans.use: to buy tobacco for her business

loans.name: Quarter A Group

texts.en:
Young and vibrant yet mature and hard-working is Hatkhotin who hails from a small town on the outskirts of Churachandpur in the Northeastern state of India. Hatkhotin is the featured member of Quarter A pictured with raised hand. This group’s main purpose in coming together and forming a group is to raise their economic and living standard by accessing loan for a mini 45 watt solar lighting worth 12,173 INR. Hatkhotin being the representative of the group shared about the grievance of not having access to regular power supply in the town. She cannot run her business till late hours due to irregular electric supply and frequent load shedding. This forced her to divert a considerable share of means to the purchase of another alternative lighting device. As the family lives only on the pension of her grandfather it is difficult for them to spend an extra amount on another alternative device.

Hatkhotin used to teach in a local private school but the amount she gets as a salary could not meet the expenses of the family. Therefore, in order to supplement her income Hatkhotin resigned from the teaching job and opened a variety store near her house. She says that she earns a profit of around 400-500 INR per day. She says she gets lot of free time to do side business while running the store, too.

Hatkhotin wants to access a solar loan to buy a 45-watt solar home lighting system which will light up 4 light bulbs for 12 hrs a day. Since it has 90 meters of  wire, it can be install in any four adjacent rooms in the house or as per user’s own convenience. Mobile phone charging can be more hassle free unlike depending only on the conventional electricity to charge the phone. With the help of the solar loan, Hatkhotin expects to get more income by opening her store till late in the evening. 

Likewise, the other group members are also busy in their businesses and are working hard. Their businesses include weaving, tailoring and a variety store. They will all use the solar light in their activity at night. They are hopeful for better and bigger outcome in the days to come, if Kiva continues the good work towards them in the future, too.

loans.use: To own solar lighting to install in her variety store so as to open for longer hours at night.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To start a farming business by building a greenhouse and planting fruit trees

loans.name: Shoghik

texts.en: Shoghik is a farmer from Ghukasavan village in the Ararat region. She lives there with her husband, son and daughter. The family has been running a farm for many years. In particular, they cultivate tomatoes, greens, garlic and potatoes. As this is the family's only revenue source, all the four members are involved in agricultural activities. Shoghik's husband and son sell the agricultural products in local markets. The family's agribusiness needs some investments to function more efficiently. That's why Shoghik has applied for a loan of USD 1,000. The requested amount will be used to pay for 15 bags of fertilizer and buy chemicals for plants. As this is Shoghik's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products in the past because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and chemicals for plants

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator to keep the drinks, foods, and water in a cold condition in the house.

loans.name: Drita

texts.en:
Drita wants to thank all of the lenders for her previous loan, which has helped her complete the renovations to improve her doors and windows and to paint her house. With this she has managed to improve the living conditions, for which she appreciates and is grateful to the lenders.

Now, she is requesting a second loan to buy material to start a business with her older daughter making handicrafts. The loan will help her to get the start-up materials that she will need and assist her in getting the work done for her first customers. This loan will help to improve the family’s standard of living even more since she will be able to start contributing to the finances. She is very happy for this opportunity to start her business with her daughter and to sell her products in the market. She wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: To buy handicraft materials

loans.name: Abagambakamu Kyomukama Group

texts.en:
Angelina is 49 years old and married, with five children aged between 34 and 18 years, living in Kagadi, Uganda. For 12 years, she has been getting her income from second-hand clothes and farming, to supplement her income. She plans to educate her children and expand her business, despite the hardship of competition. 

Angelina  is asking for credit to buy more second-hand clothes to sell to realize profits. She is a member of Abagambakamu Kyomukama Group, where each member guarantees the other to get a loan, since they don’t pledge securities.

loans.use: to buy more second-hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Rose Group

texts.en:
Kimsy owns a drug store in the village, which is about 2 ½ km away from the town market. The town is about 40 kms from the city, capital of Manipur, which is one of the northeastern states of India. Kimsy belongs to "Rose" group and she is the featured borrower for the group. She is pictured with her hand raised. Kimsy is married and blessed with one child.

 Her husband is a farmer and during off seasons, he helps Kimsy run errands for the drug store. Kimsy has been running a drug shop for more than a couple of years in the village where she resides. She usually gets the drugs from the main city wholesalers and sells them in the village with a little profit. Her purpose for running the drug store is to facilitate the villagers with first aid supplies and also to earn an income. Having not access to hospitals and clinics in the village, villagers are ensured of buying the essential drugs that she stocks in the shop. The Primary Health Center in the village is defunct due to irregular attendance of the staff. The villagers and neighboring villagers ask for first aid supplies in Kimsy’s drug store before they visit hospitals in the main capital city, Imphal.

 Since her drug store serves customers till late hours she wants to install solar to provide better lighting and to extend her working hours. The power supply is very irregular and frequent load shedding prevails in the village. She has to use other alternative lighting devices to light up her shop which means she has to spend an extra amount from the income she gets. Therefore, Kimsy believes that owning a solar lighting system will help her in reducing the expenditures and at the same time make her work more comfortable and easier at night.     

The presence of Kimsy’s drug store has been a relieving factor for the villagers. They can now purchase any first aid kits, antibiotic, cough syrup, etc. which are available at her shop, and that saves the villagers the fares spent going to the town market. The rest of the group members too needed solar systems for their respective income-generating activities and for household use.Their activities are a variety store, vegetable vending and weaving, etc..

loans.use: To buy a 45-watt mini solar home lighting system to install in her chemist's shop to stay open for longer hours.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 29-year-old married lady with two children, aged 14 and six years. She has been in the cereals business for the last four years, during which time she has established her business, and she is now able to make a monthly profit of 40,000 KES.

Mary has applied for her first loan, which she plans to use to add more stock of cereals to her business. She hopes to use the anticipated profits to start another business and repay her loan.

In the future, Mary would like to educate her children to the highest level possible.

loans.use: To add more stock of maize

loans.name: Vishal Shg Group

texts.en:
The Vishal Self Help Group is a five-member team operating for more than three years. The group is managed by a local NGO called “People’s Action for Transformation” (PAT) in the Avikkarai village in Tamil Nadu, India. Neelavathi, the leader of the group, is married with three children. Her husband is a daily wage farm worker. 

The members of the group have received microfinance loans from PAT during these three years and have been making prompt and on-time payments. These loans have helped to improve the quality of their livelihoods, for which they are very grateful.
 
Neelavathi and her group have learned of a smokeless stove produced by Grameen Infra, which is cheaper than alternative stoves and uses less fuel. In addition, the stove can reduce indoor air pollution and provide a safer environment for their families. This is especially important because most group members’have young children who spend substantial time in and around the kitchen.

A Kiva loan can not only help provide this stove for the five group members, but also provide a healthier living space for their family.

***Full names of all borrowers (first and last) are required before submitting for approval***

loans.use: to buy a smokeless stove

loans.name: Dúo Amor Y Fe Group

texts.es:
Dúo Amor y Fe
Dúo formado por José Gerónimo de 28 años de edad originario del área de san Martin Jilotepeque. José se dedica desde hace más de seis años a la venta de suplementos alimenticios Omnilife El han sido una persona responsable en sus pagos y está agradecido con Fape y Kiva por el apoyo que le han brindado, ya que por medio de el prestamos está logrando sus metas de tener más inversión y por lo consiguiente generar ganancias. José solicita el crédito para la compra de batidos, vitaminas y suplementos alimenticios omnilife.
texts.en:
Dúo Amor y Fe [Love and Faith Duo], is a duo formed by José Gerónimo, age 28, who is from the area of San Martín Jilotepeque.  José has been selling Omnilife nutritional supplements for more than six years. 

He has been responsible with his payments, and he appreciates FAPE and Kiva for the support that they have given him, as by means of the loans, he is achieving his goals of investing more and therefore generating earnings.  José is requesting the loan for the purchase of Omnilife shakes, vitamins, and nutritional supplements.

loans.use: to purchase Omnilife products to sell.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en: Thomas, aged 41, is a married Ugandan man with three children, all of whom attend school. His business is poultry farming and he is involved in a range of activities like teaching, selling fresh food and mobile money transaction, which act as his additional income. With the loan, he wishes to buy chicks and chicken feed to expand his business. In doing all this, he hopes to merge all his businesses into one place and educate all his children. He too, has a number of challenges like the skyrocketing prices of chicken feed and drugs, heavy rains and bad roads making transportation of fresh foods to consumption places a barrier, thus ending with losses.

loans.use: to buy chicks and chicken feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy new games and networking machines for his shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his son’s education.

loans.name: El Artesano Group

texts.es:
ELAINE  mujer joven y emprendedora que vive en una comunidad del vecino Cantón Eloy Alfaro. Tiene 2 hijos varones de 11 y 4 años quienes asisten a los centros de formación académica.
Mientras ELAINE estudiaba, llego a tener su primer embarazo, tenía 19 años y sus hermanos mayores no permitieron que se hiciera a compromiso y que terminara sus estudios secundarios. Logró graduarse como bachiller y la suerte le acompañó que empezó a trabajar como profesora.
En la actualidad ella trabaja en su comunidad como asistente de contabilidad en la Junta Parroquial.
Con su primer crédito ella inicio el negocio de ventas de cosméticos por catalogo. 
Con el presente crédito ella implementara la venta de combustibles, ventas de sabanas y toldos a través de plan acumulativo- esto garantiza el pago de sus clientes.
Manifiesta que jamás una entidad financiera había llegado hasta su comunidad para conocer y ayudar a cubrir las necesidades de sus habitantes a través de un crédito.
INFORMACION ADICIONAL.
Su pueblo se encuentra a 2 horas de Camarones. La actividad principal de sus habitantes es la agricultura - la pesca – siembra de coco y plátano. Son 7 integrantes responsable de sus crédito y empeñados en la superación y progreso de su comunidad.
texts.en:
Elaine is a young, enterprising woman who lives in a neighboring community in Eloy Alfaro canton. She has two sons, 11 and 4 years of age, who attend school.

While she was in school Elaine became pregnant. She was 19 years old and her older siblings did not allow her to drop out and get engaged but insisted that she finish secondary school. She managed to graduate from high school and with luck began to work as a teacher. Currently she works in the community as assistant accountant for the Parish Council.

With her first loan she started a business selling cosmetics by catalog. With her current loan she will start selling fuel and sheets and awnings through a cumulative payment plan – this guarantees payment by her customers. 

She states that a financial entity had never come to her community before in order to meet the inhabitants and help them cover their necessities through loans.

Additional Information: Her village is two hours from Camarones. The principal business of its inhabitants is farming, the cultivation of coconuts and bananas, and fishing.  The group consists of seven members who are responsible for the loan and committed to the improvement and progress of their community.

loans.use: implement the sale of fuel and sheets and awnings to protect against malaria in her community.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a 36-year-old married woman and a mother of four children. Her husband is a farmer and his income is not enough to support his family. Before starting a milk production business, Amina's family often lived in hand-to-mouth conditions. 

Four years ago, she started a milk selling business with the help of her husband to support her family and secure the future of her children. Now, she has two cows and two buffaloes. She has good milk sales on a daily basis. Her customers are satisfied and give her value due to her honesty in business. 

She has shown very good credit behavior and currently is in her eighth loan cycle. Now, she requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase another cow. She wants to increase milk production according to customer needs and wishes to use profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase another cow.

loans.name: Men

texts.en:
Men is 49 years old. She is from Dhupguri. She is married to Sharat, aged 54 years. Both of them are uneducated and can sign their names only. They have only one son, who is deprived of education. As a result, he did not get any job. He works as a labourer under a contractor who rents decorating items for different occasions.  They live in the small village West Magurmari in the district of Jalpaiguri.

Men's husband is a farmer by profession. He works on their own ancestral land and grows vegetables, but his scanty income cannot provide the family with sufficient financial sustenance. Men is a hardworking entrepreneur. She has been running her own animal husbandry. She purchases piglets, and after fattening, sells them to the local people and to butchers. She has been in this business for the last five years and is a great financial support to her family.

To continue the business and to strengthen the financial condition of her family, she would like to carry on and expand the business by purchasing more piglets. So, she asked for a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner). She will utilize the loan to buy super-quality piglets and use the rest for food. She hopes she can earn a satisfactory profit and breed more pigs to enlarge her business.

She thanks her lenders (BJS and Kiva).

loans.use: To purchase piglets for her animal husbandry.

loans.name: Buddo School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Samson. He is the Head Teacher of Buddo College a mixed school in the Peri-urban area of Buddo, Wakiso District with 300 students. Buddo College has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Buddo School will repay this loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. This will be supplemented by the sale of carbon credits, which the school will generate from using the water tank. Samson ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Blue Print School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Sylvia. She is the Head Teacher of Blue Print Junior School, a mixed school in the Peri-urban area of Namugongo in Wakiso with 94 students. Blue Print School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a Tulip water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase Tulip Filtration water treatment system, with 4 Sets of 20 Litre Buckets which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Blue Print School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. This will be supplemented by the sale of carbon credits, which the school will generate from using the water tank. Sylvia ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve her student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Kamika Shg Group

texts.en:
Kamika Self Help Group is made up of eight women from a small village of Koraput district of Odisha, India. All the members of this group are involved in different activities, such as betel leaf cultivation, milk selling, paddy and vegetable cultivation, etc. They are very hardworking women, having a willingness to learn new business trends. They all help and support each other. Whatever they are earning from their businesses is used for their monthly household expenses. 

One of the group members, Manguli, who is a widow lady, is the president of this group. The lady standing second from the right in the first row is Manguli. Manguli is 41 years old and lives with her parents-in-law and two children. She does paddy cultivation. She produces paddy and sells it at the market. Her parents-in-laws engaged in farming activity. Her children help Manguli in paddy selling at the market. 

Manguli is planning to buy standard-quality seeds, fertilizers and pesticides, so she can produce more paddy and can increase her income. Manguli, along with her group members, is asking for a loan amount of 120,000 INR to invest in their business activities. Manguli will use her portion to purchase standard-quality seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for her paddy cultivation. 

She wants to construct a house for her family. She says, on behalf of the group members, "Thank you, Kiva, for providing this opportunity for us!"
