loans.use: to purchase standard-quality seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for her paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Highland School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Roy. He is the Head Teacher of Highland Secondary School, a mixed school in the Peri-urban area of Nabbingo in Wakiso with 146 students. Highland Secondary School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase an Ultra-filtration water treatment system with a 450 litre tank & pump, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Highland Secondary School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. This will be supplemented by the sale of carbon credits, which the school will generate from using the water tank. Roy ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Jesus Self Help Group

texts.en:
Sagaya is the team leader of the Jesus Self Help Group, which is managed by the NGO, People's Action for Transformation (PAT), in Tamil Nadu, India. She lives in a village, Pullangadi, in Trichy district.

Sagaya lives with her children and her husband, Vincent. Her husband works in an office.

The smokeless stove comes with a single burner, is highly efficient and designed for daily use. The cost is 1,400 rupees. With a traditional stove, there are chances of being affected by diseases such as lung cancer, asthma and tract infection, as a traditional stove emits a lot of smoke.

Sagaya, along with the other members, needs a loan to purchase a smokeless stove to have a better and healthier life.

loans.use: to purchase a smokeless stove.

loans.name: Josephat

texts.en: Josephat is a married man. He has 2 children. He describes himself as honest. He operates a transport business, where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for 2 years. His business is located in a secure area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be security threat. He will use the Kes 10,000 loan to repair and maintain his motorcycle. His business goal is to acquire a fleet of motorcycles within 5 years. This is his first loan with SMEP Micro finance Bank.

loans.use: repair and maintain his motorcycle

loans.name: Manzura

texts.ru: Манзура прекрасная мама пятерых детей. Ей 38 лет. У нее два сына и две дочки. Старшему сыну 18 лет, он находиться в Российской Федерации на заработках. Младшему сыну 7 месяцев. Дочери учатся в школе. Манзура с мужем в течение 11 лет работают на земле не покладая сил. На земельном участке они выращивают овощей. Они зарабатывают на жизнь от выращивания и продажи овощей. Сейчас на рынках много привозных фруктов и овощей и Манзуре становиться тяжелее конкурировать с ними. Она просит кредит, чтобы собрать спевший урожай и посадить новый. Для этого нужны средства, на которые она купить семена, минеральные удобрения и т.д. У Манзуры не хватает определенной суммы денег для совершения покупки, и она надеется на кредит.
texts.en: Manzura is a beautiful mother of five children. She is 38 years old. She has two sons and two daughters. The oldest son is 18 years old; he works in the Russian Federation. The youngest son is 7 months old. The daughters attend school. Manzura and her husband have been working on land for 11 years with all of their efforts. They grow vegetables on their land plot. They earn a living from growing and selling vegetables. Currently, there are a lot of imported fruits and vegetables at a market, and it is becoming difficult for Manzura to compete with them. She is requesting this loan to gather her harvest and plant a new one. She needs money to purchase seeds, mineral fertilizers, etc. Manzura is short of a certain sum of money to make this purchase and hopes for this loan.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizers for a new sowing

loans.name: Yao

texts.en: Yao is 30 years old and makes his living as a tailor. He is also married to a seamstress. They have two young children who are both in school. Yao makes clothes for both men and women and this loan of 300,000 FCFA will help him buy material and fabric for his business. This is Yao’s second loan with WAGES. His first loan was fully repaid. With this new loan, Yao hopes to continue growing his business and to work towards building a secure future for his family.

loans.use: To buy material and fabric for making clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for taxi repairs

loans.name: Steven

texts.en: Steven is a repeat customer. A resident of Kiyanja, Ntungamo district, his major activity is carpentry and trading lumber. He applied for loan of ugx.1,500,000 to add capital to his business. He has been in this business for over five years. He wants to use the money to buy trees from the nighbors then cut them and sell firewood and the rest he makes lumber, which he sells to the builders in neighboring places and Ntungamo towns. According to him he has many clients in the towns mentioned, but is limited by capital and that’s why he came to ugafode requesting for capital to improve his business. He thanks Ugafode for the financial assistance. Pictured is the client with the UGAFODE credit officer

loans.use: To buy trees for firewood and lumber for his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase high yielding grafted trees

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 36 years old, married, and has three children who attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Irene operates a fish vending business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for six years. 

Irene requested a loan from NWTF for 10,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall. In the future, Irene would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall

loans.name: Fulgencio Manuel

texts.es:
El señor Fulgencio es un agricultor muy habilidoso con experiencia en varias áreas de la agricultura, con un talento innato para el trabajo en equipo y una gran mente emprendedora.
Tiene un gran cultivo de yuca y plátano que atiende todos los días desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana.
Actualmente vive con su esposa y 3  de los 9 hijos que tiene y por las cuales ha tratado de luchar siempre para sacarlas adelante.
El desea darle un impulso a su cultivo y obtener mejores ingresos de este por eso pide un auxilio económico para invertirlo en insumos agropecuarios y semillas de yuca y plátano, el préstamo le dará la oportunidad de tener un producto de mejor calidad.
Su mayor sueño es tener una casa propia y brindarles a sus hijos un buen futuro.
texts.en:
Señor Fulgencio is a very skillful farmer, with experience in various areas of agriculture. He has an innate talent for teamwork, and a great entrepreneurial mind. He has large cultivations of yucca and plantains that he tends every day, starting in the very early hours of the morning. He lives with his wife and three of his nine children; and he has always tried to fight in order to provide for them. 

He wants to boost his cultivation, and in this way, make more income. This is the reason that he is requesting a loan. He will invest it in agricultural supplies, and in yucca and plantain seeds. The loan will give him the opportunity to have a better quality product. 

His greatest dream is to have his own house, and to give his children a good future.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for his tuition fees

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es: Teresa de 45 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo, ella posee una tienda desde hace 5 años en su domicilio, además vende ropa interior, con lo que gana de sus ventas ayuda a solventar algunas de las necesidades de su hogar, Teresa solicita un crédito para comprar más mercadería por mayor para su negocio como: azúcar, sopa, leche, golosinas, refrescos, etc.  y asi poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Teresa is 45 years old and lives in her own home along with her husband and son. She has run a store for 5 years out of her home. Besides grocery items, she also sells underwear. With what she earns, she takes care of household expenses. Teresa is asking for a loan in order to purchase more merchandise for her store like sugar, milk, sweets, sodas etc. This will help her to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: purchase sugar, milk, sweets, sodas etc.

loans.name: Ebeneza Group

texts.en:
Amina, who is in her late 30's, is married with three children.  Two of them are at school and one is still small.  She has been selling fish since 2013.  She works from 7am to 10pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Amina's 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She will use this loan to buy fish, cooking oil and firewood for frying the fish. She dreams of building her own house and to own a retail food shop.

Amina will share this loan with her loan group "EBENEZA", which has eight members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy fish, cooking oil and firewood for frying the fish.

loans.name: Forjadores Del Mañana Los Olivos Group

texts.es: Evelyn  de 39 años de edad es socia del grupo Forjadores Del Mañana Los Olivos con una duración de 3 años, es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos, tiene un negocio de venta de medicina natural al cual le dedica 10 horas al día desde hace 5 años y aprendió cuando era vendedora en una tienda, atiende alrededor de 20 clientes y público en general, aparte de este negocio se dedica  al alquiler de equipo de sonido y confecciona banderolas , solicito el préstamo para invertir en la compra de productos naturales para su negocio, se siente muy contenta agradecida con los inversionistas de KIVA porque gracias a ellos, ella podrá obtener mejoras para su negocio, envía muchos saludos y pide que sigan apoyando a los que mas lo necesitan.
texts.en:
Evelyn is 39 years old and has been a member of the communal bank Forjadores del Mañana Los Olivos for 3 years. She is married and has 2 children. She has a business selling natural medicine, which she works on 10 hours a day for 5 years, and learned when she was a saleswoman in a store. She serves about 20 clients and the general public. Aside from this business she rents out sound equipment and manufactures banners. 

She is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of natural products for her business. Evelyn is very grateful to the KIVA lenders because with their support she can improve her business. She sends her greetings and asks the lenders to continue to support those who need it most.

loans.use: to buy products for her natural medicine business.

loans.name: Amidatou

texts.en:
Amidatou is a 36-year-old seamstress and mother of two children. Her husband works in retail. Amidatou has her own shop where she has been making and selling clothes since 2001. 

This will be Amidatou’s first loan with Kiva, and she plans to use the loan for 300,000 FCFA to purchase fabric. Amidatou hopes that this loan will help her grow her business and increase the financial stability of her family. In the future, she hopes to open new shops where she can sell her clothing.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Caleb

texts.en: Caleb is a female Kiva borrower. She describes herself as determined. She operates a retail business where she prepares mandazi to sell. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a populated area and her primary customers are frequent customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stocks of ingredients for preparing mandazi (East African donuts). Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have frequent cash flow.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of ingredients for preparing mandazi (East African donuts).

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en: Samwel is a 36-year-old married man, who has 6 children. He describes himself as hardworking. He operates a transportation business where he provides transportation services. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. He describes his biggest business challenge to be price and fluctuation of fuel. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to repair the vehicle. His business goal is to grow his business.

loans.use: to repair the vehicle he uses for his transportation business

loans.name: El Castillo 2 Group

texts.es:
La localidad es 100% cañera por lo que la mayor parte de los habitantes trabajan en el campo. A una hora se encuentra la presa  y a 30 min. otra localidad que se caracteriza por la venta de mojarra y donde aún se habla la lengua materna llamada mazateco. En esta comunidad se creó un grupo llamado “El Castillo 2” conformado por 10 personas.

Alicia-venta de plantas de ornato, Margarita-calzado por catalogo, Evarista-venta de pollo, Daniela-venta de antojitos, Minerva-venta de refrescos, Eduardo-venta de masa y maíz, Lidia-venta de pasteles y pizza, Elodia-venta de tacos, Mariela-venta de calzado por catalogo.

La señora Minerva Alicia se ha dedicado a vender pollo destazado desde hace ya 6 años, ella se levanta desde muy temprano para aliñar los pollos que venderá en el día. Ella inició la venta de pollo para apoyar a su esposo,  gracias a los préstamos que se le han otorgado ha logrado crecer poco a poco con su negocio. Minerva mencionó que ahora comprara mas pollos y maya para ampliar el corral para que no se escapen los animales. Contar con el apoyo de su esposo es algo de gran motivación, con las ganancias han remodelado la casa y sustentando los gastos de la misma.

Con las ganancias que ella obtenga, ahorrará para comprar una peladora de pollo de esta manera le sera más fácil tener listo el pollo y podrá descansar un poco más.

Asimismo, hablando acerca del grupo, los miembros mencionaron: el formar parte del grupo les hace ser una familia y por lo mismo siempre han tratado ir todos a la par" hablando acerca de su responsabilidad y trabajo en equipo.
texts.en:
The location is 100% sugarcane.  Therefore, most of the inhabitants work in the field.  The dam is one hour away, and 30 minutes away is another place known for selling 'mojarra ' [a fish].  The people there still speak their maternal language, Mazateco. The El Castillo 2 group was created in this community, and it is comprised of ten members.  

Alicia sells ornamental plants, Margarita sells shoes by catalog, Evarista sells chicken, Daniela sells snacks, Minerva sells soft drinks, Eduardo sells dough and corn, Lidia sells cakes and pizza, Elodia sells tacos, Mariela sells shoes by catalog.

Minerva Alicia has been selling butchered chicken for six years.  She gets up very early to dress the chickens that she will sell during the day.  She started selling chicken to support her husband.  Thanks to the loans that have been given to her, she has managed to grow little by little in her business.  Minerva mentioned that she will now buy more chickens and chicken wire to expand the coop where she puts them so that they do not get away.  Having her husband's support is a big motivation.  With the profits, she has remodeled the house and paid for those expenses.  With the profits that she gets she will save to buy a chicken skinner.  This way it will be easier for her to have the chicken ready, and she will be able to sleep a little more.  

Being part of the communal bank makes everyone a family, and they have always tried to join our efforts.

loans.use: to buy chicken and chicken wire for the chicken coop.

location.town: Tembladeras del castillo, Acatlan de Perez Figuero

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell for her vegetable vending business.

Josefina has been in this business for four years. Josefina earns more income from her general store.

Josefina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Tukwatanize Nyamondo Group

texts.en:
Eria is a 29-year-old married man living in Kagadi Uganda with 4 children, 2 of whom attend school. He deals in produce alongside animal rearing since 2009 to improve his house hold income. Eria is hoping to educate his family and to grow his business into a large produce store serving many customers. He intends to use the loan to buy more beans and maize to sell. He is a member of Tukwatanize Nyamondo Group, where each member guarantees the other to get a loan since they don’t pledge securities.
The extra person in the photo is a group member who has guaranteed others but has not taken a loan.

loans.use: to buy beans and maize to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase livestock and supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to help her coffee plants.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy enough meat for her to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy oil for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase high yielding cacao trees

loans.name: Santos Balbina

texts.es:
La señora Santos Balbina de 62 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus dos nietos, en su casa propia, se dedica desde hace 35 años al negocio de pulpería que es venta de abarrotería en genera.
Doña Santos Balbina en su negocio también vende insumos para sembrar, venenos, machetes y otros mas,  vive en una aldea de Choluteca, al sur de Honduras,  es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Doña Santos Balbina está solicitando el préstamo para compra de productos como maíz, frijoles, café, aguas, leche, azúcar, aceité, etc. también desea surtir con mas insumos machetes, limas y botas de hule, con el apoyo de este crédito pretende mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida, es una cliente nueva con deseos de trabajar con Prisma y prosperar en su negocio.
Su sueño es tener un buen negocio y aumentar su clientela  y al mismo  tiempo mejorar su casa en un futuro junto a su familia.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Junio de 2014
texts.en:
Santos Balbina is 62 years old and lives with her husband and two grandchildren in their family home. For the past 35 years, she has run a grocery store.

At her store, Santos Balbina also sells planting supplies, pesticides, machetes and other similar products. She lives in a village in Choluteca, in the south of Honduras.

She is an enterprising woman with a drive to succeed and strive daily to improve her quality of life.

Santos Balbina is requesting this loan to purchase products such as corn, beans, coffee, water, milk, sugar, oil, etc. She also would like to stock more products such as machetes, metal files, and oilcloth bags. With the support of this loan, she hopes to improve her income and quality of life. She is a new client of Prisma and hopes to work with them to make her business proper.

Her dream is to have a good business and increase her clientele, at the same time improving her house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase corn, beans, coffee, water, milk, sugar, cooking oil, metal files, machetes, and oilcloth bags

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es: Manuel tiene 26 años  de edad y habita junto a su compañera de vida, suegra y su cuñado de 7 años de edad. Manuel es un artesano que hace  maravillas a base de madera y residuos de coco, etc. Todas sus artesanías las vende de forma ambulante y en su casa desde hace 12 años. Tiene muchos clientes y cada día lo prefieren más. Con el deseo de mejorar sus condiciones de vida ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de los materiales necesarios para la elaboración de las artesanías como: tientes, pitas de ceda de colores, barniz, pega, remaches, tornillos, etc.
texts.en: Manuel is 26 years old and lives with his wife, mother in law, and his brother in law who is 7 years old. Manuel is an artisan who makes marvelous crafts from wood and coconut shells. He sells his work as a street vendor and from his house. He has been doing this for 12 years. He has a lot of customers and, every day, more and more people come to give him their business. He wants to improve his living conditions and he has made the decision to ask for a loan through FUSAI so he can invest in purchasing materials he needs to continue his artisanal work. He will purchase stains, varnish, glue, rivets, screws etc.

loans.use: purchase supplies for his artisanal work.

loans.name: Mercelyne

texts.en:
Mercelyne is a married woman with two children. She describes herself to be future-oriented and honest. She operates a vegetable stall where she sells tomatoes, eggs, cooking fat, omena (a type of fish), onions, and matchboxes. She has been involved in this business for two years. She describes her biggest business challenge to be not having enough stock. 

She will use the KES 10,000 loan to purchase additional stock of vegetables. Her business goal is to expand the business to include a cereal shop within five years. She hopes in the future to use the profits from her business to pay her children's fees. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of vegetables.

loans.name: Hermenegildo

texts.pt:
O Sr. Hermenegildo de 30 anos de idade, casado e pai de 4 filhos dos quais 2 estao a frequentar a escola no ensino primario e 2 sao menor de idade ainda nao frequentam  a escola, sustenta a sua mae. Ele è carregador de caixa na empresa de producao de banana a mais de 2 anos.
 Com o presente emprestimo sera aplicado para comprar material de construcao (barrotes, chapas de zinco e pagamento de mao-de-obra) para dar continuidade com a construcao da sua casa.
texts.en:
Hermenegildo is 30 years old and is married with four children. Two of his children attend elementary school and the other two are very young and haven't started school yet. Hermenegildo also supports his mother financially. For more than two years he has worked loading boxes in a company that produces bananas.

With this loan he will buy construction materials like metal bars and zinc plates, and pay workers to help continue building his house.

loans.use: buy construction materials like metal bars and zinc plates, and to pay workers to help finish building his house.

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es: Ana Julio usó el crédito anterior para mejorar un cuarto en su vivienda y así poco a poco ha ido mejorando su calidad de vida, terminó de pagar su crédito sin ningún problema. En esta ocasión solicita el crédito para cambiar el techo de su vivienda que se encuentra en mal estado, y para cambiar el portón de su vivienda, ya que la época de invierno ha entrado y le afectará enormemente por que el agua se introducirá en su vivienda. Espera no tener ningún problema con este crédito, ya que sus planes son seguir mejorando su vivienda, su siguiente proyecto será hacer más grande el porche.
texts.en: Ana Julio used her previous loan in order to improve her bedroom in her home and, little by little, she has continued to improve her quality of life. She finished paying back her previous loan without any problems. For her next loan, she is asking for a credit in order to replace her roof, which is in bad shape, and to replace her front gate. The winter season has arrived and it will affect her a lot because water always drips into her home. She hopes she won't have any problems with this loan. Her future plans are to continue to improve her home and her next project will be to build a porch.

loans.use: replace her roof and front gate.

loans.name: Komla

texts.en: Komla is a single 31-year-old man. He has a shop where he sells cameras and cellphones in Lomé, the capital of Togo. This will be Komla’s fifth loan with WAGES. He has fully repaid all of his previous loans. Komla plans to use his loan to increase his stock of cameras and cellphones for his business. He has used his increased profits from previous loans to reinvest and grow his business. Komla hopes to get married soon, so building a strong business will allow him to support his future family.

loans.use: to buy mobile phones and cameras to sell.

loans.name: Alfredo Silvestre

texts.pt:
O Sr. Alfredo de 32 anos de idade, casado e pai de 3 filhos todos a frequentar a escola no ensino primario. Ele è tractorista na empresa de producao de banana.
Com o presente emprestimo sera aplicado para comprar material de construcao (chapas de cinco, cimento, barrotes e pagamento de mao-de-obra) para dar continuidade a sua obra.
Tem como grande desafio melhor as condicoes de habitacao e a dieta alimentar.
texts.en:
Alfredo is 32 years old and is married with three children, all of whom are in elementary school. He works driving a tractor at a company that produces bananas.

With this loan Alfredo will buy construction materials like zinc plates, cement and metal bars, and pay workers to help with his home construction project. His main goals are to improve his family's living conditions and diet.

loans.use: buy construction materials like zinc plates, cement and metal bars, and pay workers to help with his home construction project.

loans.name: Albino

texts.pt:
O Sr. Albino de 37 anos de idade casado e pai de 2 filhos que estao a frequentar   escola no  ensino primario e secundario. Ele è carregador de caixa na empresa de producao de banana e è tambem negociante informal de produtos da primeira necessidade na sua casa, actividade que esta a ser acompanhada junto com sua esposa, seus produtos vende na porta da sua casa e por encomenda na empresa de producao de banana.
Com o presente emprestimo sera aplicado para comprar material de construcao (cimento, blocos, chapas de zinco, pedra e pagamento de mao-de-obra) para dar continuidade a sua casa.
texts.en:
Albino is 37 years old and is married with two children. One child is in elementary school and the other is in high school. Albino works loading boxes at a company that produces bananas, and he also has a side business selling everyday products from his house. His wife helps with this second business, and they sell goods from their front door and also on order from the banana production company.

With this loan, Albino will buy construction materials like cement, zinc plates, stones and blocks, and pay workers to continue construction of his house.

loans.use: buy construction materials like cement, zinc plates, stones and blocks, and pay workers to continue construction of his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy iron, steel sheets, metal, electrodes etc.

loans.name: Akoffa

texts.en:
Akoffa is 30 years old. Her husband is an electrician, and they have two children - a two-year-old, and a nine-year-old who is in school.

She has been selling charcoal from her home for the past four years. This will be Akoffa’s second loan with WAGES. She plans to use the 400,000 XOF loan to purchase more stock, with the goal of eventually opening her own store. 

Akoffa’s hope for the future is to be able to provide a good education for both of her children.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Kinole Group

texts.en:
Fatuma is in her mid-thirties and has got three school-aged children. She is married and sells fried fish - a business she has been doing for six years. She wakes up early in the morning, travels by bus to the fish market where she buys the fish, cleans them and sometimes fries them, and then goes back home to resell. She finishes her business at 11pm every day and is able to make a fair monthly income. 

She is requesting a third loan through Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans, since repaid, to buy fish, cooking oil and firewood for frying fish. Fatuma made extra income from these loans which she used to cover school fees and household expenses. In the coming years, she would like to build a house. 

She will use this loan to buy a stock of fish and cooking oil for frying fish. 

Fatuma will share this loan with her loan group "Kinole" which consists of twelve members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy a stock of fish and cooking oil for fish frying.

loans.name: Sulma Judith

texts.es: Sulma de 31 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con su hija, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa casual desde hace seis años y también ropa interior, vende de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias y mercados, es muy conocida como una persona responsable y trabajadora, con las ganancias  de sus ventas lleva el sustento diario a su hogar, Sulma solicita un crédito para la compra de pantalones, blusas, faldas, camisas, licras, etc. por mayor para tener una mejor calidad de vida junto con su hija sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Sulma is 31 years old, she is a single mother and lives in her own house with her daughter. 

She has sold casual clothing for six years as well as underwear. She is a mobile seller around the local areas and markets. She is well known for being a responsible and hardworking person. With her profits she provides her family with their daily needs.

Sulma is asking for a loan to buy trousers, blouses, skirts, shirts, stretch clothing etc. wholesale, to have a better quality of life together with her daughter without any constraints.

loans.use: to buy trousers, blouses, skirts, shirts, stretch clothing etc. wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more goods to sell,  including oil, rice, salt, and pepper

loans.name: Estefany Esther

texts.es:
Estefany es una joven muy emprendedora y con grandes sueños para cumplir en su vida.
Desde hace algunos meses se dedica a la venta de productos por catalogo como ropa, accesorios, artículos de belleza, entre otros, estos productos los vende principalmente a amigos, vecinos y familiares. 
Hoy en día tiene grandes habilidades en este campo gracias a su simpatía y excelente calidad de servicio que utiliza con sus clientes para atenderlos de una muy buena manera.
Solicita un préstamo para realizar la compra de surtido de mercancía que le permita fortalecer su inventario y tener más productos disponibles para ofrecer a sus clientes, esto se verá reflejado positivamente en su economía.
Tiene la esperanza de poder salir adelante y continuar con sus estudios universitarios.
texts.en:
Estefany is a very entrepreneurial young woman with big dreams she wishes to accomplish in her life. For several months she has been selling products through catalogs such as clothing, accessories, and beauty products, among others. She sells these products mainly to friends, neighbors, and family. She currently has great skills in this field, thanks to her charm and excellent quality of service she uses to take good care of her customers.

She is requesting a loan to purchase an assortment merchandise that will allow her to build her inventory and have more products to offer her customers, which will positively affect her income. She hopes to be successful and continue with college.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her business.

loans.name: Lila Ofelia

texts.es:
Lila es una joven emprendedora, tiene 19 años de edad, es soltera y vive en San Juan de Lurigancho junto a su familia. Su mayor motivación en la vida es su familia, es por ellos que lucha constantemente para poder brindarles una mejor calidad de vida.
Desde hace más de 1 año se dedica a la venta de jugos y le va muy bien porque es una persona muy responsable, trabajadora, innovadora y sobre todo porque tiene muchos clientes debido a que ofrece jugos de calidad.
Lila está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá comprar un Televisor para que de esta manera su familia pueda disfrutar de sus momentos libres juntos. Con esto ella continuará esforzándose día a día para sacar adelante a su familia y más adelante poder: "Tener su propio negocio".
texts.en:
Lila is an enterprising young woman. She is 19 years old and single; she lives in San Juan de Lurigancho with her family. Her biggest motivation in life is her family; it's because of them that she struggles constantly to be able to provide them with a better quality of life. 

For more than one year, she has earned her living selling juices. It is going very well for her because she is a very responsible, hard-working, and innovative person, and above all, because she has a lot of customers due to the high-quality juices she sells.

Lila is grateful to the Kiva lenders because the support they have provided to her enables her to purchase a television so that her family will be able to enjoy their free time together. With it, she will continue striving day after day to provide for her family and, in the future, to be able to have her own shop.

loans.use: to buy a television

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
Roberto de 31 años de edad,  estudio hasta séptimo grado, solo hasta ese nivel había en la escuela de su domicilio y el pueblo le quedaba muy lejos para continuar en el siguiente nivel.

Esta acompañado su esposa es ama de casa se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y a la atención de su bebe que esta de pocos días de haber nacido, es el primer hijo que tienen, además él vive con sus padres y hermanos en total son 9 miembros en la familia.

Él siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura junto a su padre y hermanos lleva más de 20 años, ya que su padre le enseño desde pequeño.  El lugar de trabajo les queda a tres kilómetros de su casa caminan 40 minutos para llegar, sus demás hermanos también colaboran en las actividades agrícolas trabajan todos los días 8 horas diarias y a veces más.

El crédito lo necesita para mejorar el techo de su vivienda,  ya que se encuentra en muy malas condiciones, comprara madera aserrada y pago la mano de obra de un carpintero para que realice esta estructura y así poder tener un hogar más bonito y no estar preocupados que el techo pasara el agua de las lluvias o peor aún que se vaya a caer.

Roberto sueña a futuro poder construir su propia casa y que su hijo crezca sano y tenga un hogar digno y que se prepare académicamente, él espera que con la ayuda de este crédito que solicita puedan mejorar la casa para solucionar este problema y que toda su familia viva en un lugar bonito.
texts.en:
Roberto is 31 years old and studied through the seventh grade since that was the highest level he could achieve at the school in his hometown. The next town was too far away for him to continue to the next level.

Roberto is in a relationship and his wife is a homemaker who takes care of the household chores and looks after their baby who was born a few days ago. This is their first child. In addition, Roberto lives with his parents and siblings, so there are a total of nine members in his family.

Roberto has always been devoted to farming, having worked with his father and siblings for more than 20 years. His father taught him at a young age. The place where he works is located three kilometers from his house, which is a 40 minute walk. His other siblings also participate in the farming activities. They all work eight hours a day, but sometimes more.

The loan he is requesting will be used to improve the roof of the family house, which is in very bad condition. He will buy lumber and pay for a carpenter to handle the work. As a result, he will have a very nice place and not have to worry about the roof leaking when it rains, or even worse, caving in.

Roberto dreams of building his own house in the future where his child can grow up healthy, have a decent home, and become prepared academically. He hopes that, with the help of the loan he requested, he can improve the house and resolve this problem so that his entire family can have a nice place in which to live.

loans.use: to buy lumber and to pay a carpenter to repair the roof.

loans.name: Sandra Elizabeth

texts.es:
Sandra, ha tenido un impacto favorable en su negocio al utilizar de buena manera el crédito anterior, puesto que mejoro la variedad de sandalias, surtió la tienda e inicio la venta de meriendas, sus ingresos extras no incrementaron mucho pero le han ayudado a subsistir junto a su familia y a cancelar su deuda.
Sandra se decidió por solicitar un nuevo crédito para renovar su inventario y ofrecer a sus clientes productos de que están de moda, comprara variedad sandalias, aceite, yuca, plátanos, gas propano, leña, etc., fortalecerá el negocio y tendrá la materia prima para elaborar la venta de meriendas
texts.en:
Sandra put her previous loan to good use and her business experienced a favorable impact. Her shop improved since she was able to acquire a variety of sandals. She also started selling snacks. Her extra income did not increase by much, but she was still able to support her family and pay off her debt.

Sandra decided to request a new loan so that she could replenish her inventory and offer fashionable products to her customers. She will buy a variety of sandals, as well as oil, cassava, bananas, propane gas, firewood, and other supplies. This will strengthen her business and enable her to have the supplies that are needed for preparing and selling snacks.

loans.use: to buy supplies for preparing snacks and to acquire a variety of sandals to sell.

loans.name: Henry Adolfo

texts.es:
Henry un hombre de 29 años de edad que como muchos sueña con tener un negocio propio y una gran casa que sea de su propiedad, pero como soñar en un país donde son tan escasas las oportunidades, donde trabajas por un salario que en muchas ocasiones solo te da para sostener tus necesidades básicas. 
Henry es un hombre muy positivo y cree que todo con esfuerzo, humildad y honestidad se puede lograr por ello quiere iniciar su propio negocio de venta y comercialización de ropa y calzado los cuales ha tenido experiencia vendiendo gracias a sus hermanos, para ello quiere solicitar un crédito que le permita iniciar con esta idea de negocio y luchar el mismo por sus sueños sin esperar nada de nadie siempre persiguiendo con perseverancia sus metas ys abe que tiene todas las facultades para hacerlos. 
El crédito lo invertirá en compra de ropa para hombre y dama y zapatos deportivos, cabe aclarar la gran importancia de este crédito para Henry pues será el inicio de una OJALA futura vida de éxitos que le espera.
texts.en:
Henry is a 29 year old man who dreams of having his own business and a big house of his own, but these are big dreams in a country where one works for a salary that is just enough to maintain one’s basic needs.

Henry is a very positive man who believes that with all his efforts, humility, and honesty one can succeed and he wants to start his own business selling clothing and shoes.  He has had experience with this, thanks to his brothers.  He is asking for this loan to start this business and work toward his dreams, without expecting anything for anyone.  He will always pursue his goals because he knows that he has the ability to do so.

He will use the money from this loan to buy men’s and women’s clothing and sports shoes.  This will be an important loan for Henry because it will hopefully mean the beginning of a new successful future.

loans.use: to stock his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more goods to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beverages to offer for sale

loans.name: Baasankhuu

texts.en: Baasankhuu, 28 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He began rendering taxi service to local people two years ago. His wife recently gave birth and currently is staying at home, looking after their infant. Using his previous loan, he installed a low pressure heater into his house, creating a comfortable living environment for his family. Now he is requesting a loan of 1,400,000 MNT to buy vacuum-insulated windows as a protection against dust and debris. By doing so, he can prevent any harm falling on his vulnerable wife and newly-born child. Also in cold weather, vacuum-insulated windows will not pass heat through, preserving energy at home.

loans.use: to buy vacuum-insulated windows

loans.name: Reina Cecilia

texts.es: Reina de 39 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, desde hace varios años que Reina se dedica al oficio de corte y confección, tiempo en el cual ha ido adquiriendo mucha experiencia como también clientes fijos. Ella es una persona muy responsable, quien trabaja con mucho esmero por dar lo mejor de sí. Reina solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda invertir en su negocio, comprando mayor cantidad de materia prima como: telas, botones, hilos, y agujas, para poder atender mejor a los clientes  y no perder la oportunidad de obtener ganancias extras y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Reina, age 39, lives in her own house with her husband and their two children.  Reina has been making clothes for several years.  During this time she has been gaining much experience and fixed customers.  She is a very responsible person who works with great care to do her best.

Reina is requesting a loan in order to be able to invest in her business.  She will buy a greater quantity of raw materials like fabric, buttons, thread, and needles.  She will do this in order to be able to better tend to her customers, to not lose the opportunity to get extra earnings, and to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fabric, buttons, thread, and needles in bulk.

loans.name: Oscar Amildo

texts.es: Oscar de 38  años de edad vive en casa propia, con su esposa y tres hijos  de 18, 16 y 12 años ellos estudian actualmente, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, comercializa sus productos n los alrededores de la zona donde el reside con lo que logra de sus ganancias lleva el sustento diario a su hogar, Oscar solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas para el cultivo de maíz y frijol como semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc.  para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Oscar, age 38, lives in his own house with his wife and their three children.  The children are ages 18, 16, and 12, and they currently go to school.

He grows corn and beans.  He sells his products in areas outlying from where he lives.  With what he manages to earn, he brings home the daily sustenance.

Oscar is requesting a loan to buy agricultural supplies for his corn and bean crops.  He will buy things like seeds, fertilizer, compost, and pesticides, etc. in order to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, compost, and pesticides, etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy slippers to offer for sale

loans.name: Central Group

texts.es:
JISELA. Madre soltera desde hace 8 años. Ella tiene 34 años. Tiene 2 hijas de 13 y 9 años ellas asisten normalmente a clases.
Vive en Rocafuerte y tiene aspiraciones a futuro de tener su tienda mas grande, de tal forma que los habitantes tengan un lugar donde comprar de todo y no tener que viajar a Esmeraldas para poder conseguir los productos de primera necesidad mensualmente.
Hace 7 años puso una tienda de abarrotes, con la que ha podido ayudarse económicamente para gastos de educación, salud y alimentación. Además vende productos por catálogos.
Con el presente crédito comprará al por mayor arroz, aceite y jabón  ya que son los productos que se consumen masivamente y la gente sale a buscarlos a las ciudades cercanas. 
Menciona que su comunidad tiene atractivos hermosos y su gente es muy amable. Que sería bueno compartir esta información para que muchos amigos en el exterior nos visiten algún día.  
La llegada de FODEMI  a nuestra comunidad revive la esperanza de los pequeños comerciantes. 
El grupo al que pertenece se llama “CENTRAL” y está conformado por 9 personas de la misma comunidad.
texts.en:
Jisela has been a single mother for 8 years. She is 34 years old. She has two daughters, aged 13 and 9, that attend school regularly. She lives in Rocafuerte and has future aspiration to have a large store where people can buy everything and not have to travel far to get staples monthly in Esmeraldas. 
Seven years ago, she established a grocery store with which she could them financially with education expenses, health, and food. She also sells products through catalogs. With this loan she will buy wholesale rice, cooking oil, and soap since they are products that are massively consumed and people have to go searching for them in nearby cities. 
She mentions that this community has beautiful attractions and its people are very friendly. It is good to share this information so that many friends from abroad visit someday.
The arrival of FODEMI in the community revives hope for small entrepreneurs. The group she belongs to is called "CENTRAL" and consists of 9 people from the same community.

loans.use: to purchase in-demand staple products for her store

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente de 24 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijo, él se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pijamas desde hace alguno años, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia y también vende de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias que se encentran cerca de su casa, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra salir adelante con los gastos que se le presenta en su hogar, el cliente solicita  un crédito para la compra de tela esponjada de varios estilos y colores, hilos, elástico, etc. para seguir con su trabajo y  darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
This borrower is 24 years old and lives in his own home along with his wife and child. He has been manufacturing and selling pajamas for a few years. His business is located in his home and he also sells as a street vendor by going to different neighborhoods near his house. With the income he generates from his sales, he is able to keep up with the household expenses.

The borrower is requesting a loan in order to buy fluffy fabric in various styles and colors, thread, elastic, and other supplies. This will enable him to continue his work so that he can provide a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy fluffy fabric, thread, elastic, and other supplies for making pajamas.

loans.name: Oscar Antonio

texts.es: Oscar de 55 años de edad vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos mayores, la casa es propia, el se dedica al cultivado de maíz y de frijol, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en sacos así como los muestra la fotografía para luego salir a comercializarlos a los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa con las ventas que el hace logra sustentar algunas de las necesidades que su familia necesita, Oscar solicita un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. para darle a su familia un mejor nivel de vida sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: Oscar is 55 years old and lives with his wife and two adult children.  He owns his home and raises corn and beans.  When his harvest is ready in sacks, as shown in the photograph, he goes out to sell them at the various markets near his home and supports his family’s needs through the sales.  Oscar is asking for this loan to buy fertilizers, compost, insect controls, etc. to provide a better life for his family without limit.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Claudia Margarita

texts.es: Claudia tiene 36 años de edad y habita en casa propia heredada por su madre junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos de 13 años y 11 años de edad, además vive con ellos un tío. Claudia es un mujer muy trabajadora quien se gana la vida por medio de la venta de lorocos, queso, mangos y leche. La venta la realiza de forma ambulante desde hace 2 años y gracias a su carisma y buenos precios de sus productos ya cuenta con muchos clientes que cada día la prefieren más. Claudia solicita este crédito a FUSAI puesto que desea invertir en su negocio en la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería. Con el monto solicitado comprará: mangos, lorocos, quesos, leche, etc.
texts.en: Claudia is 36 years old and lives in her own house that she inherited from her mother. She lives with her life partner and their two children aged 13 and 11 years old. She also lives with an uncle. Claudia is a very hardworking woman who makes a living selling edible flowers called lorocos, cheese, mangoes, and milk. She has sold as an ambulant vendor for 2 years. Thanks to her charisma and the good prices of her products, she already has many customers who prefer her more every day. Claudia requests this loan from FUSAI to invest in her business by purchasing many goods. With the amount requested she will buy mangoes, lorocos, cheese, milk, and more.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and dairy products to sell

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es: Carlos a lo largo de estos años ha solicitado sus créditos tanto para mejorar su vivienda, como para invertirlo en su negocio, en todos los créditos ha demostrado ser una persona responsable pagando en tiempo sus obligaciones. En esta ocasión solicita el crédito para hacer una habitación en su vivienda. Comprará materiales de construcción como bloques, perlines, hierro y piedrín. Su esposa tiene una pulpería y le ayuda con los gastos del hogar. Su siguiente meta después de este préstamo es hacer otra habitación para su hija mayor.
texts.en:
Over the years Carlos has asked for loans to improve his house as well as invest in his business. In all his loans he has shown to be a responsible person, paying back on time.

On this occasion he is asking for a loan to make a room for his house. He will buy construction materials such as blocks, purlins, iron and gravel.

His wife owns a grocery store and helps him with the household expenses. His next goal after this loan is to make another room for his eldest daughter.

loans.use: to construct a room in his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock her store with various products

loans.name: G.s San Miguel Group

texts.es:
La señora Eugenia es una mujer emprendedora y dedicada a su negocio que es la venta de tortillas de maíz, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 16 años, su actividad de venta de tortilla la realiza en su casa de habitación y atiende personalmente a sus clientes todos los días de la semana.
Doña Eugenia se levanta muy temprano a vender su producto y sus clientes son las personas que viven en su misma colonia y comedores de la ciudad del Paraíso, su negocio le ayuda de gran manera, porque las ganancias le sirven para cubrir sus gastos personales, de igual manera le ha ayudado a mejorar su nivel de vida familiar.
Doña Eugenia está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de producto como maíz, leña y cal para su negocio y obtener más ganancias, solicita el préstamo de manera grupal con las siguientes personas, Doña Catalina se dedica al comercio sus ingresos los obtiene de su negocio venta de tortillas, actividad que realiza desde hace 10 años.
Doña Marlín se dedica al comercio sus ingresos los obtiene de su negocio, venta de tortillas actividad que realiza desde hace 2 años.
Doña Iris se dedica al comercio sus ingresos los obtiene de su negocio, venta de tortillas, actividad que realiza desde hace 2 años esperan que con los ingresos que obtengan puedan mejorar sus negocios y seguir apoyando a su familia e hijos.

Danlí, Honduras – Junio  2014
texts.en:
Eugenia is an enterprising woman who devotes herself to her business of selling corn tortillas.  She has been engaged in this business activity for 16 years.  She sells the tortillas at her house, and she personally tends to her customers every day of the week.

Eugenia gets up very early to sell her product.  Her customers are the people who live in her neighborhood and the eateries in the city of Paraíso.  Her business helps her a great deal because the earnings cover her personal expenses.  They have also helped to improve her family’s standard of living.

Eugenia is requesting the loan to buy products like corn, firewood, and lime powder for her business and to get more income.  She is requesting the loan as a group with the following people:

Catalina, who has been selling tortillas for ten years
Marlín, who has been selling tortillas for two years
Iris, who has been selling tortillas for two years

They hope that with the income they get they are able to improve their businesses and to continue supporting their families and children.

Danlí, Honduras – June, 2014

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, and lime powder for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy food items such as rice, salt, red oil, and onions for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy goods such as rice, salt, red oil, and union to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: will use the money to buy enough goods for baking to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fabric, a sewing machine and a generator.

loans.name: Sandra Aku

texts.en:
Sandra is a third year student at Health Concern Ghana and desires to be a nurse in future. She accessed this loan to enable her pay for her school fees.
The completion of her studies would provide her the needed skills to achieve her goal of caring for the sick and also give her financial independence. She can also cater for her siblings education since her dad is deceased and her mother does not earn enough to cater to all of her siblings.

Educating the community on healthy living inspires her most because there are a lot of issues which may be a detriment to their health. That gives her the drive to do better in her education and to put smiles on their faces.

Without this loan she would have to quit school and work for some years in order to save some money. She has younger siblings and family who are looking to her for support.

She would want investors around the world to invest in her country because it is peaceful and the people are hospitable.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition fee and textbooks.

loans.name: Feng

texts.en: Feng is 32 years old, married, and has four children. She makes and sells elei printed material (traditional Samoan dyed cloth) to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. Feng has requested a loan to buy material, fabric paint, stencils, brushes, rollers, carved wooden designs, and a new cutter. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy material, fabric paint, stencils, brushes, rollers, carved wooden designs, and a new cutter

loans.name: Tuvalu

texts.en: Tuvalu is a 43-year-old single mother of seven children. She makes and sells fruit salads in her community to earn a living. She has one year of experience with this business. Tuvalu needs a loan to buy a case of milk, a bag of sugar, roasted peanuts, a bottle of vanilla, some pawpaw and pineapples. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Tuvalu became a member of SPBD this year.

loans.use: to buy a case of milk, a bag of sugar, roasted peanuts, a bottle of vanilla, some pawpaw and pineapples

loans.name: Sina

texts.en: Sina is 34 years old and married with four children. She owns and operates a small store, selling a variety of items. She has been doing this for one year. Sina needs a loan to buy a new display refrigerator, a chest freezer, snacks, frozen goods, canned food, and sacks of onions and potatoes. She hopes to use her profits to pay for the renovation of her house and help pay for her children's education. She became a member of SPBD this year to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy a new display refrigerator, a chest freezer, snacks, frozen goods, canned food, and sacks of onions and potatoes

loans.name: Delaine

texts.en: Delaine is a 45-year-old single woman with no children. She makes and sells fruit salads in her community to earn a living. She has two years of experience with this business. Delaine needs a loan to buy a case of milk, a bag of sugar, roasted peanuts, a bottle of vanilla, a bunch of ripe bananas, some pawpaw and pineapples. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Delaine became a member of SPBD this year.

loans.use: to buy a case of milk, a bag of sugar, roasted peanuts, a bottle of vanilla, a bunch of ripe bananas, some pawpaw and pineapples

loans.name: Rafael Alfonso

texts.es: Rafael es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora el cual vive con su esposa en casa propia, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en sacos así como los muestra la fotografía, para luego comercializarlos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, Rafael esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de abonos, semillas, foliares, etc. para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Rafael is a very responsible and hard-working person who lives with his wife in their own house. He works growing maize and beans. When his harvest is ready, he stores it in bags like those shown in the photo, in order to sell it afterwards in different markets near to his home.

Rafael is asking for a loan to buy items such as fertilisers, seeds and foliar pesticides in order to provide his family with a better quality of life without limits.

loans.use: to buy items such as fertilisers, seed and foliar pesticides.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys is a 27-year-old married woman with two children. She describes herself as focused. She operates a general store where she sells a variety of goods. She has been involved in this business for five years. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase additional stock, specifically tea leaves, to expand her business. Her goal is to be a better business woman within five years.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock, specifically tea leaves, to expand her business

loans.name: Yahaya Jalo

texts.en: Yahaya Jalo is a 25 -year-old farmer from Pegi. As a Babban Gona member, Yahaya Jalo is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Yahaya Jalo can earn up to $2000/hectare this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Yahaya Jalo is ambitious and is aiming to reap 40 bags/hectare this season. When asked, Yahaya Jalo said “I plan to use the money I make to educate my children Isah and Jalo,” and in five years to “make more money for myself and my family." With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: to access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, an over-sewing machine, a table, and fabric

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, over sewing machine and table.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy an embroidery machine and air-conditioner.

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en: Samwel is a 34-year-old married man who has four children. He describes himself as honest. He operates a tuk tuk business providing transportation. He has been involved in this business for five years. He describes his biggest business challenge to be access to capital. He will use the KES 35,000 loan to start a grocery store with his wife. His business goal is to own a second tuk tuk within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will expand his business and own another tuk tuk.

loans.use: to start a grocery store with his wife

loans.name: Erick

texts.en: Erick is a married man who has two children. He describes himself as focused. He operates a motorcycle transportation business and has been involved in this business for three years. He describes his biggest business challenge to be access to capital. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase three tires. His business goal is to drive a tuk tuk within five years. He hopes that in the future, he may buy a second motorcycle. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to purchase three tires

loans.name: Ezekiel

texts.en: Ezekiel is a 50-year-old married man with six children. He describes himself as hard working. He operates a transportation service and he will use the KES 20,000 loan to repair his vehicle. His business goal is to see his business grow within five years.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a 31-year-old married man who has a 2-year-old child. He describes himself as optimistic. He operates a tire business and has been involved in this business for three years. His primary customers are commercial motorists. He describes his biggest business challenge to be financial instability. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase additional stock to expand his business. His business goal is to operate wholesale within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will build a better life.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to expand his tire business.

loans.name: Nashon

texts.en: Nashon is a 26-year-old married man who has three children. He describes himself as hard working. He operates a transportation service and has been involved in this business for three years. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the price fluctuation of fuel. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to repair his vehicle. His business goal is to grow into a matatu sacco (transport cooperative) within five years.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle

loans.name: Tom

texts.en: Tom is a 32-year-old married man who has one child. He describes himself as hard working. He operates a transportation service and has been involved in this business for three years. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the fluctuating price of fuel. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to repair his vehicle and purchase a new tire. His business goal is to grow into a matatu sacco (transportation cooperative) within five years.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle and buy a new tire

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

Merlyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more stocks of food to sell, like chicharon and ampao (native delicacies).

Merlyn has been in this business for three years now. She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of food to sell, like chicharon and ampao (native delicacies).

loans.name: El Cuerval Group

texts.es:
ROSARIO. Tiene 59 años de edad vive con su esposo. 11 de sus 12 hijos ya tienen compromiso y el último vive con una de sus hermanas en Guayaquil, quien le apoya con los gastos de estudios.
Su esposo es pescador y realiza su actividad todos los días en su vieja canoa y su deteriorada red.
ROSARIO es ama de casa y en el patio de su casa cría pollos. Es su segundo préstamo en FODEMI y en esta ocasión recibirá $900,00 dólares  con los que comprará 200 pollos vitaminas y alimento balanceado para la cría de las aves y con las ventas poder pagar las letras del crédito y obtener ganancias.
ROSARIO sufre de reumatismo, ella invirtió el capital del crédito anterior  en la misma actividad pero se le presento una urgencia de salud y no fue posible obtener mejores resultados. Pero con el  esfuerzo propio y de su esposo,  no descuidó los pagos de l crédito.
Con este nuevo crédito comprara 200 pollitos, balanceado, maíz, vitaminas, aserrín focos incandescentes y cables para la energía. También adecuara el galpón. Dejara un pequeño monto de dinero para ahorro para el pago de la primera cuota.
El producto de la pesca de su esposo, la venden en La Tola, ya que no es mucho y la mayoría de veces solo es para la comida.
Sus deseos ahora que recibe un poco mas de dinero. Es vender bebidas refrescantes de consumo familiar ya que la gente consume mucho las bebidas gaseosas que se compran en las afueras del pueblo. Cree que vendiendo allí tendrá mejores ingresos.
Siente que la llegada de FODEMI es una bendición ya que en entregar el crédito no se demoró mucho y nos hacen las entrevistas en nuestro pueblo.
Agradecemos mucho que tomen en cuenta a los sectores olvidados donde hay mucha gente pobre.
texts.en:
Rosario is 59 years old and lives with her husband. 11 of her 12 children are married, and the youngest lives with one of her sisters in Guayaquil, who she  supports with education expenses. Her husband is a fisherman and works every day in his old canoe and with his deteriorating net. Rosario takes care of the home and breeds chickens in the backyard. This is her second loan from FODEMI, and this time she is requesting $900 dollars to buy 200 chickens, vitamins, and animal feed to breed the chickens. When she then sells them she will be able to repay her loan and make a profit.
 
Rosario suffers from rheumatism. She invested her previous loan in the same activity, but then had a health emergency which impeded her from carrying out her plan. But with her and her husband’s effort, she was still able to repay her loan. With this new loan she will buy 200 chicks, animal feed, corn, vitamins, sawdust, incandescent bulbs, and wires for power. She will also adapt the shed for the new chickens, and leave a small portion of money to save for the payment of the first installment. 

She sells the fish from her husband in La Tola, but it is not much, and most times there is no more to sell after the couple has eaten some. Her current wish, if she receives a little more money, is to sell soft drinks, since people consume a lot of carbonated drinks bought at the outskirts of town. She thinks that if she sells them in town she will have better income. there will sell better income. 

She thinks that FODEMI’s arrival is a blessing, because the loan process is quick and interviews are conducted in her town. She is very grateful that the lenders are helping the forgotten areas where there are many poor people.

loans.use: to buy 200 chicks, animal feed, corn, vitamins, sawdust, incandescent bulbs, and wires for power. She will also adapt the shed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sewing machine, iron and fabric.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy sewing machine and fabric.

loans.name: Kevin Robert

texts.es:
Kevin es un joven emprendedor, tiene 18 años de edad, es soltera y vive en San Juan de Lurigancho junto a su familia. Actualmente vive en la casa de sus tíos ya que sus padres viven en el extranjero, pero como se siente inmensamente agradecido con ellos los apoya con algunos gastos del hogar.
Desde hace casi 1 año trabaja como cajero en una importante cadena de Supermercados y le va muy bien puesto que ya tiene bastante experiencia, es una persona muy eficiente, responsable, trabajadora y sobre todo con muchos deseos de superación.
Kevin está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá comprar un televisor para que de esta manera pueda disfrutar de sus momentos libres viendo sus programas favoritos. Con esto él seguirá esforzándose para más adelante poder cumplir su más grande sueño: "Estudiar una carrera universitaria".
texts.en:
Kevin is a young entrepreneur, he is 18 years old. He is single and lives in San Juan de Lurigancho with his family. He currently lives at his aunt and uncle's house as his parents live abroad, but feeling immensely thankful towards them, he helps them with some of the home's expenses.
For the past year he has been working as a cashier at an important supermarket chain and he does really well since he has a good amount of experience. He is a really efficient, responsible and hardworking person and above all has a real drive to succeed. 
Kevin is thankful with the Kiva lenders because with the support they provide he will be able to buy a television set and in this manner be able to enjoy his free time watching his favorite programs. This way he will continue to work hard in order to fulfill his biggest dream: "Earn a university degree."

loans.use: purchase a television set

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is 68 years old and lives in Map-an, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 10 children now at their adult age. 

Susana earns a living from coconut shell charcoal production and wholesaling business for 30 years already. Susana earns approximately PHP 6,000 each month doing this type of business activity. She has requested a loan to be used for purchasing additional stocks of coconut shells for her charcoal production business. Susana has been a member of PMPC for almost eight years. In the future Susana hopes to expand her charcoal production business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of coconut shells for charcoal production.

loans.name: Lorelie

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Lorelie works hard to support her family.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from a general store. Lorelie is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, rice, fish, and vegetables for her food-vending business.

Lorelie has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, rice, fish, and vegetables for her food production business

loans.name: Ma. Chona

texts.en:
Ma. Chona is 45 years old and married with three children.

Ma. Chona works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Ma. Chona has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and earns additional income from buying and selling school supplies.

Ma. Chona aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Ulanie

texts.en:
Ulanie is a married woman with nine children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She is 45 years old and has six children who are currently in school.

Ulanie has a vegetable-vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more vegetables to sell in her vegetable stall.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Ulanie has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell in her vegetable stall.

loans.name: Avita

texts.en:
Avita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers for her fish vending business.

Avita has been in this business for 30 years. She earns more income from pig fattening.

Avita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Stefano

texts.es: Stefano de 19 años de edad, cuenta que desde muy pequeño, a sus 9 años,  empezó a trabajar cargando bultos, para ayudara  a su padre, quien tenia un negocio  y solo le permitía a Stefano participar  en sus ratos libres. Cunado Stefano creció, pidió a su padre que le permitiera trabajar, pero su padre solo quería que terminara de estudiar, para que posteriormente emprendiera su propio negocio y justamente Stefano así lo hizo. Hoy es un comerciante reconocido en su barrio  y en los alrededores de él y vende suéteres, camisas, bermudas etc. y muchos artículos que su clientela le solicita.  A ello les vende de contado y a crédito, trabajando diariamente desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde, comprando en almacenes de otros países como Panamá y Estados Unidos. Su meta principal es tener un surtido diverso y emprender con otro punto comercial, en otros municipios del departamento. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  mediante el cual comprará suéteres, pantalones cortos, perfumería y vestuario en general. Esta inversión tendrá muy surtido su negocio y esto es justamente lo que desea Stefano para impactar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Stefano is 19 years old. He says that when he was very small—nine years old—he began working carrying packages to help his father, who had a business and only let Stefano participate in his free time. When Stefano grew up, he asked his father to let him work; however, his father just wanted him to finish his education so that he could later start his own business, so that is exactly what Stefano did. 

Today, he is a well-known merchant in his neighborhood and the surrounding areas. He sells sweaters, shirts, bermuda shorts, etc., as well as many articles that his customers ask him for. He sells to them in cash or on credit, working every day from 8:00 in the morning to 6:00 in the evening and buying from warehouses in other countries like Panama and the United States. His main goal is to have a diverse selection and to launch other sales locations in other municipalities in the department. 

Stefano is currently applying for a Kiva loan, his first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which he will buy sweaters, shorts, perfume, and general apparel. This investment will stock his business very well and that is precisely what Stefano wants in order to affect his sales.

loans.use: to buy sweaters, shorts, perfume, and general apparel.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more goods and renovate his work place.

loans.name: Pedrita

texts.en:
Pedrita is 64 years old and lives in Mialem, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children, who are now at their adult age. 

For her means of living, Pedrita is engaged in a sand and gravel buying and reselling business; she has been doing this for eight years already. She earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of business activity. 

She has requested a loan to be used in buying additional cubic of gravel to sell to construction suppliers in the town. 

Pedrita has been a member of PMPC for almost six years. In the future, Pedrita hopes to expand her sand and gravel buying and reselling business.

loans.use: to buy an additional cubic of gravel

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra is 40 years old and lives in Nacional, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married, with four children now at their school and infant ages. 

Sandra is has been engaged in managing a boarding house and a motor wash business for four years already, and earns approximately PHP6,000 each month doing this type of business activity. 

She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing a sidecar to be attached for her motorcycle for hire.

Sandra has been a member of PMPC for almost three years. In the future, Sandra hopes to expand her boarding house and motor wash business.

loans.use: to purchase a sidecar for her motorcycle business

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita is 65 years old and lives in Map-an, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married, with four children now at their adult age. 

Esterlita has earned a living from services and working as a baby sitter for ten years already. Esterlita is earning an income of not less than PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of service activity. 

She has requested a loan to be used to purchase construction materials for house repair. Esterlita has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) for almost nine years. 

In the future, Esterlita hopes to engage in business.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Dolores Elizabeth

texts.es: Dolores tiene 35 años de edad y desde hace 18 años se dedica a la venta de leche en su comunidad. Dolores es una mujer muy trabajadora quien se gana la vida trabajando muy duro para apoyar con la economía de su hogar y junto a su esposo quien es pescador mantienen a sus tres hijos de 17 años, 15 años y 8 años de edad. Dolores desea invertir en la compra de una ternera para criarla y luego venderla por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para hacer la compra dado que no puede hacerlo por su cuenta pero expresa tener la capacidad de pago que el crédito implica.
texts.en:
Dolores is 35 years old and for the past 18 years has worked selling milk in her community. Dolores is a hard working woman who earns her living working really hard to help with the household expenses. Together with her husband, who is a fisherman, they support their three children ages 17, 15 and 8.
Dolores wants to invest in the purchase of a calf to raise and eventually sell. This is the reason she is requesting this credit from FUSAI, to make the purchase since she is not able by her own means, but expresses having the capacity for payment that the credit implies.

loans.use: purchase a calf.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is a hard-working woman. She has a store in Ozamiz that helps provide for the family. She bakes and prepares snacks for added income. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase raw ingredients and other basic commodities to sell. 

Marissa hopes to sustain her business so she can continuously support the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients and other basic commodities to sell.

loans.name: Bernadeth

texts.en:
Bernadeth works hard to support her family. Bernadeth is married and has a manufacturing business making candy in the Philippines.

Bernadeth has asked for a 10,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy ingredients and materials for her business.

Bernadeth has been making candy for 11 years now.

In the future, Bernadeth would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and materials for her business

loans.name: Lilina

texts.en:
Lilina is 42 years old, and married with three children, who are all in school. Lilina works very hard to provide for them.
