Lilina's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. Lilina has restarted her general store business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Lilina has taken a 10,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) housing loan through NWTF in order to buy materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using the loan to buy building materials, and to pay for construction labor.

Lilina is committed to rebuild her devastated life, and in future would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: San Pedro Group

texts.es:
FLOR MARIA
Se entera de FODEMI por una amiga quien le invitó a participar del crédito en el grupo “San Pedro” formado por 7 personas donde cada uno recibirá $500,00 dólares.
FLOR MARIA tiene 30 años  y 5 hijos (4 varones 1 niña) ella se ha dedicado a la compra venta de concha a más de descabezar camarón donde consigue ganar un dinerito extra.
Ha tenido una vida muy difícil nos comenta. Ya que con su primer compromiso donde llegó a tener sus 4 primeros hijos vivía una serie de maltratos físicos, hasta llegar a la separación. En su segundo compromiso, tampoco pudo llegar a comprenderse con su pareja, el consumía mucho alcohol y esto no permitía que la armonía en el hogar existiera. Fue abandonada cuando tenía 6 meses de embarazo. Actualmente vive con sus 5 hijos en una casita que ha podido adquirir y poco a poco acondicionarla para que sus hijos tengan su propio espacio donde desarrollarse.
Con este crédito. Comprará más concha y ampliara sus ventas, con aspiración a vender al por mayor. Así podrá comprar a mejor precio a sus vecinos pagando un precio justo.
Sus aspiraciones son de tener suficientes recursos para también poder comprar el camarón al por mayor y comercializar estos dos productos (concha y camarón), así podrá dar trabajo a más gente en la descabezada de camarón. Y principalmente apoyar a sus hijos en la educación.
texts.en:
Flor Maria learned about FODEMI from a friend who invited her to participate in the loan for the group "San Pedro", made up of seven members, where each one will receive $500 dollars.  Flor Maria is 30 years old. She has five children (four boys, one girl). She makes a living buying and selling mollusc, besides deheading shrimp, to make a little extra money.

She comments that she has had a difficult life.  During her first engagement, when she had her first four children, she lived through a series of physical mistreatments that led to separation.  During her second engagement, she could not either to come to an understanding with her partner. He drank a lot of alcohol, and this would not allow the existence of harmony at home. She was abandoned during her sixth month of pregnancy.

She currently lives with her five children in a little house that she has been able to acquire, and little by little set up for her children to have their own space to grow up.

With this loan, she will buy more mollusc and increase her sales, aspiring to sell wholesale. In this way, she will be able to buy from her neighbors at better prices, paying a fair price. Her ambitions are to have sufficient resources to also be able to buy the shrimp wholesale, and commercialize these two products (mollusc and shrimp). Thus she will be able to employ more people for the shrimp deheading.  And mainly, to support her children's education.

loans.use: to buy more mollusc and increase her sales, with aspirations to sell wholesale.

loans.name: Marlon

texts.en: Marlon is 22 years old and in his second year studying computer programming. His family’s source of income is their bakery, but sometimes what they earn is not enough to keep up with their expenses. This is why Marlon is applying for a 10,000 PHP loan from KIVA lenders through ASKI to help him finance his studies.

loans.use: To pay for his studies in computer programming.

loans.name: Janil

texts.en:
Janil is married and is a hard worker. For the past two years she has helped support the family by raising pigs.

Janil is applying for a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more piglets, plus feed and vitamins for her animals. She is working and saving to grow her pig business ever larger.

loans.use: to buy more piglets, plus feed and vitamins for her animals.

loans.name: Irma Yolanda

texts.es: Irma Yolanda es una joven muy trabajadora. Ella es maestra de educación primaria y da clases en san Martin Jilotepeque y por las tardes se dedica  a la venta de ropa típica como lo son: cortes, güipiles, fajas y perrajes, estos productos tienen mucha demanda en esa área. Sus pagos los a realizados puntualmente. Ella está muy feliz por su bebita que acaba de nacer y quiere trabajar mucho para darle todo lo mejor a su bebita. Solicita el crédito para la compra de cortes, güipiles y fajas así surtirá mas su negocio y ganara mas.
texts.en: Irma Yolanda is a hardworking young woman. She is a primary school teacher and teaches in San Martin Jilotepeque; in the afternoons, she makes a living selling traditional clothing, such as skirts, "güipiles" (traditional blouses), "fajas" (belts) and "perrajes" (shawls). These are very sought-after products in this area. She has paid off all that she owes on time. She is very happy because her baby was born recently, and she wants to work a lot to give the child the best. She is asking for a loan to buy skirts, blouses, belts and shawls to stock her shop, and to earn more.

loans.use: to buy and sell traditional clothing.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
For many years Estrella has farmed to augment her family’s income, planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables to sell. She has been successful doing so.

Estrella has been a member of GDMPC since 2011. She has taken out and repaid previous loans (see below). Now she is applying for a new 50,000 PHP loan to buy fertilizer and seedlings.

In the future, Estrella wants to make improvements on her house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Jacqueline Marilu

texts.es:
EL Grupo Crédito San Pedro De Pueblo que se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Pueblo Nuevo del Cantón Santa Ana, lugar de gente honesta y dedicada a las faenas del campo y a la ganadería, con bellos paisajes campestres y gente amable.
En este lugar vive la señora Jacqueline, tiene 27 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 9 y 6  años que  estudian en escuela. Su esposo es ganadero.
Doña Jacqueline es una muy buena madre y esposa que realiza el crédito para que su esposo lo utilice en sus actividades, el se dedica a la ganadería y venta de leche, queso y ganado, el todas las mañanas ordeña sus vacas para recoger la leche y luego se desplaza por varios lugares de la localidad comprando leche y queso a varias personas para luego salir a vender a la ciudad en una motocicleta que él tiene y en la cual distribuye estos productos
Este crédito es para comprar leche, queso y alimento para el ganado.  Lleva dos años en el  Grupo Crédito y le gusta porque así ella puede ayudarle a su marido. Sus sueños son comprar un carro para que su marido realice su labor.
texts.en:
The community bank San Pedro de Pueblo meets every 15 days in the community of Pueblo Nuevo in the county of Santa Ana. It is a place consisting of honest people dedicated to raising livestock and cattle with beautiful rural landscapes and nice people. 

Jacqueline lives in this place. She is 27 years old and married with two children aged 9 and 6 years old who attend school. Her husband raises cattle. 

Jacqueline in a very good mother and wife applying for the loan so her husband can use it for his work. He raises cattle and sells milk, cheese, and cattle. He milks his cows each morning to collect the milk and travels to several spots in the community to buy millk and cheese. Later, he goes to the city on his motorcycle to distribute and sell the products. This loan is to buy milk, cheese, and animal feed for his cows. Jacqueline has been in the community bank for two years and she likes it because she can help her husband. Her dream is to buy a car, so she can help her husband with his work.

loans.use: to buy milk, cheese, and animal feed for her cows

loans.name: Juana Olimpia

texts.es: Juana de 49 años de edad es muy responsable y trabajadora, ella se dedica a la venta de verduras,  su negocio lo tiene ubicado en el mercado central que se encuentra cerca de su casa, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar las necesidades de su hogar, vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, Juana solicita un crédito para la compra de de verduras por mayor, para seguir con su venta y asi darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: 49-year-old Juana is very responsible and hardworking. She sells vegetables. Her business is in the central market that is near her home. With the money she earns through sales, she covers household expenses. She lives in her own home with family members. Juana is applying for a loan in order to buy vegetables in bulk in order to continue with her business and give her family a better quality-of-live.

loans.use: to buy vegetables in bulk

loans.name: Abisirayeri Group

texts.fr:
Adronis  fait partie du groupe  Abisirayeri  et  habite à Bujumbura. Il a 21 ans et est marié à  Nadine, une cultivatrice. 

Il fait le commerce de haricot et de riz depuis 2 ans.  

C’est son premier  crédit   à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il  obtient, il  va augmenter son capital et   acheter une grande de riz et de haricot   à revendre, pour gagner plus.

Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait faire l’élevage de vaches.
texts.en:
Adronis, age 21, is a member of the group Abisirayeri and he lives in Bujumbura. He is married to a farmer named Nadine. He has been selling beans and rice for 2 years.  

This is his first loan cycle with Turame, and he plans to use the credit to strengthen his working capital and buy a large quantity of rice and beans to bolster his sales and revenue. 

In the coming years, he would like to start raising cows.

loans.use: to strengthen his working capital and buy a large quantity of rice and beans to bolster his sales and revenue.

loans.name: Lilipina

texts.en:
Lilipina is a food vendor. She has been engaged in this business for 20 years and earns an additional income from buying and selling firewood. This hard-working entrepreneur has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. 

She requested PhP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

Lilipina dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Johnson Dale

texts.en:
Johnson Dale from Gerona, Tarlac, is a student taking up Hotel and Restaurant Services in St. Paul Colleges Foundation. 

His father is a mechanic while his mother is an Overseas Filipino Worker. He has five siblings. What his parents earn is sometimes not enough to support the family and cover his school finances. This is why he hopes to take out a PhP 10,000 loan from Kiva lenders to help him pay his tuition. 

Johnson Dale is positive that this loan will help him to achieve his dreams, and he is grateful to his lenders.

loans.use: to pay tuition

loans.name: Sarah Jane

texts.en: Sarah Jane, 22 years old, is in her 2nd year of studies in Hotel and Restaurant Services. She has 4 siblings. Their family earns their income from farming. She wants to finish her studies to be able to help her parents. To do this, she requests 10,000 PHP loan from the KIVA lenders.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fee.

loans.name: Cherilyn

texts.en:
Cherilyn is 47 years old and lives in Palilan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married, with three children now at their adult and school age. 

Cherilyn is engaged in a direct-selling business, particularly selling Avon, Personal Collection, MSE, Natasha products, and motorcycle fuel lubricants. She’s been in this business for 17 years already and earns approximately PHP 10,000 each month doing this type of business activity. 

She has requested a loan to be used to purchase additional stocks of beauty products, RTWs (Ready-To-Wear), and fuel lubricants for her direct-selling and distribution business.

Cherilyn has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) for two years. In the future, she hopes to expand her direct-selling business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of beauty products, RTWs, and fuel lubricants.

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
Elenita is 43 years old with four children.

She earns a living by rearing chickens in the Philippines. Elenita has asked for 10,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy additional chickens and chicken feed for her business.

Elenita has been raising chickens for 15 years, and also earns extra income from vegetable vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional chickens and chicken feed for her business

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
Ellen works hard to support her family. Ellen is married and has a business making herbal medicines in the Philippines.

Ellen has asked for a 13,000 Philippine Pesos loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like turmeric and citrus for her business.

Ellen has been in this business for four years now.

Ellen would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like turmeric and citrus for her business

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia sells coconut meat to earn a living. She has been engaged in this business for six years. She earns additional income from the direct sales of Avon products and from raising pigs. This hard-working entrepreneur has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of her loans from NWTF.
  
She is requesting PhP 20,000 through NWTF to buy more sacks of dried coconut meat to offer for sale.
  
Lydia dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy sacks of dried coconut meat to offer for sale

loans.name: Mylen

texts.en:
Mylen is 33 years old and married with three children.  Two children attend school and she works very hard to provide for them.

Mylen's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Mylen has restarted her general store business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Mylen has taken a 10,000 PHP housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family's home.

She is using the this loan to purchase building materials and pay construction costs.

Mylen is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in the future would like to save enough money  to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay construction costs.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cosmetic products and fabrics for resale.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 36 years old and lives in Molave Zamboanga del Sur. She is married with 2 children (adult and school aged). 

Susan is engaged in a direct selling business of native chicken and charcoal. She’s been in this business for 14 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP each month doing this type of business activity. 

She requests a loan to purchase native chicken and charcoal. Susan has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, Susan hopes to expand her direct selling business.

loans.use: to purchase chicken and charcoal.

loans.name: Harold

texts.en:
Harold is 29 years old from Paniqui, Tarlac. He is studying Hotel and Restaurant Services. His father is a barangay captain and his mother is an Overseas Filipino worker. His parents' earnings are not enough for his schooling. They request 10,000 PHP from the KIVA lenders to use for his tuition fee. 

Harold hopes that lenders will grant his loan request.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fee.

loans.name: Rosa Otilia

texts.es:
EL Grupo Crédito San Pedro De Pueblo que se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Pueblo Nuevo del Cantón Santa Ana, lugar de gente honesta y dedicada a las faenas del campo y a la ganadería, con bellos paisajes campestres y gente amable.
En este lugar vive la señora Rosa, tiene 59 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cinco hijos mayores de edad, una de ellos aun vive en su casa. Su esposo es agricultor.
Doña Rosa para poder ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar ya que con lo que él hace no alcanza para cubrir los gastos hace varios años empezó un negocio, ella tiene un pequeño local en su casa, allí los fines de semana prepara meriendas y comidas rápidas como hamburguesas, corviches, empanadas, batidos y jugos naturales, ella prepara el delicioso aguado de pollo plato que es muy degustado por sus clientes que todos los fines de semana llegan hasta su local, lleva más de 15  años con este negocio el cual le deja lo necesario para salir adelante.
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar arroz, carne, pollo, frutas  y otros viveres para la preparación de los alimentos. Lleva 4 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan para salir adelante.  Sus sueños son tener un gran restaurante.
texts.en:
The San Pedro de Pueblo Credit Group meets every fifteen days in the parish of Pueblo Nuevo, in the Santa Ana Canton, a place where there are honest people  who work in farming and livestock-raising.  It has beautiful country landscapes and friendly people. Señora Rosa lives here. She is 59 years old, and she is married. She has five grown children from this relationship, one of whom still lives at home. Her husband is a farmer. 

She started a business several years ago, in order to help her husband with the household expenses, as his income is not enough to cover all of them. She has a small café in her house. There, on the weekends, she prepares snacks and fast food such as hamburgers, corviches (a dish made with bananas and fish), empanadas, shakes, and fresh juices. She makes the delicious dish, "aguado de pollo" (a soup made with chicken, rice, potatoes, onions, peppers, and other vegetables and herbs). Her customers like it so much that they come to her café every weekend. She has had this business for 15 years, and it gives her what she needs to move forward.

She will use the loan to purchase rice, meat, chicken, fruit, and other supplies for preparing the food. She has been in the credit group for four years, and she likes it because it helps her to move forward. Her dream is to have a big restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase rice, meat, chicken, fruit, and other supplies.

loans.name: Jovencia

texts.en:
Jovencia is 52 years old and lives in Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married, with four children who are now at their adult age. 

Jovencia has earned a living from a fishing activity for about 15 years already. She earns approximately PHP 2,000 each month doing this type of business activity. 

She has requested a loan to be used to purchase construction materials for house repair and renovation. 

Jovencia has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) for almost nine years. 

In the future, she hopes to expand their fishing business.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials for house repair and renovation.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 46 years old and has nine children. She is married and has five children who are in school.

Lourdes and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Lourdes has asked for a housing loan of 9,714 Philippine Pesos to buy building materials, and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Lourdes has been a NWTF borrower since 2012. She plans to repay this loan through her selling spare parts.

With your help, Lourdes can rebuild her house and recover from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future she would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
Ma. Fe is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase ingredients and items for her business.

Ma. Fe has been in this business for 6 years. Ma. Fe earns additional income raising chickens.

Ma. Fe has sustained her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients and items for her business.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her raising livestock business and requests a 10,000 PHP housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay  construction costs to build a house for her family.

With your help, Gemma will be able to rebuild her devastated life.

In the future, Gemma would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay construction costs.

loans.name: Chrip

texts.en:
Chrip, 39, is an experienced and industrious farmer from Prey Chhor District, Kampong Cham Province.  She is a lovely mother of one married child and two unmarried children who attend primary school.

She operates a farm business on a small rice field and earns $ 4  a day to support her family's daily expands. 

To accelerate her farming process, Chrip would like to get cows to help her plow the land; she can’t afford them. Due to the shortage of money, she would like to get a KIVA loan since it has a low interest rate.  

She thanks the lenders for their generous behavior.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 60 years old and lives in Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 5 children now at their adult age. 

Vilma has raised hogs and poultry for almost 5 years. She earns approximately 3,000.00 PHP each month doing this type of business. She has requested a loan to purchase 4 sacks of feed for her hogs and poultry raising businesses. 

Vilma has been a member of PMPC for almost 8 years. In the future, Vilma hopes to expand her hog and poultry raising business.

loans.use: to purchase 4 sacks of feed for her hog and poultry raising businesses.

loans.name: Kamboinsin Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Mme LIMATA est responsable du groupe KAMBOINSIN BENKADI.  Mariée, elle est mère de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a 10ans et le moins âgés à 01 an.  01 va à l’école. 
Mme vend de la bouillie depuis 05ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de son secteur. 
Elle veut s’acheter 02 sacs de mil et 02 sacs de sucre pour la préparation de la bouillie. 
Elle veut épargner ses bénéfices afin de renforcer son activité. Mme ambitionne étendre les limites de son activité et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Limata is the representative of the KAMBOINSIN BENKADI group. She is married and the mother of three children. Her oldest child is 10 years old and the youngest is 1. One of her children is in school.

Limata has been selling porridge for five years. She buys her supplies at her local market.

She wants to buy two bags of millet and two bags of sugar to prepare some porridge.

Limata wants to save her profits in order to boost her business. Her goals are to expand her activity and to better provide for her children.

loans.use: to buy two bags of millet and two bags of sugar to prepare some porridge.

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita is a woman who searches for any possible way to obtain a resource that will allow her to feed her family.

 A year ago, she began making a living selling groceries . She thanks God and her costumers for this occupation, since the results of these sales have been very rewarding and her products are well-liked. 

Based on this success, Perlita asks for a loan to purchase additional products to sell which will allow her to continue to realize her dream which is to grow as an entrepreneur.  By the grade of God, she always looks out for the well being of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose, age 69, is a rice farmer. He has been engaged in this business for 10 years and earns approximately PhP 3,000 per month from his rice farm. He lives with his wife in Villalin, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. Together they have raised three children, now grown.
 
Jose has been a member of PMPC for 10 years. He has requested a loan to cover labor costs and to purchase commercial fertilizers and sprays for his farm.  

In the future, Jose hopes to engage in additional types of agribusiness.

loans.use: to cover labor costs and to purchase commercial fertilizers and sprays for his rice farm

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: A portion of Karim's Group $ 3,000 loan is to purchase a tok tok, a three-wheel auto rickshaw.

loans.name: Vuoch Sreang

texts.en:
Sreang, a 45-year-old mother of three school children, lives in a rural area of Prey Chhor District, Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. Sreang has been working as a farmer in a small rice field near her house for more than twenty years. In total, Sreang can make USD 3 per day from her farming.

Sreang is borrowing a loan from HKL to build a hygienic latrine for the sake of her family members. Through this loan, Sreang hopes that it will help her to promote her health and living condition. Sreang thanks lenders for the financial support via HKL, which provides her with a much lower interest rate than its general loan product.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is married with 5 children. Myrna is 52 years old and lives in Catagan, Tangub City.

Myrna sells groceries to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns PHP 5000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan o 14,900 for additional capital to buy merchandise for her sari-sari store.

Myrna has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, Myrna hopes to better their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Ma. Jessie

texts.en:
Ma. Jessie is a 42-year-old married woman with four children (3 attend school). 

Ma. Jessie has raised pigs in the Philippines for 5 years. She requested 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She has previously borrowed 9 times from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Ma. Jessie would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena, age 56, saw her home and business destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. She has started up her general store business again, and now she needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

She and her husband have 10 children, one of whom still attends school. Magdalena works very hard to provide for her family.

Magdalena requested a PhP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase materials with which to rebuild her family home. She will use her loan funds to buy building materials and to pay for construction labor.

Magdalena is committed to rebuilding her family's devastated life. In future, she would like to save enough money to be able to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy building materials and to pay for construction labor in order to rebuild her family home

loans.name: Marilona

texts.en:
Marilona is 55 years old and has three children. She is married and has three children who are in school.

Marilona is in the agricultural business of pig fattening, in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pig. She has been in pig fattening for 13 years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marilona would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pig.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 39 years old and married with two children who are currently in school. Marilyn works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like snack foods, canned goods, noodles, detergent soap, coffee, sugar, etc. to sell.

Marilyn has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods, noodles, detergent soap, coffee, sugar, etc.  In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like snack foods, canned goods, noodles, detergent soap, coffee, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Myra

texts.en:
Myra is a 4-year-old married woman with four children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Myra's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her agriculture business and is committed to regain what she lost. Myra is taking out a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build her a house for her family.

Myra has been with NWTF since 2012 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, She will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Myra would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Yaneth Azucena

texts.es: Yaneth tiene 30 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto  a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos de 14 años y 10 años de edad. Yaneth trabaja como jornalera desde hace dos años y es así como lleva el sustento a su hogar y junto a su compañero de vida quien es albañil mantienen la economía familiar. Ella solicita este crédito a FUSAI dado que desea mejorar una parte del techo de la vivienda por lo que comprará lámina galvanizada y madera. Con el primer crédito techo una parte de su vivienda y encemento una parte del patio.
texts.en:
Yaneth is 30 years old and lives in her own house with her life partner and their two children, ages 14 and 10. For the past two years she has worked as a day worker and this is how she and her partner, who is a bricklayer, contribute to their household finances. 

She is asking FUSAI for this loan because she would like to fix a section of the roof of her house for which she would buy metal sheets and wood. With her first loan she roofed part of her house and put down concrete for a patio.

loans.use: to buy sheets of metal and wood to repair a section of the roof of her house.

loans.name: Suon

texts.en:
Suon, a 26-year-old mother of one child, lives in Prey Chhor District, Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. To make a living, she works as a farmer on a small rice field near her house. She has done this work for 5 years, and it allows her to make USD 5 per day.

Suon is living in a very old house in which some parts or the roof and the wall are broken and need to be repaired. Due to the shortage of money, she has applied for a KIVA loan from HKL, which is the second loan for her, to pay for house repairs. Suon thanks lenders for the financial support via HKL, which provides her with a much lower interest rate than its general loan product.

loans.use: to pay for house repairs

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en: Luzviminda has been running her piggery for more than five years and she earns well for the needs of her three children and the entire family. She has sustained her business and is now running well. Recently, she took a new loan to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. She wants to make an expansion to her business and dreams of seeing her children finish their studies in the future

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Derek Mart

texts.en:
Derek Mart is 21 years old and is taking up Hotel and Restaurant Services in St. Paul College Foundation. He chose this course to easily obtain a job and be able to help his family. 

To do this, Derek wants to avail a PHP 10,000 loan from the Kiva lenders to pay for his tuition fee. He hopes that lenders will approve this loan.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition fee.

loans.name: Miguela

texts.en:
Miguela works hard to support her family. Miguela is married and has a buy and sell ready-to-wear business in the Philippines.

Miguela requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of ready to wear to sell to her customers.

Miguela has been in this business for 15 years now.

Miguela would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of ready-to-wear to sell to her customers

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 42 years old and married with seven children. With six children in school, Rowena works very hard to provide for them.

Rowena's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Rowena has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Rowena has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using the this loan purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Rowena is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in future would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Perseveranda

texts.en:
Perseveranda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling nipa roofing in the Philippines. 

She's borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to stock more nipa roofing to sell.

Perseveranda has been in this business for four years. She earns more income from food vending.

Perseveranda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to stock more nipa roofing to sell

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena works hard to support her family. Rowena is married and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines.

Rowena requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional piglets, feeds and vitamins for her business.

Rowena has been in this business for 20 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Rowena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets, feeds and vitamins for her business

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 56 years old and married with four children. With one child still in school, Thelma works very hard to provide for them.

Thelma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Thelma has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as vinegar, dish washing soap, bath soap, coffee, cereals, creamer, shampoo, and soft-drinks. 

Thelma would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 48 years old and married with one child who is in school. Elena works very hard to provide for them.

Elena's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Elena has restarted her agriculture business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Elena has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using the this loan purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Elena is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in future would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
An USD 800 loan is offered to Elena to improve her business. She is married and she has two children. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy everyday. She will buy some additional supplies such as a refrigerator, beer, fanta, coca-cola, sprite, sagiko, eggs, noodles, cigarettes, milks and biscuits. She has been involved in business activities since 2010. She feels so comfortable running her business, because she can earn money everyday.

Running a business has made Elena independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator, beer, soft drinks, sagiko, eggs, noodles, cigarettes, milks and biscuits.

loans.name: Oeung

texts.en:
Oeung, age 45, lives with her husband and their four children in the province of Kampong Speu. She is a housewife. Her husband is a farmer, and all four of the children are employed as garment workers and factory staff. Together, the family can earn approximately $23.50 per day.

Oeung would like to apply for a loan in the amount of $1,500 in order to buy cows to feed and sell. This loan will help her start up her own small agricultural business so she can contribute to the family income. 

In the future, she dreams of helping her children start up their own clothes design shop. She also hopes eventually to build a bigger house.

loans.use: to buy cows to feed and offer for sale

loans.name: Blanca Del Rosario

texts.es: Blanca de 48 años de edad vive en casa propia con esposo y una sobrina, ella trabaja como costurera, se encarga de confeccionar ropa formal, uniformes y ropa casual, ella es alguien muy detallista quien desarrolla un trabajo muy bueno, lo que le permite contar con la fidelidad de muchos clientes amigos y vecinos. Blanca elabora trabajos por encargo y así mismo elabora prendas de vestir para vender en su casa de habitación, donde también se dedica a elaborar su trabajo con lo que puede obtener ganancias extras. Ella solicita un préstamo con el fin de poder comprar telas en diferentes colores y estampados, así mismo comprar hilo, agujas y todo lo necesario con lo que pueda realizar más trabajos y asi obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Blanca is 48 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and a niece. She is a seamstress and is responsible for making formal wear, uniforms, and casual clothing. Blanca is very detail-oriented and does very good work, earning her the loyalty of many clients, friends, and neighbors. She does work to order and also makes clothing to sell out of her house where she is developing her business so she can earn extra money.

Blanca is asking for a loan so she can buy fabrics in different colors and patterns, thread, needles, and everything she needs to make more clothing and thus earn more money so she can give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fabrics in different colors and patterns, thread, needles, etc.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en: Cynthia is 40 years old, married and has two children. She is managing a store selling grocery items to the people in their village while her spouse is a farmer. Her child, Kristine Joy wants to become a teacher. She is in first year level now. Cynthia is now asking for a PHP 20,000 loan from Kiva lenders to pay for tuition fees, books and allowances in school. She hopes to continue giving good education to her children so they will become successful in their chosen career someday.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees, books, and allowances in school

loans.name: Lelanie

texts.en:
Lelanie sells motor spare parts and accessories to earn a living. She has been running her business in her local community for more than seven years. She earns a sustainable income. She lives with her family in Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur.

Lelanie repaid her previous loan successfully. It was used to replenish her inventory of spare parts and accessories. She requested a new loan to purchase new items to expand her product offering.
 
She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda, a 57-year-old micro-entrepreneur from Silang, Cavite, Philippines, has been operating a transportation business for several years, and she makes a good income from this. She's a widow, and that's why she is determined to work harder to provide for her family. Her children are helping her generate income for their everyday needs.

She has two tricycles that carry up to four passengers to their destination within the community. The tricycle driver then remits a boundary (daily quota) each day to her. In her business her regular customers are the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 600 every day.

Merlinda wants to apply for a PHP 10,000 loan to continue operation of her business. She will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts and accessories and also to pay for the maintenance of the motorcycles.

In the future, she wants to have another tricycle, and she hopes that her family will always be in good health. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God they study.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and the maintenance of her tricycle units

loans.name: Romana

texts.en:
Romana is 58 years old and married with four children. 

Romana has an agricultural business fattening pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Romana has been in the pig-fattening business for 10 years now and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Romana would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Tita works hard to support her family. She has a pig fattening business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling ready to wear.  Tita is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Tita has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely is a 58-year-old married woman with nine children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Fely's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her general store business and is committed to regain what she lost. Fely is taking out a PHP 10,000 Housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build her a house for her family.

Fely has been with NWTF since 2012 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, She will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Fely would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Darcy

texts.en:
Darcy is single and has a baking cakes business in the Philippines.

Darcy requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients like eggs, flour, and sugar for her business.

Darcy has been in this business for 1 year now.

In the future, Darcy would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like eggs, flour, and sugar for her business

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 44 years old and married with four children, who are all in school. Elsa works very hard to provide for them.

Elsa's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Elsa has restarted her agriculture business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Elsa has taken a PHP 9,942 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using the this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Elsa is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in the future would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Mistubishi Group

texts.en:
Omary, who is in his late 30s, is married with four kids who are still in school. For the past year, he has been selling fruits and vegetables. He works from six in the morning through ten at night daily to make a good monthly profit. Omary will share this loan with his loan group, Mistubishi, which has three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

Omary is requesting a loan from Tujijenge Tanzania to buy fruits and vegetables to sell. This will be his third loan. Omary used his previous loans to restock the missing items in his business. He has successfully repaid his previous loans and used his profits to pay school fees, cover household expenses, and build a house. Omary dreams of buying a motorcar to collect fruits and vegetables from farmers at their farms.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy another batch of chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.en: Jaime has cultivated his rice farmland for more than 20 years. He is now 62 years of age, married to vegetable vendor, and has been blessed with six children. Five of his children have settled for marriage while his youngest child is still studying. At his age, he still enjoys his farming activities. Jaime would like to keep his rice farmland productive so he is requesting additional capital of 10,000 PHP to be used in buying farm inputs such as fertilizers, insecticides, and herbicides.Through these farm inputs, he could supply his farmland with proper nutrition, which will enable him to obtain better yields in the next harvest season. He just hopes that his requested loan amount will be approved.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and insecticides used for maintenance of hs farming business

loans.name: Hak

texts.en: Hak is 60 years old, and a widow with two children. She is a sour fruit seller, and one of her children is a garment worker. They live in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. They can earn approximately $10.50 per day. Now she would like to apply for a loan of 1,500 USD to buy zinc sheets and wood to build a new house, because her present house is old. This loan will help her to build a bigger house and to live in a better condition. In the future, she is going to improve her selling and fill up the soil on the ground under her house.

loans.use: to buy materials to build a new house.

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en: Estelita raises hogs within her locality. She is married and blessed with four children. She has been raising hogs for more than five years. Estelita would like to seek financial assistance from lenders amounting to 35,000 PHP which will allow her to buy stocks of hog feed, vaccines, and vitamins. She believes that through sustaining her hogs with proper nutrition, she could gain better profits and improve her living condition. She is hoping for approval of her requested loan amount to ensure a continuous smooth flow of her hog-raising business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of hog feed, vaccines, and vitamins for her raised hogs

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is 30 years old. He supports five members of his family. He is married to Regina and together they are blessed with three children ages eight years, six years and six years. Robert sells timber and earns a monthly income of KES 30,000. This is his first loan with VisionFund Kenya for KES 30,000. His desire is to prosper higher and higher.

loans.use: to buy trees for his timber yard.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To put up her business premises and add beauty products to her salon

loans.name: Roselida

texts.en:
Roselida is a 50-year-old lady married to Kanui and blessed with eight children. She has been selling green vegetables as well as charcoal for the last two years and gets a monthly income of KES 8,000.

She has applied for her second loan of KES 15,000 from VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to buy more assorted vegetables and charcoal from dealers to sell. She paid her previous loan successfully.

Roselida will use the anticipated profits to provide for the family's basic needs in the future.

loans.use: to buy more assorted vegetables and also to buy charcoal to sell

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 29 years old and married to Samuel, who is self employed in  the juakali business. Together they are blessed with four children between 12 years and eight years.She sells fish, a business she has done for the past 10 years, earning an income of KES 10,000 per month. 

Eunice is not requesting a loan to expand her business, however. She would like to spend the loan paying her children's school fees. She has thus requested a loan of KES 30,000 from VisionFund Kenya for that purpose.

This is Eunice's third loan after successfully repaying her previous loans.She hopes and dreams of seeing her children educated for life.

loans.use: to pay school fees.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 29 years old. She is married to Charles, and together they are blessed with five children between the ages of 25 years and one year. She was married by a widower who had three children before they were blessed with two of their own. 

Nancy sells beauty products and clothing, a business she has done for five years now.  Nancy is requesting a loan of KES 70,000 from VisionFund Kenya, which she will use the loan to pay school fees for her children.

This is her forth loan after successfully repaying her previous loans. Nancy desires to see her children educated for a life at their desired levels, and hence she will dedicate her profits to educating her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees.

loans.name: Severina

texts.en: Severina has been selling dried fish in the market for more than two years and her previous loan from GDMPC used for the business was successfully repaid. With her generated income, she was able to start a transportation business to add to their cash inflows. Recently, she took a new loan to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. She is hopeful of gaining more profit, to use it for her family's improved living, and she wants to improve her business to have a stable income for their future.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Bancy

texts.en:
Bancy is a single woman with three children with ages ranging from 12 to 16 years. She works as a farmer growing crops. Bancy describes herself as honest and states that her biggest business challenge is the lack of finances to buy farm inputs. 

Bancy is requesting a 90,000 KES loan to buy farm inputs. This will be her fourth loan with SMEP Micro finance bank. Bancy successfully repaid her previous loans. She hopes to be financially stable in the future.

loans.use: buy farm inputs

loans.name: Charle

texts.en: Charle is a widow who operates a general store to make a living. Aside from this, she also vends barbecue to earn extra income. For five years in running the business, she has earned well to support the needs of her family and was able to sustain it.  She borrowed a loan from GDMPC to purchase additional products to sell. She hopes to improve the business to ensure a better source of income for the family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Edna Lilibeth

texts.en:
Edna Lilibeth, age 48, raises pigs to earn her living. She has been engaged in this small agricultural business for five years now, and has borrowed 22 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She and her husband have one child, who is enrolled in school. 

Edna Lilibeth requested a PhP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies for her pigs.

In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina, age 43, runs a general store business to earn an income. She has been engaged in this business for 12 years. She and her husband have two children, both of whom attend school. She works hard to support her family.

She requested a PhP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more grocery items to offer for sale in her general store.

In the future, Regina would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items to offer for sale in her general store

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is a 41-year-old lady married to Dominic. They are residents of city suburb a zone just one kilometer from the city center of Kampala.

She operates a hardware shop in Mengo, near a market, that she started with limited working capital in 2005. She has since increased her operating capital to about 7,000,000 Ugandan shillings. She has taken three loan cycles from UGAFODE Microfinance Ltd. that have enabled her to boost her business to the current status. However, she faces a challenge of competition from neighboring hardware shops and increased rent costs. 

She applied for a loan of 3,000,000 shillings to add stock into her business. She is very appreciative and grateful for the financial support from UGAFODE Microfinance Ltd. (MDI), but she requests that the interest rates be lowered further to enable her benefit more from the loan. She thanks the Kiva lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: To buy stock of hardware

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase flagstones and cement to renovate the house from the inside.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth lives in Uganda, Kampala. She is married with four children and all of them go to school. She operates a beauty saloon at the market on a retail basis. She works seven days a week. She has been in this business for the last ten years. 

She has requested a loan of Ugandan Shillings 900,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy relaxers, hair treatments, weaves and braids. Her major challenges include seasonality and electricity. Her goal and aspiration is to buy a plot of land. 

She lives in rented house and the family has  access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy hair relaxers, treatments, braids, weaves.

loans.name: Usman

texts.en:
Usman is a father with a 4-year-old child. He lives in Batu Ampar village, near with Pemuteran beach, in the north part of Bali. He’s a big buyer for fish. Usually he buys fish from the fisherman around Pemuteran beach and he sells again to other buyers. Usman also has a salt pond. Every day Usman distributes the fishes from 02.00 AM until 04.00 AM and then at 07.00 AM starts work at his salt pond.

Usman needs an additional loan to improve his business. He will use it to purchase fish fee to sells again, he will also use the loan to buy many pipes to bring the flow of sea water into his salt pond. Now he has a new customer in fish feed. Usman hopes all of his business plans will run well and make him successful.

loans.use: to purchase fish feed and water flow pipes

loans.name: Thích

texts.en:
Thích is 58 years old and she is married with 2 children. Thích operates a food stall/restaurant selling snacks. Thích runs her business in Hau Loc district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Thích has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

In 2013, Thích joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Thích has successfully repaid 1 loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having latrine so her family shares a neighbor latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Thích hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret  lives in Uganda, Kampala. She is married with five children; all of them go to school. She has additional family members. 

She sells groundnuts. She operates her business on both a retail and a wholesale basis. She works six days a week. She has been in this business for 20 years. 

Margaret has requested a loan of Ugandan shillings 2,500,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy bags of groundnuts, cow peas, and beans. 

Her major challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to build rental houses. 

She lives in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy bags of ground nuts, beans, cow peas

loans.name: Sokvin

texts.en: Sokvin is 28 years old, a garment worker, and a married woman with two children. Her husband is a drum-maker. They live in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. They can earn approximately $12 per day. Now she would like to apply for a loan of $1,200 to buy a motorcycle to ride to work. This loan will help her have enough money to buy a motorcycle to ride to work and reduce her traveling expenses. In the future, she wants to build a bigger house with fences around it as well as support her children to finish high school.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to ride to work

loans.name: Maritza Manuela

texts.es:
EL Grupo Crédito San Pedro De Pueblo que se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Pueblo Nuevo del Cantón Santa Ana, lugar de gente honesta y dedicada a las faenas del campo y a la ganadería, con bellos paisajes campestres y gente amable.
En este lugar vive la señora Maritza, tiene 31 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tienen un hijo de 6  años que estudia en escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña Maritza es una muy buena esposa que para ayudarle a  su marido realiza el crédito para que él lo utilice en su negocio, él se dedica a la compra y venta de chanchos, vacas, gallinas entre otros animales, dos días a la semana el recorre los campos para comprar estos animalitos que luego lleva a revender a Santa Ana o Portoviejo lugares donde ya tiene sus clientes que semana a semana le compran y que esto le permite sacar adelante a su familia de una manera honesta y honrada.
Este crédito es para comprar gallinas, chanchos y vacas para la venta. Esta desde el inicio en el  Grupo Crédito y le gusta porque así le ayuda a su marido. Sus sueños son comprar un camión para el transporte de los animales.
texts.en:
The "San Pedro de Pueblo" lending group meets every two weeks in Pueblo Nuevo in the Santa Ana canton.  The people of this town are honest and dedicated to field work and raising livestock.  The rural landscapes are beautiful and the people are kind.  Maritza lives here.  She is 31 years old and lives in a common-law marriage.  From this relationship, she has a six year old son who attends school.  Her husband is a businessman.  

Maritza is a very good wife who is seeking this loan to help her husband with his business.  He works buying and selling pigs, cows, chickens and other animals.  Two days a week, he walks through the fields to purchase these animals which he later resells in Santa Ana or Portoviejo, places where he already has customers who buy from him week after week.  This allows him to get his family ahead in an honest and honorable way.

This loan will be used to purchase chickens, pigs and cows to sell.  Maritza has been in the lending group since its inception, and she likes it because it allows her to help her husband.  Her dream is to purchase a truck to transport the animals.

loans.use: purchase chickens, pigs and cows.

loans.name: Apple Fe

texts.en: Apple Fe is a responsible mother. She requests a loan from Paglaum MPC, which she will use to increase her inventory. She wants to buy more kilos of fruits and vegetables for resell. This way, she will be able to sell more products which will allow her to earn more money and provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more kilos of fruits and vegetables for resell

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is a married woman with nine children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Elvira is 49 years old and has four children who are currently in school. 

Elvira has a rice milling business in the Philippines. Elvira requested a 15,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials and tools for the maintenance of her business.

Elvira has been in this business for 7 years. In the future, Elvira would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials and tools for the maintenance of her business

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is 40 years old, and married with four children, three of whom are in school. Regina and her family survived Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Regina is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. She has been a NWTF borrower since 2012. She plans to recover through her agriculture business. With your help, Regina can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of Super Typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en: Rhoda is a 43-year-old, married woman with three children who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rhoda has a computer shop business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 29,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase spare parts and tools for her business. She has been in this business for nine years. In the future, Rhoda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and tools for her business.

loans.name: Sayra

texts.en:
Sayra works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her general store business and is now requesting a 10,000 PHP housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so that she can build a house for her family.

With your help Sayra will be able to rebuild her devastated life more quickly.

In the future, Sayra would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase supplies to make meals and stock her business with beverages and snacks to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Luisa

texts.en:
Ma. Luisa is a 41-year-old married woman with three children, two of whom are currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Ma. Luisa has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Ma. Luisa requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Ma. Luisa has been in this business for 7 years. In the future, Ma. Luisa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie, age 26, saw her business and family home destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. She has started up her agricultural business again, and now she needs to provide her family with safe shelter. She and her husband have one child, who attends school. She works hard to provide for her family.

She has requested a PhP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF in order to rebuild her family home. She is using her loan funds to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

Annie is committed to rebuild her family's devastated life. In future, she would like to continue to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor to rebuild her family home

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a repeat client of UGAFODE Microfinance Ltd. (MDI). He is a resident of Muntungo zone 4, Nakawa division, and Kampala district. Joseph is married to Annet with one child, aged 2 months. 

Joseph has been a carpenter for the last 10 years. He managed to buy a plot of land, and he has been able to build a house on it using loans that he has acquired from UGAFODE. However, he faces a challenge of increased prices for timber and high electricity bills, since he uses machines that use power to make furniture. 

He has applied for a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan shillings to complete his house. This will help his family to get decent accommodation when the house is complete. He is very appreciative of the financial support from UGAFODE Microfinance Ltd.  Photographed is Joseph with the Ugafode credit officer(in a tie)left to right.

loans.use: To complete his residential house

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
He is a 51-year-old Ugandan married to Gertrude with whom he has 10 children. One of his children attends school. He has been a carpenter as his main business since 2000.

He has applied for a loan of UGX 1,000,000 to buy timber to make his products for sell. His plan for the future is to expand his business and completely finish his house to house his children. He started this project using the previous loan but the amount was insufficient, which is the reason he came for another loan. He is hard working though his main challenge is the low sales turnover in the business. He hopes this will soon be overcome with continuous financial support.

loans.use: to buy timber for making doors and frames

loans.name: Grupo La Trinidad Group

texts.es: Odilia es una mujer trabajadora de 46 años de edad, Soltera (Es la que aparece de primero de izquierda a derecha porta una blusa de color verde con figuras blancas), vive en el departamento de Suchitepéquez, su actividad productiva es la elaboración de bordados típicos, principalmente (cortes y blusas), lleva dos años en este negocio, la venta lo realiza en los mercados regionales de su comunidad, es una actividad rentable, donde obtiene la mayor parte de sus ingresos para poder ayudar a su familia, es por ello que formaron un grupo para apoyarse desde la elaboración hasta la venta del producto final, Odilia está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de materiales para la elaboración de los trajes típicos, la meta que tiene es poder incrementar sus ventas y tener sus propio local, actualmente alquila local para poder vender sus productos.
texts.en:
Odilia is a single, hard-working 46-year-old woman. (She is the one pictured on the left in a green blouse with white figures.)  She lives in the department of Suchitepéquez  and her main work is doing typical embroideries, mainly skirts and blouses. She has been doing this for two years and sells her products in the regional markets in her community.  It is a profitable activity and the majority of her earnings go to help her family. 

This is why they formed a group to support each other from production to the sale of the final product.  Odilia is asking for a loan so she can buy materials to make these typical pieces of clothing. Her goal is to increase her sales and have her own stand.  Currently she rents space to sell her products.

loans.use: to buy embroidery materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase sheet metal, wood, cement, sand and gravel to repair his roof and to cement his floor.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta de 25 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar conformado por su mamá, sus hermanos  y su hijo de 5 años de edad, ella se dedica a cultivar la tierra, su principal siembra es el maíz, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona, con lo que gana de sus ventas ayuda a solventar algunas necesidades que se le presentan en su hogar, la clienta solicita un crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas como: fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para continuar con sus siembras , y asi poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The client is 25 years old and lives in her own home with her family that includes her mother, her siblings and her five year old son.  She works as a farmer.  Her main crop is corn, which she sells around the region.  With her earnings, she is able to cover some of the necessities in her household.

She is seeking a loan to purchase agricultural supplies such as: fertilizers, manure, pesticides, herbicides, etc. to improve the land that can be seen in the picture, so that she can continue with her farming and provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: purchase fertilizers, manure, pesticides, herbicides, etc. to improve her land.

loans.name: Rosa Angelica

texts.es: Rosa de 46 años de edad vive con su grupo familiar conformado por su esposo y sus hijos, ella se dedica a la agricultura su principal siembra es el maíz y adicional a eso también se dedica a la venta de frutas en el mercado, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo ayuda a solventar algunas de las necesidades que se le presentan en su hogar, Rosa solicita a INTEGRAL  un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografía y así tener junto con su familia una mejor estabilidad económica sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Rosa is 46 years old and lives with her family, which includes her husband and her children.  She works as a farmer.  Her primary crop is corn, but she also sells fruit in the market.  With her earnings, she is able to help cover some of the necessary household expenses.  

Rosa is seeking a loan from Integral to purchase seeds, fertilizers, manure, pesticides, herbicides, etc. and to improve the land, which can be seen in the picture, so that her and her family can have a more stable financial situation.

loans.use: purchase seeds, fertilizers, manure, pesticides, herbicides, etc, and improve her land.

loans.name: Nely

texts.en: Nely, from Oroquieta, is 65 years old and married.  She personally tends her store in their barangay. Since she became a member of Paglaum MPC, she has been a member in good standing. She wants to obtain financial assistance from Paglaum MPC amounting to PHP 15,000 to buy merchandise for her sari-sari store.   In the future, she dreams of setting aside some savings from the daily sales, to renovate their house.  She wishes to see her children have stable jobs as well.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou, 56 years old, is a widow and resident of Ozamiz. She runs a snack vending business that helps support the family.

In 2013, Marilou joined Paglaum MPC to avail a loan because she wanted to buy raw ingredients such as flour, sugar, and milk. But aside from financial assistance she received, she said that she also enjoyed the add-on benefits like insurance and savings.  She has now applied for a loan of 15,000 PHP. She is hoping that with Paglaum’s help, she is looking forward to sustaining her business and hopes to own a stall in the public market.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients like flour, sugar, and milk

loans.name: Baltazar De Jesus

texts.es: Baltazar de 54 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar conformado por su esposa y dos hijas, el se dedica a la agricultura siembra maíz desde hace mas de 20 años, comercializa sus productos en las agencias de compra-venta de granos básicos que se encuentran ceca de su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra solventar algunas de las necesidades de su hogar, Baltazar solicita un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía y así poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Baltazar is 54 years old and lives in his own house with his family including his wife and two daughters. He is a farmer and has been growing corn for the past 20 years.  He sells his products at the basic grains exchanges which are located near his house. With the money he earns he is able to  cover some of the household's necessities.

Baltazar is asking for a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, manure, pesticides, etc. to improve the land shown in the photograph, and thus provide a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, manure, pesticides, etc. to improve the land.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet lives in Uganda, Kampala. She is a widow with five children and all of them go to school. She takes care of one additional family member. She has her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees.  

She sells chips, cassava and other snacks at the market on a retail basis. She works six  days a week .She has been in this business for the last five years. She gets additional income from poultry farming. 

She has requested a loan of Ugandan shillings 200,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy cooking oil, cassava, baking flour and chicken feeds. Her major challenge includes seasonality. Her goal and aspiration is to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy cooking oil and baking flour.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en: Eduardo is married and has seven children. He has operated his own farm for many years and he earns well to provide for his family. Eduardo recently borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase fertilizers. In the future, he wants to improve his farm and his entire family's general living situation.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony is a thirty-two-year-old married to Ann, who adds additional income to their family. They are blessed with two children aged two and four.  Anthony has been operating a retail shop for seven years. He earn an income of KES 10,000 at the end of every month.
  
Anthony is now servicing his fourth loan of KES 40,000 with VisionFund Kenya and intends to use this amount to add additional stock like; sugar,rice,detergents to his retail shop to satisfy his customers' needs.  The profits he earns will be used to expand his shop into a mega retail shop in his community and to educate his children.  He hopes to be a successful businessman and get rid of poverty in his community by opening a supermarket in the near future.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, detergents to sell in his retail shop to satisfy his customers' needs.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is 52 years old and married with three children.

Estrella works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks like diapers, sanitary pads, cooking oil, soy sauce, candies, biscuits, detergent soap, etc. to sell.

Estrella has borrowed and paid back 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

Estrella aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks like diapers, sanitary pads, cooking oil, soy sauce, candies, biscuits, detergent soap, etc. to sell

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 45 years old and married with four children, two of whom are in school. Myrna works very hard to provide for them.

Myrna's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Myrna has restarted her agriculture business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Myrna has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using the this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Myrna is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in future would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is 35 years old and married with two children, both of whom are in school. Joan works very hard to provide for them.

Joan's business and family home were destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. Joan has restarted her personal products retail business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Joan has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF in order to rebuild her family home. She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Joan is committed to rebuild her devastated life, and in the future would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden, 39 years old, is married and has five children who are in school. Eden and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home was wiped out. 

Eden is taking out a housing loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. Eden has been with NWTF since 2012. She plans to recover through selling school supplies.

With your help, Eden can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Mwanarusi

texts.en:
Mwanarusi appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards and enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income.
