She is requesting a loan to purchase bales of clothes to sell. She thanks Yehu Microfinance Trust for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Sakhom

texts.en: Sakhom is 42 years old, a farmer and a married woman with three children. Two of her children work in a garment factory and another is a student. Her husband is a farmer, farming rice and peanuts. They live in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. They can earn approximately $11 per day. Now she would like to apply for a loan of $700 to buy new roofing tiles to renovate her house. This loan will help her live in a better condition. In the future, she is going to buy more farmland, build a bathroom and support her child to finish High School.

loans.use: To buy new roofing tiles to renovate her house

loans.name: Cheak

texts.en: Cheak is a 35-year-old motor mechanic, and a married man with two children who are students. His wife is a housewife. They live in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. He can earn approximately $10 per day. Now he would like to apply for a loan of 600 USD to buy motor parts to sell to his customers. This loan will help him have enough money to buy more parts to meet his customers’ needs and increase his income. In the future, he wants to have a bigger stall for motor repair, renovate his house, and support his children to finish high school and then find jobs.

loans.use: to buy motor parts to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Aspeed Group

texts.en:
The featured borrower of Aspeed Group, Batayola, along with his other group members, is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua. They have been friends since they arrived to work in Lebanon in order to better support their families.

Batayola is a 37-year-old married father of two who works as a chef in a restaurant to provide his family with a better income. Pictured on the far right, he will use his loan portion to help pay for his children's education tuition fees back in the Philippines.  

The other group members are pictured in this photo: Joel Kennith is the second from the right, Ygot is the second from the left, while Zaldyjr is the first from the left.

loans.use: to pay for his children's education tuition fees back in the Philippines

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is a 27-year-old married mother of two who established in May 2014 her own children's clothes selling shop to help her husband, who traveled abroad seeking a better work opportunity to cover the family's expenses and improve their living.

Diana is a hard worker, and has proved within this short time that she has remarkable customer service talents. Her income is fine, but she is seeking better opportunities to develop her business more. She is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with a newly released summer collection, especially for the end of holy month of Ramadan celebrations.

This is Diana's second cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower. Through her previous loan she did necessary work at her house. She is very excited about this loan and is sure that it will provide her with a better income, and will develop her business properly.

loans.use: To increase her business merchandise with a newly released summer collection, especially for the end of holy month of Ramadan celebrations

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new tractor.

loans.name: Sinza E Group

texts.en:
MWAJUMA, who is in her late 30s, is single with one child who is still at school. She has been running a grocery selling beers, juices, waters, wine, and sodas for five years now. She is doing great with her business, working from 4 AM until after midnight and is able to realize a good profit each month. 

Mwajuma, together with other five members of Sinza E group, will hold each other accountable to repay back the loan.

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is her second loan which she will use to buy beers, sodas, juice, spirits, and wine for the grocery. She used the previous loan, and she repaid it back successfully, to buy grocery beers, sodas, water, wine, and spirits. Mwajuma is thankful to everyone who has supported and keeps supporting her group. She received a profit which she used to provide services for her family: paying medical and household expenses and school fees for her child. Her dream is to greatly open a big bar.

loans.use: to buy beers, sodas, juice, spirits, and wine for the grocery

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of groceries

loans.name: Lucina

texts.en:
Lucina is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 43 years old, and her three children are in school.

Lucina has a furniture-making business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials such as wood, paint, nails, etc. for her business.

Lucina has been in this business for 18 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional materials such as wood, paint, nails, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Yowelyn

texts.en:
Yowelyn is 43 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school. Yowelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Yowelyn's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Yowelyn has restarted her food vending business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Yowelyn has taken a 10,000 PHP housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using the this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Yowelyn is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in the future would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma, 49 years old, is married and has three children, one of them currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

For the past 8 years, Emma has had a business buying and selling herbal products in the Philippines. Emma has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional herbal products to sell to her customers. In the future, Emma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional herbal products to sell to her customers

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.en:
Antonieta is a 37-year-old married woman with three children, two of whom are currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Antonieta has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Antonieta requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall.

Antonieta has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Antonieta would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is 54 years old with one child.

Juliana works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like fabric conditioner, detergent soap, coffee, sugar, bread, candies, and biscuits to sell.

Juliana has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 6 years and also earns additional income from raising chickens.

Juliana aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph lives in Kagadi-Uganda.  He deals in produce, alcohol, and a retail shop. He ventured into this business to develop himself and look after his family. He is a 39-year-old, honest and hard working, married man with seven children. They are aged between 17 and 2 years old, six of whom attend school. Joseph hopes to make more income and to educate his children despite the problems of price fluctuations and bad debtors. He is requesting for loan to buy more maize and coffee to sell.

loans.use: to buy more maize and coffee to sell.

loans.name: Maricen

texts.en:
Maricen is 42 years old, married, and has seven children who are in school.

Maricen and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home was wiped out. 

Maricen is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Maricen has been a NWTF borrower since 2012. She plans to recover through her general store business.

With your help, Maricen can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In future She would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 60 years old and widowed with five children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Julieta is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional livestock and other supplies for her business.

Julieta has been raising livestock for 20 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling dried coconut meat.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 48 years old and married with two children. 

Gloria is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Gloria requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Gloria has been in the pig fattening for 10 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Gloria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria works hard to support her family. Gloria is married and has a buy and sell rice grains business in the Philippines.

Gloria requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice grains to sell.

Gloria has been in this business for 10 years now.

Gloria would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Victor Alberto

texts.es: Víctor de 41 años de edad vive en casa propia con su  esposa y sus hijos, el tiene un taller de bicicletas y reparación de llantas de carro, ubicado en su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra  solventar algunas de las necesidades de su hogar, Victor solicita un crédito para la compra de repuestos para bicicletas por mayor  para continuar con el negocio, y  poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Víctor is 41 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and children. He has a bicycle and tire repair shop that he has run for many years from his home. He uses his earnings to cover household expenses.

Victor is asking for a loan to buy wholesale bicycle parts, in order to keep his business going and be able to give his family a better quality of life, without any limitations.

loans.use: buy wholesale bicycle parts.

loans.name: Yeskiel

texts.en:
Yeskiel come from east Timor, but now lives in Bali. He moved from his village try to find a better life in Bali. His wife is from Bali. To make a living, Yeskiel and his wife have a business as a cake makers. They make various kinds of cake and sell to every kiosk in their area. His cakes have a unique taste because the cake mixes the tastes of Timor and Bali; this has made his cake famous.

Sometimes they can’t afford the orders from their customers. To improve his business, Yeskiel proposed a loan to MUK to purchase more cake ingredients such as powder, sugar, and chocolate. Yeskiel will also purchase the tools to make a cake, like a blender and mixer. Yeskiel hopes he can increase his income because he and his wife have a dream to own their own home. Now they still rent a house.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients and tools to support his cake business

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself as time conscious. Susan operates a restaurant where she cooks food to sell and also sells drinks. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in an area with potential, and her primary customers are daily customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough capital. She will use the 80,000 KES loan to buy stock of ingredients for preparing the food she sells. 

Susan's business goal is to have an expanded and big business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will create more employment opportunities. This is her tenth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans worth 200,000 KES were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy stock of ingredients for preparing food

loans.name: Anelyn

texts.en:
Anelyn is 24 years old, married, and has two children, one of whom is in school.

Anelyn and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home was wiped out. 

Anelyn is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Anelyn has been a NWTF borrower since 2012. She plans to recover through her agriculture business.

With your help, Anelyn can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
Lucita is 58 years old and married.

Lucita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Lucita has borrowed and paid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

Lucita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for transport

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel, 33 years old, is married and has two children, both in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Maribel's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her business raising livestock and is committed to regaining what she lost. Maribel is taking out a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Maribel has been with NWTF since 2012 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Maribel would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a mother of one and owns a school at the expansive Mukuru informal settlements in Nairobi,Kenya. The school is fairly young and has a population of about 55 children attending. Being in a slum, she has not been able to secure land for building a pit latrine for the children. 

However, Jane learned about the Fresh Life toilet and thought it would be a perfect solution for the school's lack of a sanitation facility. She seeks a loan to help her purchase and run one Fresh Life toilet for the school. The facility will go a long way in ensuring that pupils are comfortable whenever they are at school.

loans.use: to purchase and run one Fresh Life Toilet

loans.name: Sonia Janeth

texts.es: Sonia de 47 años de edad  vive en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida, ella posee una tortillería ubicada en su lugar de residencia, posee mucha clientela por la amabilidad y los buenos precios, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunas de las necesidades de su hogar, Sonia solicita un crédito para compra de maíz por quintales y cal,  y asi poder tener junto a su compañero de vida una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Sonia is 47 years old and lives in her own house with her partner. She has a tortilla shop located in her home. She has a large clientele because of her friendliness and good prices. She is able to cover some her household needs with what she makes from her sales. Sonia is requesting a loan to buy corn by quintal and lime, which will allow her to have a better quality of life with her partner.

loans.use: to buy corn by quintal and lime.

loans.name: Purwandri

texts.en: Purwandri lives in Bogor, a satellite city located about a 1 hour drive from Jakarta. Purwandri is married and living with three people in the family home. He runs a small stall selling mobile phone airtime credits. He began working with Ruma one month ago because not only did he want to add more income, but he is also excited about learning how to use mobile technology to run his business more efficiently. As the business continues to run, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a 44-year-old, married woman with two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Marites's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her general store business and is committed to regain what she lost. Marites is taking out a 10,000 PHP housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Marites has been with NWTF since 2012 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Marites would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Marichu

texts.en:
Marichu is 44 years old and single.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Marichu is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Marichu has been in the pig fattening business for five years and earns additional income from fish vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream of saving to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is 31 years old and married with two children, both are in school. Roselyn works very hard to provide for them.

Roselyn's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Roselyn has restarted her food vending business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Roselyn has taken a 10,000 PHP housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Roselyn is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in the future would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Rasha

texts.en:
Rasha is a 25-year-old married woman, who has been working in the beauty business since 2009. She is a hard worker and is well-known in the region for her special talents and experience in her domain. 

To continue to meet her customers' requests, she is applying for second youth loan cycle from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to redecorate her shop to make it more attractive to her customers. Her previous youth loan were invested in buying newly released nail color collections, which helped her in replying to her customers' requests. She also paid for her wedding expenses.

She is planning to keep on expanding and developing her business to keep her customers satisfied and to attract new customers.

loans.use: to redecorate her shop to make it more attractive to her customers

loans.name: Bilal

texts.en:
Bilal is a 24-year-old single man who has been selling silver for seven years. In May 2013, he established his current business to develop his living and increase his income.

He is well-known in his region with his good reputation and special talents in his domain. Today, he is acquiring his second Youth loan from Kiva's field  partner Al Majmoua in order to increase his business merchandise with newly released silver accessories, especially before';;; the end of Holy month of Ramadan celebrations. Through this loan, he will diversify his products and attract the attention of customers.

Bilal is looking forward to continuing to develop and improve his business in a well-managed way to be able in the future to open another branch or start a wholesale trade, if possible.

loans.use: To increase his business merchandise with newly released silver accessories

loans.name: María Dolores

texts.es:
EL Grupo Crédito San Pedro De Pueblo que se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Pueblo Nuevo del Cantón Santa Ana, lugar de gente honesta y dedicada a las faenas del campo y a la ganadería, con bellos paisajes campestres y gente amable.
En este lugar vive a la señora María, tiene 61 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo es agricultor.
Doña María es una muy buena esposa que le gusta ganar lo propio para con esto ayudarle a su marido con los gastos que genera el hogar, ella se dedica a la venta productos de Belcorp (perfumes, cremas, bisutería entre otras cosas), su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, deja a crédito y cobra cada ocho días, ella también se dedica a la cría de pollos y chanchos, ella cría estos animalitos y luego los entrega a comerciantes  que los llevan a otras ciudades a vender con lo cual se gana algo por el bien de su familia,  ella lleva más de 8 años con la venta de productos de catálogo y le va muy bien.
Este crédito es para comprar cremas, perfumes y alimento para los pollos y chanchos. Lleva 6 ciclos en el Grupo Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y sin tantos requisitos. Sus sueños son  tener buena salud.
texts.en:
The San Pedro de Pueblo loan group meets every two weeks in the parish of Pueblo Nuevo in the Canton of Santa Ana, a place with honest people who are dedicated to the jobs in the countryside and to ranching. It is full of beautiful country landscapes and kind people.

Maria, 61, lives here. She is married and has four adult children who are independent. Her husband is a farmer.

Maria is a good wife who likes to earn her own money to work with her husband to pay for household expenses. She makes a living selling products from Belcorp (perfumes, creams, jewelry, and other items). She sells door to door on credit, which is paid off every week. She also raises chickens and pigs. She raises these animals and then delivers them to vendors who take them to other cities to sell. This helps her earn money for her family's good. She has over eight years of experience selling products from catalogues and it's going well.

This loan is to buy creams, perfumes, and food for her chickens and pigs. She has had six loan cycles with the loan group and she likes it because the loans are quick, without a lot of requirements. Her dream is to be in good health.

loans.use: to buy creams, perfumes, and food for her chickens and pigs.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.es: Rachel de 39 años de edad, es madre soltera vive solo con sus dos hijos mayores de edad, se dedica a la venta de tortillas, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, posee mucha clientela por la amabilidad y los buenos precios, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunas de las necesidades de su hogar, Rachel  solicita un crédito a INTEGRAL para la compra de maíz por mayor y cal, y asi poder tener junto a sus dos hijos una mejor calidad de vida sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Rachel is 39 years old and is a single mother who lives with her two grown children. She works selling tortillas and her business is located in her home. She has many customers because of her friendly nature and good prices. With the income from her tortilla sales she covers household expenses. 

Rachel is asking for a loan from INTEGRAL [Kiva Field Partner] in order to buy wholesale corn and lime, so that she and her children can enjoy a better quality of life with no limitations.

loans.use: buy wholesale corn and lime.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is a married, Ugandan man with 4 children, 2 of whom are attending school. He lives in Kagadi where he deals in cattle fattening and farming to raise income to support his family. Through his hard work he desires to educate his children, despite the rampant theft and foot-and-mouth disease affecting cattle.

William is asking for a loan to buy more cattle for fattening to sell.

loans.use: to buy more cattle for fattening to sell

loans.name: Sonia Maribel

texts.es: Sonia de 48 años de edad, es madre soltera vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de quesadillas y tortas de pan, vende de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, tiene clientela establecida que la prefieren por la calidad con que está hecho el pan, con lo que gana de sus ventas logra cubrir algunas de las necesidades que se le presentan en su hogar, Sonia solicita un crédito para la compra de pan y quesadillas por mayor para continuar con sus ventas y asi poder dar a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Sonia is 48 years old. She is a single mother who lives in her own house with her three children. She works selling quesadillas and sandwiches. She sells in the streets of the various neighborhoods that are close to her place of residence. She has an established clientele who prefer her for the quality of the bread. With what she makes from her sales she manages to pay for some of the things needed in her household. Sonia is requesting a loan to buy bread and quesadillas wholesale so she can continue with her sales and be able to provide a better quality of living for her children.

loans.use: to buy bread and quesadillas wholesale.

loans.name: San

texts.en:
San, a 58-year-old father of one depended adolescent and two married children, lives in Batheay district, Kampong Cham province and Cambodia. He is a farmer who operates a farming business on a small rice field that is located near his house. The daily earning that he can make is about USD 5.

San has one more piece of farmland on which he does not yet grow anything and he plans to grow peanuts in the near future as he thinks that peanuts will be the high demand product in the next year. Due to the shortage of capital investment, he would like to request a loan now to buy peanut seeds and fertilizers. He hopes that this loan will help him to achieve his business plan as well as a bright and better life for his family.

loans.use: to buy peanut seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Zipporah

texts.en: Zipporah is a married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself as committed. She operates a beauty salon where she offers hair dressing services. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in an area fit for the business and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. She will use the 120,000 KES loan to buy a stock of beauty products for use in the salon. Her business goal is to be successful within 5 years. She will use the anticipated profits for family development and loan repayment.

loans.use: to buy stock of beauty products for use in the salon

loans.name: Wesley

texts.en: Wesley is a single man. He describes himself to be ambitious. He operates a retail shop where he sells sugar, flour, salt. and other items. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insecurity. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, salt. and other items. His business goal is to own a wholesale business within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will succeed. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of sugar, bread, salt, and other items

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a direct selling of personal collection and Avon products business in the Philippines.

Emelia requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more products of personal collection and Avon to sell to her customers.

Emelia has been in this business for 23 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Emelia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase personal collection and Avon products to sell to her customers

loans.name: Narcy

texts.en:
Narcy is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Narcy is 38 years old and has three children, who are currently in school.

Narcy has a food vending business in the Philippines. Narcy requested a 10,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Narcy has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Narcy would like to save enough money so that she will be able to afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 69 years old and married with 11 children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Erlinda is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Erlinda has been in the pig fattening business for six years and earns additional income from farming rice and sugarcane and from her general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Acila Mary

texts.es:
EL Grupo Crédito San Pedro De Pueblo que se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Pueblo Nuevo del Cantón Santa Ana, lugar de gente honesta y dedicada a las faenas del campo y a la ganadería, con bellos paisajes campestres y gente amable.
En este lugar vive la señora Acila, tiene 46 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tienen seis hijos, tres mayores y tres de 16, 13 y 11 años que estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo es agricultor.
Doña Acila realiza el crédito para su esposo ya que se dedica a la agricultura, el siempre siembra cultivos de arroz, maíz y verduras, ella se encarga de realizar los créditos con los cuales financian estos cultivos mientras que su marido es quien se dedica a los trabajos en el campo junto con dos personas más a quienes les pagan por su trabajo,  siembran en toda época del año ya que cuentan con las bombas de riego para esto, actualmente es la época de recolección de los frutos por lo cual requiere del crédito. 
Este crédito lo va emplear en pagar mano de obra para trabajos en la recolección de los cultivos. Está en el Grupo de Crédito desde hace 7 ciclos y le  gusta porque le ayudan con los créditos. Sus sueños es tener buena salud para ella y los suyos.
texts.en:
The San Pedro de Pueblo loan group meets every two weeks in the parish of Pueblo Nuevo in the Canton of Santa Ana, a place with honest people who are dedicated to the jobs in the countryside and to ranching. It is full of beautiful country landscapes and kind people.

Acilia, 46, lives here. She is in a civil union and has six children. Three are adults and the others are 16, 13, and 11. These three are in school. Her husband is a farmer.

Alicia is requesting this loan on behalf of her husband, who works as a farmer. He always plants rice, corn, and vegetables. She is in charge of obtaining loans to finance the crops while her husband works the land with two other people who are paid for their work. They plant all year around and depend on irrigation pumps for their work. Currently, it is the fruit harvesting season, which is why they need the loan.

This loan is going to be used to pay laborers for their work in harvesting the crops. This is her seventh loan cycle with the loan group, and she likes it because they help with the loans. Her dream is for her and her loved ones to be in good health.

loans.use: to pay for labor.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
Angelica es una joven trabajadora, tiene 22 años de edad, es soltera y vive en Ica junto a su familia.
Es madre soltera, tiene un pequeño hijo quien es su mayor motivación en la vida para salir adelante y por quien día a día lucha para poder brindarle un futuro mejor y una educación de calidad.
Actualmente está estudiando la carrera de Enfermería y desde hace algún tiempo trabaja en una empresa de Telefonía, le va muy bien porque es muy responsable, trabajadora, entusiasta y muy amable y respetuosa con los clientes.
Angelica está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá comprar un ropero para su hijo, de esta manera  estará mejorando la calidad de vida de su familia y seguirá esforzándose para poder convertirse en una gran profesional.
texts.en:
Angelica is a young worker who is 22 years old. She is single and lives with her family in Ica. She is a single mother with a young son who is her motivation in life. For him she goes out day after day to get ahead and to strive to provide him with a better future and a quality education. Currently she is studying to be a nurse and for some time has been working in a Telephone company. Things are going well for her as she is very responsible, hard-working, enthusiastic, very friendly and respectful of the customer.

Angelica is grateful to the lenders at Kiva as thanks to the support they have provided her she can buy a wardrobe for her son. in this way she can improve the quality of life for her family and continue to struggle to be able to become a great professional.

loans.use: to buy a wardrobe for her son.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: Juliana is a Kiva borrower. She operates a farm where she grows crops. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be poor roads. She also owns a retail shop, where she sells household goods. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy fertilizer for use on her farm, and to stock cooking fat, sugar and other household products to sell in her retail shop. Her business goal is to be able to do large scale farming within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a big shop. This is her fifth loan with SMEP Micro-finance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farm, and to stock  cooking fat, sugar, and other household products to sell.

loans.name: Eulogio Feliciano

texts.es:
EL Grupo Crédito San Pedro De Pueblo que se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Pueblo Nuevo del Cantón Santa Ana, lugar de gente honesta y dedicada a las faenas del campo y a la ganadería, con bellos paisajes campestres y gente amable.
En este lugar vive don Eulogio, tiene 49 años de edad, está casado y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos mayores de edad, los tres mayores estudian en universidad y el menor en  colegio. Su esposa es ama de casa.
El señor Eulogio se dedica a la agricultura, cría de chanchos y ganado y a la venta de leche y quesos entre otras cosas,  el todos los días se levanta muy de mañana a ordeñar sus vacas para luego salir a entregar la leche y el queso que su mujer prepara el día anterior, el vende a comerciantes y personas de la localidad. El también siembra maíz, maní y arroz en la época invernal, actualmente está en la recolección de los frutos razón por lo cual necesita de urgencia este crédito. 
Este crédito es para pagar mano de obra en la recolección de los frutos así como para comprar alimento para los animales. Lleva 3 años en el  Grupo Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que siempre le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños son darle lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
The Credit Group San Pedro De Pueblo meets every fifteen days in the parish Pueblo Nuevo del Canton Santa Ana, a place with honest people who are dedicated to work in farming and livestock, with beautiful country landscapes and friendly people. 

In this place lives Eulogio. He is 49 years old and married, and from this relationship he has four adult children. The three oldest are in University, and the youngest is in high school. His wife takes care of the home.

Señor Eulogio makes a living in farming, raising pigs and cattle, and selling milk and cheese among other things. Every day he gets up very early in the morning to milk his cows and then leaves to deliver the milk and the cheese that his wife prepares the previous day. He sells to merchants and people from the area. He also plants maize, peanuts and rice in the winter season, and currently is collecting the fruits of these, which is why he urgently needs this loan. 

This loan is to pay for labour to collect the fruits and to buy food for the animals. He has been in this Credit Group for 3 years and likes it for the help which the loans always bring him. His dreams are to provide the very best for his family.

loans.use: to pay the labour and to buy food for his animals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials.

loans.name: Melania

texts.en:
Melania is 28 years old and married with five children. With three children in school, Melania works very hard to provide for them. Her business and family home were destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Melania has restarted her fish vending business, and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

She has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using this loan to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor. Melania is committed to rebuild her devastated life, and in the future, would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en: Rowena works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business directly selling Avon products in the Philippines. Rowena has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more products from Avon like lipsticks, perfumes, lotion, etc. to sell. She has been in this business for 10 years now. Rowena would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more products from Avon like lipsticks, perfumes, lotion, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Zarrina

texts.ru:
Заррине 30 лет. Она одна воспитывает двоих маленьких детей. У нее среднее образование. Для того , чтобы создать хорошие условия для своих детей эта женщина работает не смотря на трудности. Она предоставляет  услуги чистки квартир и получает от этого занятия дополнительный доход.Заррина также занимается животноводством для того чтобы немного увеличить свой бюджет от выращивания скота. Хотя этой хрупкой женщине не легко одной поднимать двоих детей но она не падает духом и постоянно работает над тем, чтобы улучшить условия для детей и хочет чтобы ее дети не чувствовали недостатка.
 Для приобретения кормов ей необходимо немного денег. Она хочет на полученный кредит приобрести корм для скота. Так как Заррина является не новым клиентом в "Арванд" и у нее хорошая кредитная история она повторно обратилась в "Арванд" за кредитом. Заррина заранее благодарна МДО "Арванд" за  поддержку.
texts.en:
Zarrina is 30 and raising two young children on her own. She has a high school education and works hard in spite of her difficulties in order to take good care of her children. She cleans apartments for income and also works in animal husbandry in order to expand her budget by raising cattle. While it's not easy for her to take care of her children on her own, she doesn't lose heart and constantly works toward bettering their living conditions so that they don't have to experience hardship.

Zarrina needs some money in order to buy feed. She intends to use the loan amount to buy feed for her cattle. Since she is not a new client with Arvand, she has a good credit history and has come back to Arvand for a new loan. Zarrina thanks Arvand in advance for the support.

loans.use: to buy cattle feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his children's increasing school tuition fees.

loans.name: Susana Jacqueline

texts.es:
En San Ignacio de la  parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora y dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Grupo De Crédito 3 De Septiembre.
En este lugar vive la señora Susana, tiene 29 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de  7 y de 9 meses el menor, el mayor estudia en escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña Susana con la finalidad de contar con sus propios ingresos para los gastos de sus pequeños hijos  se dedica a la venta de ropa, interiores, zapatos, carteras, entre otras cosas, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta o en su casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes, ella sale tres días a la semana más que todo en las horas de la mañana ya que a esas horas le resulta más fácil realizar sus recorridos porque su mamá le ayuda en el cuidados de sus pequeños, ella deja a crédito y cobra cada 8 días. Lleva más de 5 años en su negocio con el cual ayuda a su familia a salir adelante. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar ropa,  perfumes, zapatos, carteras, entre  otros productos. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo de  Crédito y le gusta porque así mejora su negocio. Sus sueños darle lo mejor a sus pequeños hijos.
texts.en:
In San Ignacio of the Colon parish in the city of Portoviejo, a place known for its hardworking people who specialize in farming and livestock, the members of the Credit Group '3 de Septiembre' meet every fifteen days. 

This is where Susana lives. She is 29 years old and married, and from this relationship has two children of 7 and of 9 months. The eldest is in school, and her husband is a merchant. 

Susana, with the end goal of counting on her own income for her little children's expenses, works selling clothes, undergarments, shoes, and wallets, among other things. Her method of selling is door to door or from her home which her customers come to. She goes out three days a week, mostly in the morning hours since at this time it is much easier for her to make her rounds because her mother helps to look after her little ones. She allows credit, and collects every 8 days. 

She has had her business for more than 5 years, with which she helps her family to get ahead. 

She will use this loan to buy clothing, perfumes, shoes, and wallets, among other products. She has been with this Credit Group since the start, and likes it because it allows her to improve her business. Her dream is to provide the very best for her little children.

loans.use: to buy clothing, perfumes, shoes, wallets, etc.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman who describes herself as someone with great potential. For the past three years she has had a sewing shop where she makes clothes. Price fluctuations are her main business challenge.

Jane is applying for a 20,000 KES loan through SMEP to buy a sewing machine. Her goal is to see her business grow ever larger. She will use her anticipated profits to open a boutique someday.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Democrito

texts.en: Democrito signed up for his membership with PMPC and obtained the needed capital to start his snack vending business. He is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like him. Democrito is able to turn the tide in his favor and is making good sales these days. He wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, he took a loan to purchase bags of flour, sugar and other raw ingredients for snack vending. In the future, he hopes to open a refreshment parlor in the market.

loans.use: to purchase bags of flour and sugar and other raw ingredients to make snacks to sell

loans.name: Tanios

texts.en: Tanios is a 21-year-old single man, the sole earner in his family, responsible for supporting two other members of the family. He is a hard worker. He has been working for a transportation company for three years to support his beloved family. Tanios is acquiring a youth loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to do necessary maintenance on his car, which is very important for his own business needs and family's requests. He hopes that one day he can start his own business and improve his family's living.

loans.use: To do necessary maintenance on his business car

loans.name: Esperacion

texts.en:
Esperacion is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Esperacion is 36 years old and has three children who are in school.

Esperacion has a computer services business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials like computer ink, bond paper, etc. for her business.

Esperacion has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials like computer ink and bond paper for her business

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela is 56 years old, married and has three children, two of whom are in college. She and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her sari-sari, or general store, and the family home were wiped out. Her revived sari-sari has helped in the family’s recovery.

Adela has been a NWTF client since 2011. She is applying for a 9,866 PHP housing loan to buy construction materials and pay for labor to rebuild a house for her family.

Adela is working to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college. In the future she would also like to expand her shop. With your help, Adela can rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan.

loans.use: to buy construction materials and pay for labor to rebuild a house for her family.

loans.name: María

texts.es: María es una mujer trabajadora de 46 años de edad, Casada, tiene dos hijos varones, quienes vive en el departamento de Suchitepéquez. La actividad principal es la compra y venta de frutas (zapote, banano y piña), la venta lo realiza en los días de plaza de su comunidad y a los alrededores, la compra de frutas es demandada por la población en general, y que son pocos que se dedican a esta actividad por lo que la hace rentable, y es donde obtiene la mayor parte de sus ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia. Está solicitando un préstamo de Q 5,000.00 para la compra de un lote de terreno. La meta que tiene es dejar a sus hijos terrenos para construir su propia casa y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
María is a hardworking woman of 46 years of age. She is married, and has two male children, who live in the department of Suchitepéquez. Her main job is the buying and selling of fruits (sapodilla, bananas and pineapple). She sells on market days in her community and surrounding areas. The purchase of fruit is in demand, and very few do it, which makes it a profitable activity. This is where she obtains the majority of the income which supports her family.

She is asking for a loan of 5,000 Guatemalan quetzals ($650 USD) to purchase a plot of land. Her goal is to leave land to her children so they can build their own house, and to give a better quality of life to her family.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land.

loans.name: Ataobung Group

texts.en:
As solar lighting is getting popular day-by-day, the use of solar lights is becoming common in households. As the electricity rates are going up rapidly now, the use of solar is getting popular. This group of five women from Imphal East wanted to take a solar loan for their income-generating activities and for their household use.

Gomti is the featured profile member of Ataobung group, pictured with her hand raised. She is 38 years old and lives with her three children and husband in Imphal East. She is a weaver by profession and her husband is a government employee. This will be Gomti’s second loan from Kiva. With the first loan she took, she bought yarn and other necessary items for weaving. With the second loan, she wants to buy a 45-watt solar system that comes with a 90-meter-long wire and four bulbs. Since solar home lighting systems are generally excellent options to give in-house illumination in the rural areas and un-electrified villages, she wants to install one in her home so that she can weave and her children can study comfortably under the solar light after sunset. Likewise, the rest of the group members need solar home lighting systems to light up their homes and for their income-generating activities.

loans.use: To buy a solar home lighting system to use for weaving after sunset.

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita is 45 years old, married and had four children. She and her spouse are farmers, planting and harvesting corn to sell. 

She wanted to improve her crop output, but had insufficient funds to sustain her crops. She is now asking for additional capital of PHP 10,000 to buy fertilizers and insecticides to use in farming. These farm inputs will help maintain crop production to give her a plentiful harvest someday. 

She will save additional capital to sustain the school needs of her children and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides to use in farming.

loans.name: Reginaldo

texts.pt:
O senhor  Reginaldo  é pensionista pai de 7 filhos dos quais 3 estão já nas suas casas e 4 a estudarem e sustenta um neto que vive com ele.
Diz que com o valor irá comprar  cimento, areia e pedra  para fazer blocos para iniciar a construção de uma casa para seus filhos num espaço que adiquiriu próximo de sua casa.
Seus planos para o futuro terminar a construção da casa de seus filhos e fazer um aviário no seu quintal onde podera criar frangos para reforçar a renda familiar.
Diz que vai honrar com as datas estabelecidas para as prestações e que irá solicitar mais empréstimos concretizar seus sonhos.
texts.en:
Reginaldo is retired and has seven children, 3 of whom are independent and 4 of whom are in school. He also cares for a grandson who lives with him. 

Reginaldo plans to use this loan to buy cement, sand and stone to make blocks and to start construction of a house for his children on land that he bought next to his house.

His plans for the future are to finish building the house for his children and to build a chicken coop in his yard where he can raise chickens to supplement the family income.

He says he will pay off the loan by the established time and will then take out other loans in order to make his dreams a reality.

loans.use: buy cement, sand and stone to make blocks for construction.

loans.name: Gertrude

texts.pt:
A Sra. Gertrude de 47 anos de idade casada e mae de 7 filhos dos quais 5 sao todos maiores de idade e 2 estao a frequentar a escola no ensino primario, sustenta 2 sobrinhos. Ela è negociante informal de capulanas, calcado, saias e è tambem vendedora de peixe, caraguejo e lagosta, actividade que esta a ser acompanhada junto com seu esposo uma vez que o seu esposo è pescador artezanal, seus produtos vende a porta da sua casa e em diversos mercados de Boane.
Com o presente emprestimo sera aplicado para comprar rede de pesca para dar continuidade com actividade do seu esposo.
texts.en:
Gertrude is 47 years old and is married with seven children, five of whom are grown and two of whom are in elementary school. She also cares for two nephews. 

Gertrude works selling shoes, skirts and capulanas (a traditional sarong from Mozambique). Along with her husband, who is a small-scale fisherman, she also sells fish, crabs and lobsters from their house and in various markets in Boane.

With this loan she will buy a fishing net in order to help with her husband's work.

loans.use: buy a fishing net in order to help with her husband's work.

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en: Samwel is a married man. He has four children. He describes himself to be vibrant. He operates a tailoring shop where he makes clothes. He has been involved in this business for eight years. His primary customers are the general public. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy tailoring materials. His business goal is to have a bigger store within 5 years. He hopes that in the future he will be successful. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy tailoring materials.

loans.name: Ana Yadira

texts.es:
En San Ignacio de la  parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora y dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Grupo De Crédito 3 De Septiembre.
En este lugar vive la señora Ana, tiene 35 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro  hijos, dos mayores de edad y dos de 9 y 5 años que estudian en escuela. El marido trabaja en la ciudad de Guayaquil. 
Doña Ana tiene una tienda de viveras de consumo en su casa,  allí vende todo tipo de productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, legumbres, verduras y frutas, allí también vende productos de bazar y papelería y productos Avon (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas), trabaja todos días y sus ventas son muy buenas ya que su negocio está frente a una escuela y los estudiantes siempre llegan a comprar en su local. Tienen más de 11 años que se dedica con la cual se gana algo por el bien de su familia.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, entre otros productos de primera necesidad. Está desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los  créditos les ayudan mucho. Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
The members of the credit association 3 De Septiembre meet every fifteen days in San Ignacio, parish of Colon, in the city of Portoviejo. This city is known for its hard working people dedicated to agriculture and cattle raising. 

Ana lives in this place. She is 35 years old and has a common law relationship from which she has four children -- two adults, a 5 year-old and a 9 year-old who are in school. Her partner works in the city of Guayaquil.

Ana has a grocery store in her house, where she sells all types of products such as rice, sugar, oil, detergent, vegetables, legumes and fruits. She also sells miscellaneous products, stationary, and Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and accessories for women). She works every day and her sales are very good as her business is in front of a school and the students always shop at her store. She has had this occupation for 11 years and it allows her to earn something for the good of her family. 

She will use this loan to stock her store. She will buy rice, sugar, oil, and detergent, among other basic products. She has been part of the credit group since the beginning. She likes it because the loans are very helpful. Her goals are to go on with her business and for the store to grow every day.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergent and other basic products.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.pt:
A Sra. Lidia de 49 anos de idade solteira e mae de 4 filhos dos quais 2 estao a frequentar a escola no ensino primario e secundario e os 2 sao maior de idade e independentes. Ela exerce actividade de sacha numa empresa de producao de banana a mais de 5 anos.
Com o presente emprestimo sera aplicado para comprar material de construcao (chapas de zinco, barrotes, porta, blocos e pagamento de mao-de-obra) para  dar continuidade com a construcao da sua casa.
Tem como grande sonho melhorar as condicoes de habitacao e a dieta almentar da sua familia.
texts.en:
Lidia is 49 years old and is a single mother with four children, two of whom are in elementary and high school and two of whom are grown and independent. She has been working for more than five years doing weeding for a company that grows bananas.   

With this loan Lidia will buy construction materials (zinc plates, metal bars, blocks, a door) and will pay workers to continue with the construction of her house. Her greatest dream is to improve her family's living conditions and diet.

loans.use: buy construction materials (zinc plates, metal bars, blocks, a door) and pay workers to continue with the construction of her house.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion works hard to support her family. Salvacion is married and has a buy and sell rice grains business in the Philippines.

Salvacion requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell.

Salvacion has been in this business for three years now.

Salvacion would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena is 54 years of age, widowed and has four children. She has managed a hog raising business for almost 20 years and earns a net income of PHP 2,000 for every one hog. Her net income on this business is usually spent on their food expenses. Due to insufficient funds she would like to avail herself of a loan amounting to PHP 30,000 to purchase hog feed for her hogs. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she will be able to improve her business more.

loans.use: to purchase hog feed for her hogs.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a married woman with three children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Evelyn is 37 years old.

Evelyn has a buy and sell rice grains business in the Philippines. Evelyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more sacks of rice grains to sell.

Evelyn has been in this business for five years. In the future Evelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice grains to sell.

loans.name: Jenny De Los Angeles

texts.es:
En San Ignacio de la  parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora y dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Grupo De Crédito 3 De Septiembre.
En este lugar vive la señora Jenny, tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 17, 13 y 7 años de edad, los mayores estudian en colegio y  escuela. Su esposo es chofer y trabaja en un bus de transporte.
Doña Jenny con la finalidad de obtener sus propios ingresos y aprovechando sus conocimientos en corte y confección puso en su casa un pequeño taller de costura, allí ella se dedica a confeccionar todo tipo de ropa, también en su casa tiene un local en el cual vende aceites y todo tipo de lubricantes para carros. Trabaja todos los días y sus hijos le ayudan en el local cuando tiene muchas prendas que coser, lleva 4 años con su local y con su taller más de 15 años.
Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar lubricantes, telas y otros materiales de costura. Es socia fundadora del Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le  brinda el Banco. Sus sueños son darles la mejor educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Every fortnight, the members of the credit group 3 De Septiembre gather at the Colon parish, in San Ignacio, at the city of Portoviejo. It is a place known by its hardworking people, dedicated to agriculture and stockbreeding. 

In this place lives Jenny, who is 40 years old, married and has three children, ages 17, 13 and 7. The eldest children attend to school. Her husband is a driver and works driving a bus.

With the objective of having her own income, and making the most of her knowledge in dressmaking, she established a small sewing workshop at her own house. There she makes all kinds of clothes. 

Also at her house, she has a shop where she sells oils and all kinds of car lubricants. She works everyday and her children help her at the shop when she has a lot of garments to sew. She has had her shop for 4 years, and her sewing workshop for 15 years.

This new loan will be used to buy lubricants, fabric, and other sewing materials. She is a founder of the credit group, and she likes it because of all the help that she gets from such bank. Her dream is to give her children the best possible education.

loans.use: to buy lubricants, fabric and other sewing materials.

loans.name: Rusilly

texts.en: Rusilly signed up for her membership with PMPC and obtained the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to her. Rusilly is able to make good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of the good turn-out of business. Recently, she took a loan to restock her store with basic commodities, like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a 31-year-old married man. He has five children. He describes himself to be hardworking. 

He operates a transportation service. He has been involved in this business for five years. He describes his biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations in fuel. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to repair his vehicle and purchase fuel. His business goal is to grow into a matatu (minibus) company within five years.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle and purchase fuel

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cement and iron for building his house

loans.name: Walter

texts.en:
Walter is a married man. He has four children. He describes himself to be vibrant. 

He operates a tailoring business where he makes clothes. He has been involved in this business for seven years. His business is located in a marketable area and his primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient stock. 

He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. His business goal is to have a bigger tailoring shop within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be successful. This is his first loan with SMEP Micro finance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of tailoring materials

loans.name: Pacathiaré Khaye 2 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de crédit, Pacathiaré Khaye2 est un groupe de crédit qui rassemble des femmes qui évolue dans l’agriculture. Bome est la responsable, elle est mariée et mère de famille. Avec le crédit, elle va acheter des semences d’arachide et de mil et de l’engrais pour cultiver le champ de son mari. Elle va aussi faire de la culture maraichère pour maximiser les revenus. Car elles lui permettront de gérer la dépense quotidienne du foyer.
Bome ambitionne de faire aussi de l’élevage de bœufs et de mouton, s’il voit son capital augmenter.
texts.en: The loan group Pacathiaré Khaye2 is one that is composed of women working in farming. Bome is the group’s official. She is a married mother. With this loan, she is going to purchase peanut and millet seeds and some fertilizer to cultivate her husband’s field. She is also going to have a market garden in order to maximize her revenues enabling her to manager day-to-day expenses at home. Bome’s ambition is also to raise cattle and sheep if she sees her capital increase.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer for farming

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en: Marcelina is applying for a loan of $ 600.00 to improve her business.She is married and she has five children and She is running a business in her house by selling shirt, long pants, shorts, long sleeve, short sleeve and skirt.She is making a good income from selling and She is living a town near by the main road, so many people come to buy and she is selling every day. She opened her Mini shop a year ago with her working capital of $ 400.00.Her husband a driver.

loans.use: To buy  long pants and shorts, long sleeve, short sleeve and skirt

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 61 years old and married with seven children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Erlinda is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy seeds, fertilizers, and other farm supplies.

Erlinda has been farming rice for 40 years and also earns additional income from raising pigs. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and other farm supplies

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is 36 years old and married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like face powder, facial cleanser, detergent soap, canned goods, fabric conditioner, etc., to sell.

Carmen has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from food vending.

She aspires to save enough money  to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like face powder, facial cleanser, detergent soap, canned goods, fabric conditioner, etc., to sell

loans.name: Jaime Alberto

texts.es:
Jaime es un hombre de 40 años muy trabajador y servicial que todo lo que hace es en bien de su familia y siempre procurando su bienestar.
Vive en una humilde finca en el municipio de Santafé De Antioquia, donde vive con su esposa y sus 4 hijos por los cuales ha luchado para darles una vida digna y una educación de calidad.
El se gana la vida con la compra y venta de ganado alrededor del municipio y tiene plena fe en su negocio.
Es un individuo trabajador, constante y muy amante de sus hijos.
El solicita un préstamo para capitalizar un poco mas su negocio comprando ganado y comprando algunos productos lácteos para vender alternativamente, dándole un impulso bastante bueno a su actividad sin afectar su economía de manera negativa.
El tiene la esperanza de poder encontrar ayuda en las personas de corazón solidario.
texts.en:
Jaime, age 40, is a hardworking and helpful man. Everything he does is for the good of his family, as he is always trying to provide for their welfare. Jaime lives on a modest farm in the town of Santa Fé de Antioquia with his wife and their four children. He strives to provide a decent life and a quality education for his children.

Jaime earns his living by buying and selling cattle all over town, so he places his faith in this business. He is a hardworking individual who is steadfast and extremely fond of his children. The loan he is requesting will be used to capitalize his business a bit more by purchasing cattle and also a few dairy products that he can sell on the side. This will provide an adequate boost to his business without negatively impacting his finances.

Jaime hopes to have the assistance of kind-hearted people.

loans.use: to buy cattle and a few dairy products to sell.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a married man. He has four children. He describes himself to be vibrant. 

He operates a tailoring business where he makes clothes. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a viable location and his primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient stock. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. His business goal is to have a bigger store within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be successful. This is his first loan with SMEP Micro finance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of tailoring materials

loans.name: Erick

texts.en:
Erick is a married man. He has one child. He describes himself to be vibrant. 

He operates a tailoring business where he makes clothes. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a marketable area and his primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient stock. 

He will use the Kes 15,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. His business goal is to have other business branches within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP Micro finance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of tailoring materials

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a married man. He has two children. He operates a transportation service. He has been involved in this business for three years. 

He describes his biggest business challenge to be  overcoming modern challenges. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase another vehicle.

loans.use: to purchase another vehicle

loans.name: Hamdan

texts.en: Hamdan lives in East Bandung, the capital city of West Java province. He is married and lives with three persons in the family home. Hamdan runs a small stall called "warung" that sells snacks, drinks and mobile airtime credits. He began working with Ruma about a month ago because he was interested in the income from selling mobile airtime. He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. As the business continues, Hamdan hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends. In the photo, Hamdan is standing inside his small stall.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en: Wilson raises rice crops and various kinds of vegetables within his village. He is 52 years of age, married and has seven children. Wilson aims to have a productive and profitable rice farmland. To make his goal realistic, he is seeking financial assistance of  PHP 25,000. He will use this loan to buy gasoline, fertilizer and herbicides and pay for labor costs in transplanting his rice field. He will be grateful if his requested loan is granted.

loans.use: to purchase gasoline, fertilizer and herbicides and pay for labor costs

loans.name: Phean

texts.en: Phean is a 28-year-old garment worker. She is single. Her brother is a garment worker, too. They design clothes skillfully. They live in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. They can earn approximately $10 per day. Now she would like to apply for a loan of $1,000 to buy a motorcycle to ride to work and for her family's use. This loan will make it easier for her and her family to travel anywhere. In the future, she is going to open her own shop for designing clothes.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle to ride to work and for her family's use

loans.name: Gissella Patricia

texts.es:
En San Ignacio de la  parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora y dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Grupo De Crédito 3 De Septiembre.
En este lugar vive la señora Gissella, tiene 23 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijas de  8  y 4 años que estudian en  escuela y jardín de infantes. Su esposo es agricultor.
Doña Gissella es una muy buena esposa que realiza el crédito para que su marido lo utilice en su labor,  el se dedica a la agricultura y venta de sus productos, tiene cultivos en toda época del año y actualmente tiene sembrado maíz, maní, tomate, pimiento, frutas y verduras, cuenta con  bombas para llevar el agua hasta sus cultivos, es así como el se mantiene todo el año y les da lo necesario a su familia, actualmente está por recoger los productos que sembró  a inicios del año.
Este crédito es para pago de mano de obra para la recolección de los frutos y para semillas para sembrar nuevamente.  Lleva 4 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque así su marido sale adelante con los créditos. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
In San Ignacio of the Colon territory in the city of Portoviejo, a place known for hardworking people and dedicated to agriculture and cattle raising, every 15 days the members of Grupo De Crédito 3 De Septiembre meet. This is where Gissella lives. She is 23 years old and married, and from this marriage she has two daughters ages 8 and 4 that study in elementary and preschool classes. Her husband is a farmer.

Gissella is a very good wife that is requesting the loan so her husband can utilize it in his work. He earns a living in agriculture and the sale of his products. He has crops in every season of the year, and he currently has planted corn, peanuts, tomatoes, peppers, fruits and vegetables. He uses pumps to carry water to all of his crops, and this how he supports himself all year, and gives what is necessary to his family. Currently he is getting ready to harvest the crops he planted at the beginning of the year.

This loan is to pay for the manual labor for the harvest of the fruit, and for seeds to plant again. Gissella has been in the Grupo De Crédito for 4 years, and she likes it because it helps her husband get ahead with the loans. Their dream is to give the best to their family.

loans.use: to help her husband to pay for manual labor and to buy seeds.

loans.name: Cristomomar

texts.en:
Cristomomar is 27 years of age, married, and has two children who still attending school. 

Currently, he cultivates two hectares of rice farm land and he also raises hogs within his local community. Cristomomar plans to purchase five fertilizers and insecticides to improve his rice farm land but his capital is not enough. For this reason, he is seeking for a loan of PHP10,000. He knows that, by sustaining his rice crops with proper nutrition, he could have a plentiful yield this next harvest season.

He is hoping that lenders will approve his requested loan amount. In this way, he could send his children into higher level of education and get ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer and insecticides for his farming business

loans.name: Amsardine Group

texts.fr:
Mme MARIAM est la responsable du groupe AMSARBINE. Marié, elle est mère de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé a 25ans et le moins âgé a 13ans. 02 va à l’école. 
Mme fait la restauration (riz et tô) depuis 08ans. Elle s’approvisionne  dans les grandes boutiques de son quartier. 
Elle veut s’acheter 01 sac de riz et 02 sacs de maïs pour sa cuisine.
Mme veut épargner ses bénéfices pour son activité. Elle ambitionne agrandir son activité et soutenir son mari dans les charges familiales.
texts.en:
Ms. MARIAM is the official of the group AMSARBINE. She is a married mother of two children. The oldest is 25 years old, and the youngest is 13. Both are in school. 

Ms. MARIAM has been in the restaurant business (rice and “tô” [a starchy porridge or ball of dough]) for eight years. She gets her supplies from the big shops in her district. She wants to purchase a sack of rice and 2 sacks of corn for cooking. She wants to save her profits for her business. Her ambition is to expand her business and to support her husband in covering family expenses.

loans.use: to purchase a sack of rice and 2 sacks of corn for cooking in her restaurant

loans.name: Irma Mariela

texts.es:
Irma de 24 años de edad,  estudio hasta noveno grado, la falta de motivación la llevo a no seguir la escuela, está acompañada, su pareja se dedica a la agricultura, ambos son los responsable de la manutención de sus dos hijos quienes están pequeños, el menor tiene 6 meses y el otro 4 años, nadie más vive con ellos.

Ella tiene un puesto en el mercado, vende pan horneado a una señora, quien lo hace y ella lo vende, está en un punto céntrico donde circula bastante gente, tiene 4 años de dedicarse a la actividad, ella es una mujer emprendedora, con la actividad que realiza contribuya a la economía del país. Analizando ella lo que faltaba que vendieran en el mercado se dio cuenta que no había un puesto de venta de pan, por lo que tomo la decisión de innovar dando este paso importante, también tiene negocio propio donde hace pasteles, panes con pollo etc. El recorrido que realiza es de un kilómetro la que es su ruta de venta, nadie más se involucra en el negocio. Su horario de ventas es de 8 am a  3 pm. Es importante mencionar que Irma esta adquiriendo microcrédito cada 20 días, por lo que se le está tramitando siempre que lo solicita. Se ve la mejoría que ha tenido y el crecimiento económico y comercial que está teniendo.

El préstamo sera invertido en la adquisición de una vajilla para la cocina, la que le servirá para preparar su venta, la que realiza todos los días, la mejora que el préstamo hará es que Irma pueda continuar su negocio.

Los sueños que tiene son poder crecer siempre en las ventas y con eso tener mejores ingresos, con lo que podrá cubrir sus necesidades y las de su familia. Las ganancias serán invertidas en el pago de la cuota y ampliar el negocio.
texts.en:
Irma is 24 years old and studied through the ninth grade. She did not continue her studies because she lacked the motivation. Irma is in a relationship and her partner works in agriculture. Both of them are responsible for supporting their two children who are still small. The younger child is six months old and the other one is four years old. No one else lives with them.

Irma has a stall at the market where she sells baked bread that is prepared by another lady. Her business is situated in a central location where there is adequate foot traffic. She has been in this business for four years and is an enterprising woman. Through this business, she hopes to contribute to the national economy. Irma came to the conclusion that the market lacked a place that sold bread, so she took an important step and decided to open her own business. She also sells pastries, chicken sandwiches, and other products. Her delivery route for making sales measures one kilometer. No one else is involved in her business. Irma’s work schedule is from 8:00 A.M. to 3:00 P.M. It is important to mention that Irma submits a loan request every 20 days, so she always has an application that is being processed. She is able to see the improvements she has made and has experienced both financial and sales growth.

Her loan will be invested in a set of dishes for her kitchen, which will be used for preparing the products that she sells every day. The improvements that result from this loan will allow Irma to continue her business.
