Her dreams are to continue growing her sales and to have more income, which will help to cover her family’s needs. Irma’s profits will be invested in her loan payments and the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to buy a set of dishes for her kitchen.

loans.name: Mariana

texts.en:
Mariana ia applying for a loan of $600.00 to improve her business, and this is her first loan. She will use the loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in her store such as pants, shorts, long sleeves, short sleeves, skirts and sport clothes for kids.

Mariana opened her mini shop in 2010 with her own working capital of $200.00. She is earning a good income, and she will use the income to support her family and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy pants, shorts, long sleeves, short sleeves, skirts and sport clothes for kids

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia is 31 years old and married with two children.

Emilia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy more items like feeds, rice, snack foods, detergent soap, canned goods, etc., to sell.

Emilia has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

Emilia aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more items like feeds, rice, snack foods, detergent soap, canned goods, etc., to sell

loans.name: Zarrina

texts.ru: Заррина 35 летняя жительница маленького района Хамадони. Зарина замужем за учителя английского языка. У нее две дочки. Заррина нигде не работала и много времени проводила занимаясь исключительно домашними делами и ухаживала за детьми. Ее дети подросли и теперь у нее много времени. Заррина решила найти источник дохода, чтобы покрыть растущие расходы семьи, помочь мужу обеспечить жену и детей. Заррина начала учиться шить и кроить национальные женские платья. Такая деятельность принесла бы ней хороший доход. Но только у нее нет швейной машинки. Она просит кредит для купли швейной машинки, чтобы начать бизнес и принести новый источник дохода в семью.
texts.en: Zarrina is a 35-year-old resident of a small district of Hamadoni. Zarrina is married to an English-language teacher. She has two daughters. Zarrina never worked anywhere and spent a lot of time exclusively involved in household work and caring after her children. Her children have grown up and now she has a lot of time. Zarrina decided to find a source of income in order to cover regular family expenses and help her husband to provide for his wife and children. Zarrina began to learn how to cut and sew national women's dresses. This business could bring her a good income, but she does not have a sewing machine. She is requesting this loan to purchase a sewing machine in order to start her business and create a new source of income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine in order to start her business and create a new source of income for the family

loans.name: Hamayil

texts.en:
Hamayil is 52 years old, married and lives in her own home with her husband and children. For the past 12 years she has run a furniture store located near the center of the city in a very busy area, and she has many customers. She supplies furniture from local fabricators, then sells it in her furniture store. Her monthly income is 215 AZN (Azerbaijani new manat). 

The furniture in the store has old designs and because of this, the sales are not profitable. Demand from people for new designs of furniture is very high. She needs to supply new kinds and designs of furniture from another city. For this reason, she needs a loan 1,200 AZN in order to organize and supply new furniture from another city. This will increase her sales income and help her to cover family demand.

loans.use: to organize and supply new furniture from another city.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 46-year-old married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a taxi service where she provides transport. She has been involved in this business for eight years. Her primary customers are local. 

She will use the 20,000 Kenyan shillings loan to expand her taxi business. She hopes that in the future, she will excel in her business.

loans.use: to expand her taxi business

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 43 years old and married with three children.

Leonora works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Leonora has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

Leonora aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Yasin

texts.en: Yasin is a repeat customer and resident of Kyarihuga in Ntungamo district. His major activity is farming, especially coffee. He is applying for loan of 1,500,000 Uganda shillings. He wants to use the money to buy mulch to improve the quality of his coffee plantation. He has been challenged by low productivity within his farming production due to poor farming methods. His prime target is to yield high output from his plantations, and also to take his children to better schools in the country. But he is limited by capital and funds to enable him to achieve his target. With this loan, he believes his production will improve and his family's lifestyle will be better. He is pictured with his wife.

loans.use: To buy mulch

loans.name: Arcelie

texts.en:
Arcelie is 44 years old, married and had two children. Arcelie and her spouse are farmers. They get income from planting and harvesting corn to sell. In the farming business, they usually gain just enough income for the sustenance of the family. 

She wants to keep improving their farming practices and keep gaining income for the family. She is now asking for a loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos. She will buy insecticides and herbicides to use in farming that will help improve growth and nutrition to the crops. 

She will continue producing good crops and achieve business development for her family's welfare someday.

loans.use: to buy insecticides and herbicides to use in farming

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is aged 54, married and blessed with two children. She has owned and operated a retail store in her village for almost five years and earns a net income of 300 PHP (Philippines pesos) daily. Her net income on this business is usually spent on their electric bills. 

Due to insufficient capital for her business, she would like to avail a loan amounting to 20,000 PHP to purchase coffee, soft drinks, beverages, sugar, canned goods and breads to sell. She's hoping that her business will continue to grow and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase coffee, soft drinks, beverages, sugar, canned goods, and breads to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional stock of rice

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta is 58 years old and married with seven children.

Marietta works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

Marietta has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

Marietta aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Joaquina

texts.es: Joaquina: Es una mujer amable y luchadora, originaria de Puerto Cabezas, tiene 34 años de edad, casada, tiene 3 hijos menores de edad. Su esposo trabaja como buzo.  Cuenta con una experiencia de más de 5 años de ser docente. Desde hace 13 años habita en una casa de madera, con el propósito de cambiar la madera, solicita su segundo financiamiento, para comprar materiales: maderas, clavos, zinc y cubrir cotos de mano de obra. Desde hace 13 años vive en una casa de madera de tambo. Su sueño es tener una vivienda segura y cómoda para su familia.
texts.en: Joaquina is a friendly and determined woman, originally from Puerto Cabezas, 34 years old, married and has three young children. Her husband works as a diver. She has more than 5 years of experience as a teacher. For 13 years she has been living in a house made of wood. With the objective of changing the wood, she requests a second loan to buy materials: wood, nails, zinc, and to cover the costs of labor. For 13 years she has lived in a wooden stilt home. Her dream is to have a safe and comfortable house for her family.

loans.use: to change the wood of her home

loans.name: Cyrus

texts.en: Cyrus is a 29-year-old married man. He has two children with ages ranging from three to seven years old. He operates a tire business. His primary customers are commercial motorists. He describes his biggest business challenge to be financing. He will use the loan to purchase additional stock of tires to expand his business. His business goal is to operate a wholesale tire company within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be able to manage bills and expenses from the profits of his business and improve the quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of tires to expand his business

loans.name: Raily Velentin

texts.es: Raily: Es un hombre luchador, tiene 55 años de edad, casado, tiene 5 hijos, en edad escolar.  Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos desde hace varios años estableció una pulpería y carnicería, gracias a las ganancias percibidas en su negocio le han permitido diversificar sus productos, dedicándose también a la comercialización de mariscos. Solicita su primer financiamiento para comprar herramientas y combustibles para salir a bucear y capturar mariscos y venderlos a precios accesibles.  Su sueño es tener un negocio prospero.
texts.en:
Raily is a married man and a fighter. He has five school-age children. 

With the intention of having his own source of income, he started a grocery store and butcher shop. Thanks to the income received from his business, he's been able to diversify his products, also earning a living through the sale of seafood. 

He's seeking his first loan to buy tools and fuel to go diving and catch seafood to sell at accessible prices. His dream is to have a prosperous business.

loans.use: to buy tools and fuel to go diving and catch seafood.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 37 years old and married with two children.

Marites works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock like rice, canned foods, soft drinks, detergent soap, shampoo, etc. to sell.

Marites has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and earns additional income from raising pigs.

Marites aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stock like rice, canned foods, soft drinks, detergent soap, and shampoo to sell

loans.name: Triyadi

texts.en: Triyadi runs a small stall selling snacks, drinks, and mobile phone airtime credits. He lives north of Bogor, a semi-urban area about two hours from Jakarta. Triyadi is married and living with four people in the family home. His two children are going to school, and his wife helps him run the small stall. He began working with Ruma a month ago because he wanted to increase his income. He feels really excited to expand and develop his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. As the business runs, Triyadi hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile airtime credit transactions on weekends

loans.name: Sol De Cultura Y Progreso Group

texts.es: El grupo “Sol de Cultura y Progreso” conformado por 05 socios progresistas. Laura de 40 años de edad es casada y tiene 02 hijos dependientes. Hace más de 01 año que Laura se dedica a la compra y venta de calzados. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de zapatos, zapatillas y sandalias. El deseo de Laura es crecer en su negocio cada día. El grupo “Sol de Cultura y Progreso” agradece a todos los inversionistas Kiva por el Apoyo brindado. Laura es la primera del lado derecho y viste polo morado con chaleco negro.
texts.en:
The group “Sol de Cultura y Progreso” (Sun of Culture and Progress) consists of five progressive members. Laura is 40 years old, married, and has two dependent children. For more than a year, she has been buying and selling shoes. She is requesting a loan in order to buy shoes, slippers, and sandals. Laura wants to grow her business each day.

The group “Sol de Cultura y Progreso” appreciates all of the Kiva lenders for the support they have provided. In the photo, Laura is the first person on the right, wearing a purple pullover shirt and a black vest.

loans.use: to buy shoes, slippers, and sandals.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora 2 Group

texts.es:
19 son las mujeres que integran este grupo, están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, que les permitirá poder trabajar en las debilidades de cada una y conforme a ello poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Modesta es parte de este grupo, ella es una persona muy trabajadora, que se unió al grupo con el afán de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia, ella se dedica a la costura, hace todo tipo de prendas y confecciones, este es el medio de sustento de su familia, es por eso que pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas, hilos, gomas y demás, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo, luchando por mejorar.
texts.en:
There are 19 women in this group which participates in the poverty elimination program that will allow them to work on each one's weak points and improve their living conditions.

Modesta is one of the members and she is a very hard worker.  She joined the group in an effort to improve her and her family's lifestyle.  She is a seamstress and makes all kinds fo clothing and sewn goods.  This the source of income for her family so she is requesting a loan to buy fabrics, thread, elastic and other supplies to continue working and struggling to improve.

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread, elastic and other supplies.

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es:
Tomasa hoy tiene 64 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora que lucha por poder seguir ganándose el sustento, para poder darse una vejez digna al lado de su esposo, que es su compañero. Comenta que con su préstamo anterior pudo comprar prendas para la venta, lo que le fue de mucha ayuda.
Hoy pide un nuevo préstamo para poder invertirlo en comprar ropas y calzados deportivos, agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo y estudiando.
texts.en:
Tomasa is now 64 years old and works very hard to continue earning a living so she can have a decent old age alongside her husband.  She says that with the previous loan she was able to buy clothing to sell, so it was very helpful.

Now she is requesting a new loan to buy clothing and sport shoes.  She is grateful for the opportunity to continue growing and studying.

loans.use: To buy clothing and sport shoes.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es: José de 31 años de edad vive con su compañera de vida y su mamá. Él es un hombre trabajador que se gana la vida como instalador de cielos falsos, ventanas y puertas de vidrio desde hace 13 años. José desea construir un muro de contención lo antes posible en su vivienda por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar arena, cemento, grava, ladrillo, hierro y pagar mano de obra para la construcción del muro de contención en su vivienda.
texts.en:
José is 31 years old and lives with his life companion and his mother. He has been earning his living the past 13 years by installing drop ceilings, windows, and glass doors.

José wants to build a retaining wall for his home as soon as possible. Therefore, he is requesting a loan from FUSAI in order to buy sand, cement, gravel, bricks, and iron. He will also pay for labor so that the retaining wall for his home can be built.

loans.use: to buy construction materials and pay for labor in order to build a retaining wall.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
La Sra. Claudia tiene 39 años y está casada con el sr. Bernardo de 79 años. Tienen 4 hijas de las cuales 2 ya están casadas y tienen sus respectivas familias. Las demás están estudiando y esforzándose para poder seguir sus vidas.
La Sra. Claudia se dedica a la venta de hielos y refrescos varios, tiene una muy buena clientela que siempre compra de ella todo lo que vende.
Comenta que pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de un congelador ya que también desea vender bebidas como gaseosas y cervezas, ya que un gran potencial para poder seguir mejorando sus ingresos y condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Claudia, 39, is married to Bernardo, 79.  They have four daughters and two of them are married and have their own families.  The others attend school and work hard to continue with their lives.

Claudia sells ice and a variety of soft drinks.  She has many customers who always buy everything she sells.  She says she will use the loan to buy a refrigerator because she also wants to sell sodas and beer in an effort to continue improving her income and lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Virgen Del Carmen Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama Virgen del Carmen está en su décimo ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde seis de las dieciocho señoras se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza.
Una de ellas es la señora Marta, quien en su encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno. Para poder ayudar a la señora, la misma está siendo capacitada en hacer productos de limpieza quien aparte de ser limpiadora podrá tener un ingreso extra y seguir mejorando sus condiciones de vida por medio de su esfuerzo.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de insumos para hacer productos de limpieza, y de esa forma poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The communal bank is called "Virgen del Carmen" and it is in its tenth women's program loan cycle.  All the members are participating in the poverty elimination survey which shows that six of the 18 members are below the poverty line.

One of the members is Marta who is at level one on the survey.  She is being helped by receiving training in making cleaning products, which will give her additional income to her work as a cleaner.  

The loan is to buy supplies to make cleaning products so she can continue the work she is doing and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy supplies to make cleaning products.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en: Lilian is a 22-year-old single woman. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a food stall where she sells tomatoes, omena, and maize. She describes her biggest business challenges to be the poor road network and changing seasons. She will use the KES 10,000 loan to purchase additional stock to expand her business. She hopes that in the future, she can expand her business. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to expand her business.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 25-year-old married father of one child. He is a Palestinian refugee who works hard for his family's living and development.
Mohamad works in the construction business specializing in sanitary work. He has been a well-known plumber since 2005. His work is going on just fine, since he works in an old region and almost every house needs continuous maintenance to stay in good condition.

Mohamad is acquiring a Youth loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy new updated newly released machines necessary for his business development. He hopes to expand his working zone and wishes to open a shop where he can sell sanitary products, if possible, since his current business is mobile with no set locations. He provides his services on the spot.

loans.use: To buy new updated machines necessary for his business development

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
El Sr. Miguel tiene 27 años, está casada y tiene 2 hijos, él como su esposa se dedican a la venta de frutas y verduras desde hace 7 años, lo realizan en forma ambulante por zonas aledañas a la ciudad donde viven.
Es una persona muy trabajadora que lucha por poder dar a su familia todo y que no tengan que pasar por ningún tipo de necesidades como las que él tuvo que pasar.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de frutas por cajas como peras, manzanas, bananas, tomates y otros, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas, luchando por mejorar.
texts.en:
Miguel, 27, is married and has two children.  He and his wife have been selling fruit and vegetables for seven years, working as street vendors in areas of the city where they live.

He is a very hard working person who struggles to give his family everything they need so they do not have to go without anything like he had to.

The loan he is requesting is to buy cases of fruit such as pears, apples, bananas, tomatoes and other fruit.  This is so he can continue his sales and strive to improve.

loans.use: To buy cases of fruit such as pears, apples, bananas, tomatoes, etc.

loans.name: Alba Nelly

texts.es: Alba es una señora muy trabajadora, ella se dedica a la crianza de chanchos  desde hace 20 años atrás, Alba tiene 37 años de edad,  vive con su esposo que es cuidador de una oficina, y con sus 3 hijos de 10, 15 y 17 años de edad que se encuentran estudiando, Alba va a invertir el crédito en la compra de chanchos para incrementar en sus chancheras, Alba aspira que su negocio progrese para cubrir los gastos de educación de sus hijos y que en un futuro lleguen a tener un titulo universitario.
texts.en:
Alba is a hard working woman who has been raising pigs for 20 years.  She is 37 years old and lives with her husband who is an office janitor, and her three children, ages 10, 15 and 17 who attend school.

Alba plans to use the loan to buy pigs to expand her business.  She aspires to a successful business to cover the education costs of her children so they can obtain a university degree.

loans.use: To buy pigs.

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en: Millicent is a married woman. She has six children. She describes herself as optimistic. She operates a retail store where she sells mattresses, cushions, and covers. She has been involved in this business for two years. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low stock. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase additional materials for her store. Her business goal is to see her store grow within five years. She hopes that in the future, she may use the money generated from her business to educate her children. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her store

loans.name: Fadia

texts.en: Fadia is a 42-year-old Lebanese single woman living with her mother. She has been working for two years selling homemade food from her house in order to help her mother and cooperate to collect enough money to be able to pay the heavy living expenses. Today, Fadia is applying to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase merchandise for her business in order to improve it. She is very positive about her future and wishes to ameliorate her lifestyle.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her business

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business selling ready to wear clothing in the Philippines.

Aileen requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of ready to wear to sell.

She has been in this business for six years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Aileen would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ready to wear clothing to sell

loans.name: Judit

texts.en:
A 600 USD loan is offered to Judit to improve her business. She opened her kiosk in 2010 with her own working capital. She will use the loan to buy gasoline and diesel. Judit is generating a good income from selling.

She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business. Judit is living in a town with her family.

loans.use: to buy gasoline and diesel.

loans.name: Faraja Grp Group

texts.en:
Philiphilina is a mother of one schooling kid while the rest are grown. She is in her early 50s and married. She has been supporting her family by managing a business selling charcoal, a business she has been doing since 2000. Philiphilina needs to improve her business by owning a big store, where she can store more sacks of charcoal and meet customer's demands. To meet her ambition, she joined Faraja group, with two members to seek financial support via Tujijenge Tanzania. The members of the group will hold each other accountable to repay the loan. She works from 7 am to 6 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly return. 

This is her fifth loan request, which she will use to buy more sacks of charcoal to resell. She dreams of expanding her portfolio by opening a successful shop. Philiphilina used the previous loans, since repaid, to keep her business stock stable (she bought sacks of charcoal). With the good job she has done, she earned extra income, which she used to cover part of the school fees and home expenses. Philiphilina is so thankful with everyone who takes the time to go through her story and support.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Latofat

texts.en: Latofat was born in 1965. She is a hard-working and industrious woman. Latofat is married. She brings up four children. Latofat’s husband is a migrant in Russia. She began her own business activity in 2005. She sells children's clothes in a local market. Latofat works from early morning every day. She tries for the well-being of her family. She is a repeated client of IMON and she used her previous loans for increasing her business. Latofat has a good credit story and makes payment on time. Now she is asking for a loan of 6,000 Somoni to buy children's clothes for increasing working capital. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy children's clothes for increasing working capital.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti operates a retail shop business selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. The previous loan helped her to boost her business and now it is growing. However, she faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour to sell in her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour to sell
